1122.content:
Helga grumbled to herself as she hammered away at her damaged armor. The molten giant she had been fighting during the raid had sent her flying into the wall and cracked her equipment. Her raid leader wasn't too happy, her being one of the tanks in the group.

"Stupid giants," she cursed. "Stupid Alfas. Damn night elf has an advantage..."

Helga was a dwarf warrior, and a short one at that. Her fiery red hair was done up in two long braids, keeping it out of her way while she fought. She was well geared, with the best plate equipment her money could buy for the raids in Molten Core. But, for some reason, every time she tried to tank she would get sent flying by the larger creatures in the lava-filled caves.

"Hey Helga," said the human mage leader of her raid, Valonos. "Oof. Heavy repair bill?"

"Those giants are going to be the death of me," Helga sighed as she dropped her anvil's hammer to ground. "Sometimes it sucks being a dwarf, Valonos. I'm a pint-sized ball of metal that the monsters can knock around like a toy ball. You don't see Alfas having any problems."

The mage chuckled and leaned on his staff. "True. You are quite short."

"Thanks fer noticing..." Helga let a little bit of her accent slip out. "By the ancestors, I wish I was just a little bigger. Maybe then I can actually do my job in the raid as a tank."

"Well, if you're looking for some help in that department, you can always try the guild alchemist...Or maybe I can assist in that. There's also that creepy warlock fellow, Dagon, if you want something risky."

Helga decided to...

11223.content:
Helga stumbled through the streets of Ironforge, heading for the darker sections of the city in the back of the massive cave capital. Near the underground lake was where the shadier sort of people lingered, namely the rogues and warlocks. Helga kept to her torch as she wandered along the decrepit houses, looking for the apartment that belonged to the new guild warlock, Dagon.

She found it at last and shuffled inside.

"Can I help you?" asked a human in the back of the hovel with a black cloak and fel aura.

"Dagon Darkheart?"

"Who wants to know?" the warlock looked up, revealing his missing eye.

"Name's Helga. Helga the Heavy."

"Ah, yes. You're the tank who kept getting sent flying in last night's raid."

Helga crossed her arms and grunted. "Thanks fer noticing. I'm actually here about a solution to that problem. Can't tank if I can't keep my feet on the ground."

"Too true. It's hard enough keeping track of curses, let alone have to deal with an angry giant when he should be attacking you. But what can I as a humble servant of darkness do for you?"

"Simple. I need you to inbiggin me."

"Inbiggin you?"

"Make me bigger. Taller. Weighter. I don't care what, but I need more mass if I'm going to tank for our raid."

"Mmm. True," the warlock tapped his chin in thought. "I think I have just the things. Come."

He led her to the back of his room, where there was a black chest. He leaned over and produced two objects that emitted their own sinister air.

"What is it?"

"This," he held up a necklace with a large red gem. "Is the Amulet of Absorption. Upon wearing it and pressing your palm against an entity, you will begin to drain their life force and add it to your own. I can alter the draining effect to be physical mass instead of life force."

Helga thought about draining an unsuspecting victim of all their height and weight. She knew a few elves who could stand to be knocked down to size.

"This," he gestured to the other object in his hand, a large pouch. "Is fel powder. It empowers a user with dark energy, giving them more demonic appearance but also expanding their size."

The dwarf pondered what she would look like with horns like a demon. She knew the dangers of making deals with demons, but if it meant more power she might be willing to take the risk.

"What do you want in exchange for one of these things?"

"Honestly? Passing on loot would be fine with me. But choose carefully, I'll only part with one of these things."

Helga decided...

"That amulet sounds less...Evil," Helga decided out loud. "I'll take that."

"A fine choice," chuckled Dagon. "Just, uh, try not to use it on anyone you know personally. It could lead to some big problems."

But Helga wasn't listening as she stepped out the door, staring into the heart of the ruby like it was a giant apple. She stumbled out of the cave district of Ironforge into the more crowded, but still largely empty, halls.

"Hmm," the dwarf tossed the gem in the air a few times before tying it around her neck. "I don't feel that different."

She recalled the instructions given to her by Dagon and looked for her first victim.

Many people in the city were gathered in their own clusters of groups, so Helga had to focus on those who were off alone in the corners of the great halls. Her eyes wandered to one particular woman between the building crafting something. She was a low level priest, from the looks of it, and a human. From a glance, Helga guessed she was doing that silly cloth quest for the quartermaster.

"Hey there," Helga said, with a surprising amount of enthusiasm. "Can I help you?"

The young priest jumped. "Oh, hi! Am I in the way? Sorry. I'm just trying to get enough money for my first mount."

"Oh, boy," Helga rolled her eyes. "I remember my first mount. But you know, you're not going to earn much doing that stupid quest."

The rogue frowned. "Oh."

"Tell you what," Helga reached into her pocket to produce a few gold. "Want to earn some easy money?"

"That depends. What am I doing?"

"Smart girl. I just need to borrow a bit of your height."

"My height?"

"Just a foot for starters. What do you say?"

The priest rubbed her chin and shrugged. "Sure. I mean, it won't really matter when I'm healing, right?"

"Not at all," said Helga with a smile. "Now hold still."

The dwarf warrior pressed her palm on the priest's arm as the necklace began to glow. Helga noticed that the human seemed to be getting smaller and her robes were starting to appear a little too big on her. Conversely, she could feel her armor tightening. The dwarf's eyes widened in surprise as her already large breasts billowed out of the neck opening of her chestpiece.

Conversely, the priest looked diminished, with even her breasts seeming less well endowed. Though, she was still taller than Helga, if only barely. Despite feeling like canned food trapped in her armor, Helga felt really good and powerful. It was like she had been given a blessing of fortitude.

"A pleasure doing business with you," said Helga as she paid the priest her due.

'Yeah," replied the human girl, adjusting to the fact as how big the gold looked to her with her lost height. "Sure..."

Helga bumbled through Ironforge, content with her new view. Things looked so much smaller now and she felt strong. Fat poked out of the cracks in her plate armor as she walked proudly down the street.

"I could get used to this," she giggled as new parts of her attempted to jiggle free of her armor. "Might need to improve the fit of this though."

As the cake reached her mouth and bit into the Pie, and as good as the Pie was, it seemed a bit too good. But Ryhane dismissed this, and finished the slice. She gained a bump on her belly, not noticeable unless she'd removed her robes.
"There. Just one slice, and I'll save the rest for..." But she was cut off by her stomach growling again. "This is just weird, now... did that cupcake do something to...?"
But before she could finish her thought, her belly roared in hunger, causing her to ignore common sense and just dive into the Pie.

After she was finished, she noticed how much she gained from the strange event. As well as the huge mess she made... but her hunger was sated for the moment.
"I'd better figure out what happened, before it happens again..." Ryhane sighed, as she summoned a magic broom to clean up the splatters and crumbs.

Unbeknownst to her, the cup cake went to work on fulfilling it's original purpose, which she failed to realize. Time passes faster than she'd realized, a good few hours spent browsing the near endless tome for something good. "I am Aemillien, and I've written a few books in the past and decided to write a segment for this small book! This is a special spell, one you'll not find in any of my other books. So, I hope you're prepared, because this will be a long one. Oh, silly me, I forgot to mention what spell this is! This spell is unique, as it will have three different effects, at complete random! What are the effects? Well, I'll let you figure that out yourself. One of the best parts of the Arcane is experiencing what you don't know. Anyway, back to the spell..."


Ryhane prepared, and channeled the spell. Each time not doing so well, but she managed to get it down eventually.
When she did, her eyes and hands glowed a dark crimson, Ryhane losing all control of her body. As this happened, she levitated into the air, the reality of her room warping and distorting into impossible shapes and angles.
She was then forcefully dropped from her elevated state, and had a throbbing head- and stomach-ache.
"Ooohh... Blood Elf Magic is so intense..." Ryhane moaned as she picked herself up. That's when she began experiencing the first effect...

This was fantastic, and easily her favorite new spell. Her stomach growled just looking at it, licking her lips in the direction of the platter of seemingly fresh out the oven treats.

What was once extremely loose, was now hugging her new curves, the hem riding up her thick thighs. Once outside, she cast a levitation spell, she knew exactly where she was headed. The mage district had a suitable store just a few streets down from the tower.

As the red mist swirled around her, Ryhane felt... different. She didn't know if it was the right kind of different, given her situation. Her feet landed back on the ground, the mist flowing back out. When it was all cleared, Ryhane looked down eagerly, only to be horribly disappointed. Her breast and midsection were very much still fat. Her face shrunk up in a face of irritation. "Okay, that was bound to work." She pinched at her round tire of a muffin-top. She sat on her bed in defeat, "Ughh, there's no end! Why can't I just fix my mistake as quick as I made it?" She looked up at the ceiling of her home... an odd sensation building up in her stomach....

She sat up, curious and frightened at the same time, "Maybe it just needed time to settle in?" She puled up her new tunic to take a look. "Hmmm..." Ryhane inspected it, but nothing appeared to have changed, her stomach still soft, jiggly, and round. She poked at her deep navel, "Helloooo?" She questioned, as if talking to her stomach. She crinkled her brow, she felt... full, like she had just eaten a winterveil dinner. *Hiccup!* That was odd, she didn't have anything to eat... her stomach grew a bit taut, as if she was being invisibly fed. Her confusion turned to panic, "No-no-no-no.." her hands gripping either side of her 'food stuffed' gut.

Ryhane thought it was over, but whatever that spell did, it wasn't right. She belched loudly, still feeling like she's being stuffed with a heavy meal. Whatever was going on, it had to let up soon, she felt like she was at the end of her limits. And just as she thought she was going to burst, it stopped. "Phew..." but it wasn't over, Ryhane felt a warmth cover her body while the stuffed feeling dissipated. She looks back down in horror, her belly growing wider and outward in her lap, causing her shirt to ride up it's growing expanse. She was powerless, she could feel every curve growing chubbier, her plump rear getting wider below her. The warmth slipped away just as quickly as it came, the elf left a good hundred pounds heavier.

"Woaah.. that was wild." She muttered, still collecting her thoughts, when she noticed the Wand floating midair, with a line aimed directly at her belly spawning from the tip of the Wand.

A new warmth even covered her cheeks and face, rimming her slim jawline with a layer of cute pudge. Her shirt was acting more like a bra at this point, the buttons popping off to contain her growing chest. Ryhane's belly was on full display, her hefty tire soft and round. Her thighs became best friends, growing thick and rubbing together as her butt struggled to keep up, somehow staying pert and heart shaped.

Before she knew it, the gain faded, leaving her wide eyed and able to move again. 11413211212111311111211211212121121.content:
Ryhane was closing in on Dire Maul, just a bit further and she could find an end to this. Her wand reverberated a deep light inside her travel bag, gleaming out the top flap through the slips up top. She wasn't paying any mind to it, as it hasn't caused any issues on her journey quite yet, and she didn't want to fiddle with it earning a bolt of fattening magic. She trotted down the broken cobblestone path with a pep in her (hefty) step. Ryhane was excited to learn what she could about this wand, it's even in one of the greatest elven cities ever made! She almost skipped down the path in giddy joy.

Ryhane passed through the ancient woods, starting to see the ancient ruins off in the distance. However, as she walked past a runestone of some sort, her bag gave a loud chime, a pleasant note, but unexpected. Another chime was heard from behind her, as if in answering. Ryhane twirled around to investigate, only to be met with even more chiming runestones. An entire ring was circling the path, the ancient stones continuing their little song. "I need to take some notes!" She scribbled down on her notepad quickly, marking her location on the map, she decided it'd be time for off road exploration after she's in good shape again. As she continued down the path, she was met with a force holding her back, just as the wand did. She tried another path, but again, anywhere leaving the ring blocked her off.

Ryhane panicked, something wasn't right about this, she up the flap on her bag and pulled out the wand. It was bigger than before and more intricate, it radiated more power, perhaps absorbing some of the ancient rune's power... in any case it levitated back out of her hand, "Oi, get back here... you!" She shouted trying to grab the wand before it has the chance to do anything. There was nothing she could do but jump up and down, but it didn't do anything but set her whole body jiggling. The wand charged up again like before, pointing the end straight at the night elf. She threw her arms up as if pleading with it, but it was too late, a powerful beam struck into her belly at a constant stream, the crimson energy from her first spell pouring straight inside her. This time didn't feel the same though, it was warmer and worked faster. Within mere moments, the pounds were piling onto her already bulky frame. Inches were being added everywhere, she watched on in terror, but she couldn't take it, it was too intense and the elf passed out cold, falling down on her plump rear...

The birds chirped loudly all around her, but the chiming of the runestones seemed to have ceased. Whatever this ancient trap was, it effectively stopped her. The warble of a distant songbird kept her company as she waited. "I suppose I can take a few notes..." Ryhane gave a long sigh, this day really wasn't going well." She may as well make the best of it and occupy herself, rather than wait however long it was going to take with nothing to do.

As she was taking notes, the sound f conversation was heard behind her, 4 maybe 5 voices. Her elf ears twitching to see where exactly it was coming from. They were close, just down the road, but with the drone of the wildlife, it was hard to tell what language they were speaking...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111.title: Wait for rescue

choices: Her plan failed, and she was found by the Hordies.
The spell worked, and she successfully eluded the baddies!
11413211212111311111211211212121121111.content:
Ryhane listened in on their conversation, as it seemed they were busy discussing something else aside from the immobile elf in their vicinity.

"Face it, numbskull, ya got us lost again!" A goblin's voice criticized.
"It's not my fault that this map is so hard to navigate..." A forsaken's voice retorted.
"You're both incompetent morons!" An irritated Orc's voice roared, "Why don't you two do something useful and scout the area? I need a rest from you two's constant bickering..."

Ryhane got all the information she needed before their voices began to trail off in opposite directions, but it wouldn't be long before they found Ryhane. She wasn't hidden very well..
"Oh, no..." Ryhane gasped, "What'll I do to hide... this?" She whispered, gesturing towards her massive gut.
She then had a great idea, she remembered a spell that might be useful in this situation, so she used what little arcane energy she had left within her, and casted an invisibility spell (Max. duration 10 minutes) before anyone noticed. Hopefully, they would be gone before it expired.

As the Goblin and Forsaken inched closer to her location, she began to sweat nervously, worrying the spell might not be enough to ignore her...
11413211212111311111211211212121121111.title: A horde party comes down the road

choices: The runestones chime their tune w/ one or both of the horde ladies inside
They pass into Dire Maul, they could be a problem later...
114132112121113111112112112121211211112.content:
Lysa held her breath, the rotting undead walking just past her. "I told you there's nothing here!" He shouted, walking further down the path. "It's all clear!" He walked through the runestones without question, signaling his compatriots to follow. Rustling in the bushes was heard, and from too separate directions, the two horde ladies emerged, the orc covered in blood, and the goblin covered in mud up to her shins.

The goblin scraped off what she could, "I hate jungles, they're absolutely disgusting!" She shouted, slowly following the undead as he impatiently tapped his foot.
"Oh shut it, kezahn is a literal trash pit." The orc grumbled, carrying her stained battleaxe. She was clad in heavy red plate armor, her thighs and midriff bear to show her iron tempered physique. The goblin was wearing a mail trimmed leather get-up to keep her light on her feet.
"Naaaa, still better than stinking Orgrimmar, yah brute." She stuck her tongue out at the orc and picked up her pace. Ryhane was really nervous, they're taking their time making it through here...
114132112121113111112112112121211211112.title: Subterfuge

choices: Beg for the strength to carry your weight from Elune.
Attempt reversing the effects of the wand.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
"We've been searching long enough. You two bring your lazy butts in here and search for the artifact, NOW!" The Orc roared at the two, as they both head in, grumbling under their breath.
Ryhane dropped the invisibility spell once she could no longer smell the Forsaken's putrid odor, and decided now was a better time than ever to find a way out.

Spells were out of the question, since she was out of Arcane Energy, and she'd left her last Arcane Crystal at home.
So, she was left with two options. Either to be granted the strength from elune to carry her enormous frame by some crazy miracle, or she could attempt to use whatever power that she could muster from to Wand to possibly reverse the effects, if only temporarily.

She pondered this, and finally decided on...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Moving on.

choices: The wand properly casts the spell
Backfired... again
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane knew Elune wouldn't be helping her in this situation, considering she should have known not to dabble in things so carelessly. Speaking of reckless, her only option left was to try a reversal spell one last time. She sat in contemplation, what would get it to work properly? She had just enough energy left in her to cast one last spell. Her levitation wouldn't work, who knows what the wand would do with that? She kept the book of nullification with her an considered one last spell.

Ryhane pulled her wand back out, "Alright, this is our last chance of getting out of this, if you mess this up, we're both stuck here for good." She waved her finger at the wand, as if telling it to behave. "I don't want any funny business or I won't mind snapping you in half." Ryhane flipped open to the page she's had dog eared, a spell on being lighter on your feet, when a burden spell is cast. It was her best bet, and it seemed to be viable here, if only to get her on her feet so she can settle it. She waved her hands over her head and chanted the spell, a yellow light bolting from her palms and into the wand's core...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Last ditch effort

choices: She finds something of interest...
She hears footsteps, could be the Horde group. Need to hide, quick!
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Expecting fully the spell to backfire, she was met with a pleasant surprise when it actually worked.
"Well, I guess you're not totally worthless after all." Ryhane told the Wand, but in a slightly aggravated tone. She slightly wanted it to backfire, just so she'd have the excuse to break it.

She made it inside the pathway to Dire Maul, searching for any clues.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Working as expected... kinda.

choices: Snoop around and follow the wand's guidance
Something odd was already inside the main room
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane looked about in wonder, the ruined city still beautiful, in it's own way of course. She followed the path the horde took, they seemed to clear well, dead ogres here and there. She let them fight ahead and clear the path, it made it safe to search her surroundings. Even if they came back this way afterwards, Ryhane would be back in fighting shape and take on all three of them without a problem (Or so she says). Along the path, she's met with buildings of all sorts, but she tried not to dally too long, the spot on her map still marked. "Whatever they found there, I've got to check it first." The walkway was still in decent shape, allowing her to cross bridges and walk on down some of the major streets. Up ahead was her destined location, Ryhane's face lighting with a grin.

The building looked to be pretty massive, perhaps a regal house of some sort once stood proud here. Ryhane tried budging the doors, but to no avail. The old stone doorways were sealed shut. But as the notebook entailed, the wand was humming softly, not as powerful or alarming as it felt back in the runestone circle. If anything it felt calming, and her answers were surely inside... She waved the wand in front of the door, using it's light to get a better look at the door. As she shone it's gentle light over the doorway, runes were seen framing the outline with what looked like a large slot that only appeared with the wand's luminance, "Aha, looks like you'll be of use after all..." Ryhane slots the wand inside, the ornate end clicking into place, the stone door swiveling open, the middle of the manor illuminated via a skylight.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: She finds something of interest...

choices: The Wand begins fattening Ryhane more than ever!
An ancient spirit has been awoken, and questions Ryhane's presence.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
The wand began glowing brightly, but instead of fattening, it began to fly slowly towards a location. Ryhane decided she could sightsee later, and she followed the Wand's path.
Deeper and deeper, the building seemed to turn less of a sprawling mansion of sorts, but a catacombs of ancient texts and oddities.
She could see certain objects illuminate when the Wand got near, their glow fading as the Wand fled further into the maze of tunnels.

Finally, the wand fell dead on the ground, in a massive, seemingly empty room. Nothing much special about it.
As Ryhane entered, she was wondering why the Wand would lead her to such a meaningless room. To her, it seemed like a lot of wasted effort.
But that's when the doors behind her closed, and she was trapped. She attempted to re-open the doors, but to no avail. The room shook with a great tremor, and she back into the center of the room, where she fell on her bottom and awaited whatever was to happen next...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Snoop around and follow the wand's guidance

choices: Option1: Rewarded with a catch
Option2: Justly Punished
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
As the room shook, an ancient hum came to life, the room starting to cover in green mist. As it settled, figures were forming, translucent, but they appeared in the silhouette of the ancient elves. Ryhane was nervous, this may be the ancient home of whomever made the wand, and they might not be happy with her, and the elves are known for being powerful, especially old magisters. The longer the spectacle went on, the more detailed each specter was, a particularly tall elf sitting in a giant regal armchair, which formed out of the ground. Whatever this place was, it had great magic sealed inside.

A voice boomed in the direction of Ryhane, under the distortion of it's spectral nature, "Why have you come here, child of the moon? And why do you have my wand?" The voice shook the walls (and Ryhane's jiggly body for that matter)
"I-I came into possession of it by accident, and it's caused me nothing but trouble since. I followed the wand back here." Her voice shook as she spoke, this is one of the very few times the elf has felt intimidated, the spectral forms coming better into focus. She looked around the room, elves of all shapes and sizes were around her, some of them lithe as was normal, but others were bloated anywhere from chubby to immobile. The elf at the head of the room stood up...

Option1: The spirit thanks Ryhane for returning the wand. Her reward is to be removed of her burden, BUT on a condition...
Option2: Ryhane is punished for her actions...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: The wand's owner

choices: The Horde Trio trust Ryhane, and follow her.
They're a bit skeptical of Ryhane, and don't trust her.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
"You have done a great service to our spirits for returning the Murtallach Wand, and for your reward, we shall release you of this burden." The head elf bellows.
"Oh, thank you, thank you..." Ryhane weeps tears of joy, knowing her long journey was nearly at an end.
"However! We cannot lift the curse from you, unless it is given to another." The head elf mentions.
"Ugh, of course. Always a catch... what do you want me to do?" Ryhane sighs.

"You must bring us... a female sacrifice. Of whom we may inject all of our fat into, and they shall become the new Protector of Murtallach, forever cursed to stay down in these Catacombs until another enters within these halls to claim the Wand." The High Elf explains.
"Is that it? Well, I think I know just who to go to..." Ryhane smirks slyly, thinking her plan genius.


Meanwhile, with the Horde Group...
"After all this searching, all we found were a few crappy medallions..." The Goblin complained.
"We've only been searching for 10 minutes, did you think some big, fat idiot's gonna just waltz up and tell us, 'Hey, I know exactly where to find a really powerful artifact!' I bet you would, because you're all stupid like that." The Orc disciplined, but as she was saying that, a large shadow loomed over her. She sighed, and looked around to see a big, fat elf in barely any clothing smiling at them.
"Let me guess..." The Orc started, obviously aggravated.

"Hey, if any of you are interested, I know where exactly where you can find a very powerful artifact!" Ryhane stated, causing the Orc to groan in displeasure.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Always a Catch

choices: Ryhane forces them to split up, only bringing one woman with her
Ryhane brings the full party to the chamber
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
"You've got to be kidding me..." The orc sat down on a fallen pillar as her compatriots gave her smug grins.
"Heh, told you sister. I knew there'd be some... ogre-elf hybrid here to tell us where the good are at." Ryhane shot the goblin an offended look, but kept her composure, she wanted to make sure the fish took the bait.
"Okay, but why're we gonna trust some overfed tree-hugger? Why didn't you take it for yourself?" The orc buried her face in her hands, still not over the laughable scenario.
"Welllll, I'm just a scholar, and I barely survived getting here." She referenced her tattered clothing. "And besides, it's a win-win. You get the artifact and I get to read my scrolls." Ryhane shrugged, "The artifact doesn't really interest me anyway, I won't be able to lug it off by myself." Ryhane put on her best dumb look and hoping for the best.
"Fiiiiine, you leaf eater, we'll follow you, but if this is a trap, you can say goodbye to that head of yours." The orc battlematron growled, standing up with a hand on her axe. "Lead the way."
Ryhane turned around and smiled, trotting her way back to the catacomb, they're absolutely clueless! The prospect of not only removing her curse, but totally ruining this baddies was enough to get her all giddy inside. As she walked, the goblin whispered to the undead rogue, "How do yah think she get's 'round like that?" Her finger pointing at Ryhane's rear end swaying back and forth, "I mean, she's gotta be HEAVY," Her hands trying to mock how large Ryhane's stomach was.
"Oh shut your traps back there," the battlemaiden groaned, "I really can't stand another minute of you two, let's just enjoy the view and get something worthwhile, how about that?"
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Follow me to your unfortunate fate!

choices: The Goblin is chosen
The Orc is chosen.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane stopped them in front of the entrance, turned, and told them that only one of the two women may enter.
"Why is that?" The Orc asked Ryhane.
"Well, you see, the ancestral spirits that roam these catacombs must choose one-"
Ryhane, however, was interrupted by the female Goblin, "Who gives a crap about this history lesson, I just want tah get the artifact and get outta this joint!"
The Orc looked at the Goblin, and shot her a look of annoyance, and shoved her face into the palm of her own hand.

"So, which one of you wants to be the owner of the Artifact?" Ryhane asked the two.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Only one may enter

choices: The spirits transfer all their extra padding to the orc, Ryhane's first
Something doesn't go according to plan
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
"I'm not letting that little imp have that treasure, she's not worthy." The orc flexed her impressive muscles, "Clearly I'm the only one here capable of appeasing the spirits." The goblin gave her a rotten look, turning away and walking back the way she came.
"Fine, you take the artifact, hope it curses yah!" She shouts over her back, ticked that their leader takes all the fun stuff.
"Honestly, I'm just done working with you." The undead shrugged, following the goblin.
"Cowards, all of you! I'll be stronger than the three of us combined anyways!" She huffed, Ryhane awkwardly watching the whole thing unfold. "That settles it, I'll be the one to take it."
"Perfect! You're just the one, I know it." Ryhane chimed with a legitimate excitement in her voice. 'Oooo, this'll be so much fun!' she thought, opening the door and leading the orc inside. The spirits from before were gathered around as they arrived.
"Elf, this isn't looking right..." She clutched her axe with both hands, carefully walking past the spirits with a battle stance at the ready. "Remember what I said about your head..."
The booming voice of the head elf startled the orc, who about trembled in fear. Men and ogres were one thing, but spirits rubbed her the wrong way... "Orc, are you the one who will accept the artifact as your own?" She nodded as Lysa stepped slowly back from her. "Very well... it's yours to keep until the next comes to claim it."
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: The Orc is chosen.

choices: Ryhane is met by the Spirit once more, to thank her for her efforts.
The Goblin and Forsaken thank Ryhane for getting rid of the Orc.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
"Now, all of our weight shall be yours to bear, forevermore until the next guardian is picked." The Spirit spoke ominously.
The Orc looked confused, "Wait, what did you say?"
The Orc then began to levitate, and glow. Her grip on her axe was forcefully loosened, and she dropped it on the ground, as well as all her armor.
"Elf! What's going on?" The Orc roared in anger and confusion.
Ryhane giggled madly, "Sorry, but I've been a liar. You see, the owner of this Artifact doesn't gain a lot of power... but they do gain a ton of weight."

Ryhane's body then began to shrink down to it's normal size, as it was transferred into the Orc. The Orc's once bulging muscles, were now nothing but flabby fat, her body growing larger and larger as other spirits transferred their own weight into the Orc's body.
"EEELF! I WILL HAVE YOUR HEEEEA-PHHH!" The Orc attempted to scream, but was muffled by her own massive body. She just kept growing and growing, nearly as large as the room itself!
She finally stopped, when the last member had finished the transfer. The only thing that could be seen, was this anonymous Orc's large, immobile booty.

"Woah..." Both the Goblin and Forsaken both gaped their mouths in disbelief, their once strict and brutal leader, reduced to a heaping pile of fat.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Heavy Orc

choices: Try to avoid sneaking around here, more dangerous magic is sealed here
I have a boon to grant you, to express the thanks of my people
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
"See, I knew it was cursed! I'm glad she took it." The goblin smacked the orc's belly and watched it jiggle and shake everywhere, as she was made of jelly.
"Though honestly, I'm surprised we didn't get crushed by her after a minute," he chuckled, happy to see that she got her just desserts.
"Aahhh, and I'm just glad to have my body back," Ryhane ran her fingers down her stomach and hips, "You had no idea how irritating it was trying to get around like that," she smiled, it feels much better now.
"I'm glad you got what you worked for, and you've earned the thanks of everyone that was sealed here. You've put our souls to rest young one, and for that you've earned my trust," The booming spectral voice called down, the bass of it's tone shaking the massive green blob. "And one last thing..."
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Thanks again

choices: Ryhane, in a fit of anger, accidentally activates one of the traps.
Ryhane actually manages to escape, but is met with an unpleasant surprise.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
"While leaving these sacred halls, be aware that even more dangerous magical traps can and will activate, should you go near them. If you are affected, we will be unable to save you, nor will the Guardian of Murtallach. Farewell, Ryhane... may your path be filled with blessings." The Spirit then faded, after revealing a very important hint.
"It's a good thing I got this Goblino-Transportino 4000 handy..." The Goblin said, throwing down a circular disc that formed into a portal. "Don't even THINK about hitchin' a ride wit' us, lady. We're headed to Orgrimmar to find somethin' else to do, good luck gettin' out!" The goblin cackled as she and the Forsaken leaped into the portal, the portal soon disappearing from sight seconds after.

Ryhane now had her old body, which made it easier to navigate the halls, however she no longer remembered the path she took to get down there. Throughout the maze of corridors, she saw small runes covering multiple areas, that she avoided in case they were the traps the Spirit warned her of.
After about 30 minutes of walking, Ryhane was still stuck, attempting to figure out how to return to the surface. It seemed as if every corridor, minus all the runes scattered everywhere, looked nearly the same.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Dangerous Magics

choices: With a candle-lit dinnertable
Complete with strange beast looking right at her
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content: "Ugh, this is impossible! I manage to get rid of all the blubber, but now I'm stuck fumbling in the dark" Ryhane would've used a teleport, but something was nulling any magic she tried. Likely another safety measure in protecting the wand. Ryhane built up in anger, kicking a wall with a huff and leaning her back on it, "This is impossible, I can't even see down here without a light. This damnable elven... whatever it is." Her voice trailed down as she slid down to sit on the ground. As she did, she sunk down a bit more than she'd have liked, a slight sliding noise heard from below. "Don't tell me... pressure plate." Her face sunk into a flat expression, she had a feeling this would happen eventually. The stone floor parted in two in a flash, Ryhane landing on her less than well padded rear and started to slide down an incline she couldn't fight. "Please at least be spikes so this can be over..." But as she hit the ground roughly, she wasn't met with spikes, she stood up, rubbing her sore ass with a grimace. Around her was a large room...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Not the best with directions

choices: Went ballistic and began eating from the Infinite Food.
Controlled herself, and did her best to quell the desire to eat from it.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
She saw a Table, filled with delicious treats and meals. Their tantalizing aroma filling the air, causing. Ryhane to gravitate towards it.
"Well... I guess just having one bite couldn't hurt..." Ryhane concluded. Besides, there didn't seem to be a way out at the moment, so the best option would be to play along for now.
She looked at the delicious foods, wondering which one to take. She decided on a bowl of fruit, from which she took an apple from. When she bit into it, however, the area she bit into seemed to regenerate.
It was now Ryhane realized that this was an infinite meal, one that could be eaten from infinitely.

That said, Ryhane...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: The Möbius Dinnertable.

choices: Something/someone joins her, and ends up trying to coax her to eat
The room changes/a door opens
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
"No... I mustn't. I just got my figure back, I can't ruin it yet." She crossed her arms and looked away, rationalizing that perhaps she's missing something... maybe there is a way our from here. Ryhane kept her eyes off the table (Her favorite Spider-Cakes were there) to avoid the desire to eat. The walls were all rather simple, and it didn't look like there'd be an obvious exit here. "Maybe it's a test of some sort, if I try not and eat, I may be able to leave... or I could be entirely wrong, for all I know." She sat down on the floor with her back to the table, she had to meditate, try and figure this puzzle out...
Option1: Someone or something joins her, trying to coax her to eat from the table
Option2: A door slides up, it looks like she was right, it's a puzzle of some kind that hopefully she'll be able to get through
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: A lesson in self control

choices: The shadow eventually stopped, and sent Ryhane back to the main hall.
The Shadow revealed itself to Ryhane, as the Orc she tricked.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
As she pondered her situation, she noticed a shadow speeding overhead towards the table.
Ryhane was curious, so she turned herself around and watched to see what this odd apparition would do.
To her surprise, it stretched into a long tube-like string, and began levitating foods towards Ryhane's mouth. Ryhane tried to leave, but she seemed rooted to the ground.
So Ryhane, once again, was stuck in a room forcefully gaining weight. Ryhane's mouth was kept open, and chewed for, by the shadow, who didn't seem intent to leave her alone.

Ryhane was stuck, gaining wildly for many hours it seemed. Her belly had returned to its old weight, and a bit bigger, as with her rump and breasts.
"Ugh... I can just never get a break..." Ryhane though to herself.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Feeding Shadow.

choices: This place is weird enough, she might still find something here
Ryhane accepts her fate and tries to do her best and cope with her body
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content: The stream of food slowed down, but not before reverting Ryhane back to her previous weight and then some. The shadow kept stuffing the food into Ryhane, eager to see her pack on the pounds. Her stomach was a good inches further from where it was at the runestones. She groaned, this was too much. Whoever made this trap was beyond odd. She felt this is where it'd end, fat and immobile stuffed by a shadow for the rest of her very long lifespan, but the food eventually halted. She shadow gave what looked like a grin, rubbing all along the elf's engorged gut (Which Ryhane would be lying if she said it didn't feel nice) and pinched at her hefty rolls, an odd giggling heard bouncing off the walls of the hall. Ryhane blinked, and when she opened her eyes, she was back in the main hall of the ancient place. "Whoa... alright." She caught her barings before realizing just how annoying this all was, "I go through all that trouble and end up reversing it, only to end up a bit fatter, and who knows how I'll fix it... hopefully I just run into a 'weight loss' trap..." Ryhane shook her belly and watched it jiggle hypnotically...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: The shadow lets up

choices: Ryhane was rooted to the ground, and an invisible force was causing her to gain.
The shadow returned, and wanted to have more fun with Ryhane.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
While she was in no condition to keep searching in those dark Catacombs, she still felt the urge to return. Maybe it was the hope that there may be another way to reverse this, or possibly the shadow made her mind want to return to gain more, but either way, she didn't feel it time to give up on this place.

This time, she left a breadcrumb trail to the entrance using the line string from her ruined clothes, making sure she didn't get lost. As she ventured further in, she noticed the runes once more, but these runes were different. They didn't seem very friendly, or helpful, but they still didn't look the same as the previous ones.
Ryhane, knowing her situation couldn't possibly get worse, decides to purposefully activate one, just to see what happens.

As it turns out, she was, again, sent to a large, empty room. But this time...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: A second shot

choices: The room changes in time
The spectre becomes clearer now, or perhaps is joined by another
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane fell back on her plump cheeks, a familiar shadow returning to inspect the elf once more. The giggling from before returned, the shadow looking as though it were happy for her return. "You again... I'm going to assume you're not in the weight loss kinda mood?" Ryhane rolled her eyes at her own sarcasm, knowing fully well it'll be the same as before. "Well, at least I know there's no way getting out of this one..." She sighed, this was almost what she was expecting, a trap that makes you lose weight? What sort of trap is that? The shadow laughed, climbing on top of the elf's belly softly, only a tiny bit of weight seemed to be on top of her, it pinched her chubby cheeks and the table appeared once more. This time however, Ryhane was seated in front of it on a very wide chair. "Well, at least you've got more tricks up your sleeve?" She shrugged, hardly scared at this point, she's been through enough ghosts fattening her by now.

The shadow took the opportunity to fatten Ryhane slowly, just feeding individual pieces of food to her. "Mph, at least the food's more enjoyable when I get the chance to taste it." Ryhane stated, taking the time between bites to speak her mind. The shadow seemed pleased with her, pulling her purple bangs out of her face. Ryhane knew not to fight it, the shadow was going to have it's way no matter what, and resistance would make it tougher to deal cope with.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Aww, were you worried about me?

choices: Gave up, and accepted her fate to gain tons of weight and eat constantly.
Ryhane was absolutely appalled, and didn't believe this shadow.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane grew past half a ton, still accepting of her gain. The shadow stuffed more and more into Ryhane's body, and unlike last time, wasn't intent on giving up.
Ryhane then began to see the shadow a bit more clearly... It was obviously an elf, a slightly chubby one, but still an Elf.
That's when Ryhane recognized the shadows familiar hair and markings...

"Is that... Me?" Ryhane wondered.
"Yes, Ryhane. I am your conscience. I have come to show you your true calling, your true passion in life!" The shadow version of her spoke.
"My destiny is to become a big, fat over fed elf?" Ryhane questioned, annoyed.
"You've always wanted to be fat, but we're never given the opportunity. Now, I grant you it, and you can't help but come back for more." The shadow explained.
Ryhane rolled her eyes, "Sure. And I'm Tyrande Whisperwind. Can you please just finish this up?"
"So eager you are to gain... Does little to disprove my point." The shadow smirked.

Ryhane and the Shadow bickered for a while, until Ryhane...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: The revealing!

choices: Ryhane continues being fed by her desire shadow
Something else helps Ryhane along..
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
"Think of it this way, you would have left were it not that you enjoyed the gain somehow, no?" The shadow questioned, trying to help Ryhane along. "This whole time you wished for it! Look back to when you first started, you couldn't resist summoning that cupcake and lemon pie. The little cookbook was just the beginning! You knew the blood elven spell was risky, yet you did it anyway and ravished the whole platter of spider cakes." She shadow had a smile on her face, "I enjoy it and so do you, there's no need to ignore your sub-conscious anymore, you're destined for it!" The shadow shook Ryhane's fat gut and gave It a hard smack, "The magic here in this trap brings out your true desires! And I know for a fact that as you gained, part of you wanted more, and that grew with you!" The real Ryhane blushed a deep purple, finally starting to realize what her choices have led to.

"P-Perhaps you're right..." She watched her soft stomach shake around below her, recalling how good it felt to have her stomach rubbed from last time, something inside her called her back... "I-I love being stuffed and fat... I just didn't want to admit just how much I loved food, and I didn't want to be shamed in Teldressil..." Ryhane admitted her enjoying what's been happening to her. Looking back, a tinge of her kept wanting to try, and hopefully have spells backfire on her. "I'll come clean... I want to keep enjoying this..." Ryhane felt embarrassed, but accepted her fate...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: That's impossible... or maybe not

choices: It is time for Ryhane to leave, and the Shadow gives her something to help gain.
Something/one interrupts Ryhane's feast.

Ryhane was now personally feeding herself more cakes, pies and other fattening foods to unleash her true desires, of course with a bit of help from the Shadow.
Ryhane was very large now, her obese belly being the size, now, of the tallest human. The shadow rubbed her belly, as well as her ample behind and fat, yet perky, breasts for both of their enjoyment.

It seemed like heaven, Ryhane constantly filling herself on the best foods known to Azeroh, while the Spirit rubbed her large, smooth body.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Being fed more and more...

choices: Some sort of beast rampaging through the halls
A group of adventurers, exploring the ruin. One or two end up triggering a trap

Whatever's going on up there, it doesn't seem good..." Ryhane looked a bit nervous, this was the first time they were interrupted, and she wanted to stay here longer! The rumbling came closer and closer, a deep tremble reverberating through the walls, Ryhane's plush padding jiggling to it's rhythm. The source felt like it was right above them until it stopped. An ominous silence crept over the feasting table. Ryhane's shadow tried to keep itself hidden, as something felt as though it was still coming this way...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Interuptions

choices: Ryhane, despite her not wanting to return, goes with them out of good will.
Ryhane leaves the two, she's absolutely done with that place.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane was met by a Female Night Elf, and a Female Human.
"Oh! Hello, there. I guess you two got on a trap, as well." Ryhane greeted the duo.
The Draenei spoke up first, "Yes, we were just walking around in Dire Maul, just trying to complete a quest, when we were suddenly dropped down into this dark room here."
"Well, I'm Ryhane. What're your names?" Ryhane asked.
"I am Falaan, and this is my best friend, Yharii. We are adventurers seeking great treasure and glory!" Falaan (Draenei) responded, bowing in respect.

"Well, I guess first things first, we need to escape from here. But how?" Yharii (Night Elf) mentioned.
"I think I know a way..." Ryhane said slyly, and silently gestured towards the hidden shadow.
The Shadow took a deep breath, and teleported the three back to the entrance, unfortunately for both Ryhane and the mysterious Shadow.
"Woah! How'd you do that?" Yharii asked Ryhane.
"Let's just say I got friends on the other side..." Ryhane subtly replied.

"Alright, I've had enough sightseeing in this place... I'm leaving." Ryhane said, waving goodbye to the duo.
"Aw, come on! We could probably use someone who knows this place good, so we can more easily find the treasure down in here!" Falaan pleads.
"Well...."

choices: The shadow offers assitance
The ladies have something that can help
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane groaned in protest, she just knew the pair would be doomed without guidance, and she didn't want that on her conscious. "Fine. I'll help you out, but on one condition! I want to inspect every artifact here first; if there's anything that can help my mobility, I'm taking it." Ryhane offered, giving the adventurers a resolute look.
"Well, it's not like we need it, we're just after gold, tell you the truth." Yharii responded with a shrug, her answer further drew Ryhane to the conclusion that she was most certainly a rogue.
"Mhmm, we're perfectly fine on our feet, so anything like that is certainly yours." Not needing something of that sort was only the current consensus, if they knew what laid in store for them, they'd certainly fight over it.
"We've got a deal then, ladies." Ryhane smiled, but she didn't really know why. Maybe part of her was eager to find a permanent solution and NOT get lost, or maybe it was to watch the pair try and likely fail to the ancient traps. "Mmm, but first we need to figure this out, I can't go stomping around in my current condition." Ryhane honestly didn't know how to deal with her bulk at the moment.

The two adventurers were confused, unsure of what happened, but Ryhane knew.
Ryhane mumbled a "Thank you" to the shadows, and without giving any explanation, gestured them all to follow her.

The Shadow that was fattening Ryhane was hoping to bring her back to the world of feeding, and having her immobile would make that very difficult. So, the Shadow allowed Ryhane to re-enter the Catacombs, for a third time, in hopes that this time will prove much more fruitful.

As the trio moved along the stone-cold labyrinth, they saw many shattered runestones and artifacts, worthless with the curse of time.
It was hard for Yharii and Falaan to not view Ryhane's massive, bloated belly and ass. It was hypnotic in a way, and how it managed to stay so smooth and with no Stretch Marks was like witchcraft.
They politely ignored it, however, to the best of their ability.

Eventually, they did find one thing of interest...

Yharii feels... off, but decides to shake it off

She made sure to watch the floors and walls for traps, alerting the trio whenever she saw anything even slightly suspicious. However, as she continued to search ahead, Yharii spotting a faint glow on the ground, barely visible under the pile of withered tapestries and scrolls. "Mmm, don't mind if I do..." the rogue whispered under her breath, looking back at the other two, "I uh, found a trap over here, let me see if I can disarm it. You two stay back just in case." She turned around after seeing both of them shrug, eager to check out the artifact in the small sitting alcove. Yharii buried through the rubbish as quietly as she could, bringing out a jeweled tooth that glowed a deep blue in her hand. "That elf is going to take it for herself, I just know it, and I can't have that," She inspected it in her hand, gold frilled edges and a masterfully cut gemstone embedded on it's base. As she ran her fingers over the tooth, her thumb was treated to a little slice, barely drawing blood. "I wasn't expecting it to be so sharp..." Yharii popped her thumb in her mouth to sooth the slight nip of pain...

It's Falaan who first notices Yharii's body to swell in size, and that causes Yharii to realize it herself.

Yharii grows chubby, her leather stretching and tearing in some places. However, Yharii manages to throw the tooth away as quickly as possible. This causes the gain to cease, with Yharii shaking her new chubby belly in some dismay.
"Oh, no... my perfect body, ruined!" Yharii teared up, grasping at her fattened body.
"Don't worry, Yharii. You still look beautiful to me..." Falaan comforted.
"Oh, you're just saying that... this is going to take FOREVER to work off!" Yharii cried.

Ryhane simply watched this Drama Queen go off about how her life is ruined, inspecting the Tooth on the ground.
Yharii looked at Ryhane as she bent down, revealing a part of her humungous ass.
"Oh, I see now." Yharii spoke, "I see perfectly. This makes so much sense now!"
"Hm?" Ryhane wonders, looking behind her at Yharii.
"You're probably here to protect the real treasures, leading us to all this crazy places Traps! Well, it's not going to work!" Yharii roared.

"No, no! I'm sorry, I didn't-" Ryhane tries to explain.
"But nothing! From now on, me and Falaan are on our own." Yharii concluded.

Ryhane pleaded with the chubby elf ahead of her, "Wait, trust me, I'm only here to help! All I want is to get thin again!" She pinched at a roll and emphasized her added plumpness. "If I wanted to keep you from treasure, why would I have let you out of that chamber below? And we got rid of every trap since then!" She hung her head down, "I'm not a liar." Yharii didn't seem interested, still dramatically walking away slowly (With her chubby ass swaying behind her).

Falaan seemed more than convinced, her white eyes welling up a bit with a small ringing of tears, "Yhaaariiiii, you can't leave her now!" Her voice distraught, "She needs our help as much as we need hers!" To the sound of Falaan's upset voice, Yharii turned around her lower lip curled up in a frown.
"Falaan, you know you can't use the puppy eyes on me, it's not fair..." She walked back to the duo, "Fine, I'll let you have your second chance, Elf. But on one condition!" Yharii had a confident tone as if she pulled all this just to be dramatic, "I want you to promise that the treasure comes first. Your personal quest to lose binge weight is your own business, got it?" Ryhane narrowed her eyes at the busted leather tunic Yharii sported when she said 'binge weight', but decided to move past it.
"Fine, yes. I'll show you the way to treasure, just don't go ahead picking things up before I get a look at it?" Ryhane raised an eyebrow, knowing she specifically told her not to touch anything until she's seen it.

Yharii and Falaan huffed and grunted, putting all their weight onto the sealed door, their faces turning purple and blue respectively. "Ooof, hey chubby; come help us out here?" Yharii groaned, out of breath. "You might be enough to get this open."

Yharii and Falaan simply watch as the Fat Elf investigates the room.

The two panels turn out to be different codes for some sort of ancient feeding machine...
On one side, you type in a weight, on the other side you type in how fast you want it to be. (ex. X pounds per sec/min/hour)
"Anyone want to try it out?" Ryhane asked, but was greeted by silence, so Ryhane bites the bullet on this one.

She begins to type in numbers...

1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane looked ahead of her, on the far wall, a glowing rune was inscribed at the top of a very well embellished door. "Whatever this thing does... it has to open that door." Ryhane concluded, giving a faint shrug to the other two, who only looked on with curious expressions. "I see neither of you are interested, so I'll try it first..." Ryhane stared at the controls, trying to make sense of it. On one was units of time, on the other was a number key... She pressed the minute key, expecting something to happen, but nothing yet. Slowly her finger scanned over the numbers before settling on 20. As soon as the button set in, the machine strapped her down on a stone chair, the mechanisms above whirring to life. The pair behind watched on, not knowing what to do. Ryhane struggled in the chair, she had a feeling this wasn't going to help her figure...

A tube descended from the core of the machine, dripping a glowing blue liquid, Ryhane made a good target, her mouth already open. The tube latched on and started gurgling to life, tanks of the stuff bubbling on either side. It came in quicker than she'd thought, a stream of goo pouring sinking down into her stomach. She felt the effects nearly instantly, her already sizeable bulk growing thicker and fatter by the second. She groaned under the flow of slick blue goo, blushing without realizing. As she slowly filled up with a thicker layer of fat, Falaan noticed the rune across the way slowly draining. "Look! The blue in the rune is lowering! I think we need to get enough of the goo to leave the tanks until it's depleted..." She spoke quickly in the heat of the moment, clutching at what she thought made sense, and it did.

"And that button... is it a cancel button?" Falaan noted a stone button more prominent than the others. "Maybe we should split it up!" Falaan cried, feeling as though she's reached a breakthrough.
"Okay, but how're we gonna split it up?" Yharii questioned, her eyes narrowing.

"This fat load is only going to weigh us down! Why split up the weight when we could just stuff this elf full of goo, and forget about her?" Yharii explained.
Falaan looked worried, "A-are you sure that's such a good idea? I mean, what if she-"
"'What if?' What if what? She somehow loses all the weight and comes back with a vengeance? Just stuff her already and let's get out of here!" Yharii demanded.

Follow Ryhane's POV
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane gulped, "Then I'll do it. At this point I don't care what happens, and my conscience would be ruined if you were to take it." She looked at Falaan with a smile, "There's worse fates?" Ryhane shrugged. She felt all the power keeping her upright fade almost instantly, landing roughly on her smooth purple rump. "Go on now."
Falaan looked sad in a way, but relieved, the extra weight from her recent escapades melting off in mere minutes. Before long she was back to her fit and trim self, only now with tattered clothes. "Alright Ryhane, I'll remember what you did here!" She called, a faint bit of remorse heard in her voice.She pushed open the door, which led down a narrow corridor.

Ryhane sighed as soon as she could no longer hear the draenei's footfalls, "Well, that's that." She looked down at the necklace with mixed feelings, "There's not many options left at this point."
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Sacrifices must be made

choices: Return of the Shadow.
Ryhane was magically teleported back home.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane sat on the cold, stone floor, the necklace beckoning her to equip it. However, Ryhane resisted.
The Shadow had left her, and had moved on to elsewhere in the catacombs, leaving Ryhane an immobile blob of purple flesh.

Ryhane, after 30 more minutes of consideration, decided to just put on the necklace. If she was going to be stuck, she might as well make the most of it.
Her body began to then rapidly fill up with weight, her fat growing larger and larger.

1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane couldn't help but enjoy her fate at this point, she nibbled at her lower lip as fat grew softer and thicker. As the elf was lost in a daze, the familiar touch of the shadow returned along with a giggle, "See, I told you!" It taunted, slowly rubbing up and down her growing abdomen. "You love it!" The voice was giddy and full of energy, "Turns out this isn't so bad, huh?" The voice called once more, suddenly behind her massaging her giant rear. The voice continued to reassure Ryhane, but oddly enough, she felt as though at least two sets of hands were caring for her.

"Hmmm, is there another one now?" Ryhane asked, not knowing if she'd get an answer or not, the hands pressed with more firmness, feeling the full bulk of Ryhane's plush curves. The other 'shadow' answered back...

choices: Refuse, and be fattened for the rest of eternity.
Accept, and give up her body and soul to the void.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
She heard a strange voice, unfamiliar to her, but she could hear no words she understood come from the voice.
It encased her in a veil of shadow, clouding her vision. Before she could react, she was out like a light.

When she awoke, she was easily several tons fatter, but her pendant was stripped from her body. She was in a dark, mysterious land, empty and barren.
She looked around, trying to see any sign of someone to explain what was going on, or better yet, get her out of here.
Just as she said, shadows gathered at a location near her head, where she could still visibly see what was forming.
It was in the form of a male Night Elf, who began to speak, "Hello, Ryhane. I've enjoyed your stay here, but now I think it's time we stop playing this game of Cat and Mouse."
"What are you talking about?" Ryhane asked, "Where am I?"
"This, my fat mage, is a purgatory-like state in which I exist. Otherwise known as the Endless Void." The shadow spoke.
"While I have no form for myself, I can take on whichever form I please. I've lured many an adventurer into my underground labyrinth with the promise of treasure, yet none cared enough to investigate, and those that did were frightened off. You, however..."
Ryhane growled, as that was the only thing she could do, "What do you want from me?"
"Ryhane, I believe we both know exactly what I want. I want your vessel. I shall strip you from the burden of this obese state, all for the cost of me taking over your soul. If you disagree, however, you shall be eternally fattened in my Void. It's your decision..."

This seemed like the ultimatum for Ryhane. She enjoyed gaining weight, but she didn't want to be this way forever. Besides, this shadow being seemed a bit tricky, he knew that she enjoyed her weight, however he may just feed her to death. However, if she did lose the weight, he may trap her in this realm. But would that be so bad, either? Maybe she'd gain the powers within the area, and be able to take over.
Ryhane was conflicted, but she finally made her decision...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: The spirit is unlike the last, with something m...

choices: Decieved by the spirit
Wake up to a thin body
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane glaredat the spirit in distrust, "How do I know you're not deceiving you?" She rose a long eyebrow, "What's guaranteeing that you'll keep your word?"

"Well, you'll just have to take my word, dear. Though think of it this way, if I were trying to deceive you, wouldn't I have done that already?" He gave a smug grin, "What reason would I have anyway?" Ryhane had to admit, it was sort of hard to fight that logic, if he wanted to cross her, he'd have no resistance at this state.
"Hmmmm... what does it entail? How does it work?" Ryhane asked, there had to be a catch.
The spirit stroked his chin, "Well, I only wish to experience the mortal realm, feel it's tangible existence through mortal form. There's a reason it's called the Endless Void, there's truly nothing here." He lowered his voice a bit, "What's the harm in wanting to see the real world, hmm?" He paused, noting Ryhane's stubborn facial expression, "I won't be in full control, I'll be more of a tag along than anything, you likely won't even realize I'm there." He looked at the elf with a smile, "So?"
Ryhane wasn't quick to answer, contemplating for a few moment. It doesn't seem that bad really... and it's kinda sad in a way. "Fine, it's a deal."

"Perfect!" With that, he materialized a clipboard and paper and prompted her to sign the contract, which she managed. "A deal's a deal!" Ryhane felt dizzy, her vision slowly fading...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Offer Accepted

choices: Her friend, who usually was found by the center of Darnassus.
Her mentor, who was with a group of students nearby the main entrance area.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
Ryhane awoke to her body, restored to her natural thin beauty.
"Hm, well, nothing bad so far..." Ryhane mentioned.
She then heard a voice calling from her mind, "As promised! I'm a man of my word, of course."
Ryhane jumped a bit, "Oh! Forgot you were going to be here... so, what now?"
"Well, let's take things normally. Allow me to send us back to your normal living area..." The spirit then caused them both to vanish in a puff of dark energy, and they were both sent directly to Ryhane's tower.
"This... this is home, how'd you know I lived here?" Ryhane asked.
"I live within your body, now. I know everything you know. Well, mostly facts, actually, things linked towards your personality and opinions change so rapidly I just can't keep up with them. But facts stick, and are, mostly, unchanging. Much like your current living area." The void spirit explained.
"Well... alright, I'll trust you won't abuse that knowledge. Anyway, I've been gone for quite a while. I'd better check up on how things are going on..." Ryhane said as she dashed downstairs and out the door, and began the trek to Darnassus.

She walked in through the main gates, and decided to first check up on...
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: As promised

choices: Talking over dinner
Back at Nyla's place
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
"We're going to go check up on Nyla, now's a good time to catch up." Ryhane said out loud as she walked down the stone path. "She's a bit... jumpy, so it'd probably be best if she didn't know about you?" A few people on the street beside her looked around, wondering who she was talking too, but Ryhane paid no mind.
"It's likely best no one knows about me, for both our sakes." The spirit mentioned, "Oh, and from what I understand you've known her since you were both small children? Exactly 17, if I'm not mistaken. You met at-"
"Yeah, that's enough." Ryhane interrupted holding up her hand as if to say stop. "Try not to creep out your vessel too much?" She asked with a laugh. "Let's talk about you, how're you enjoying the mortal world so far?"
"Mmmm, it feels entirely different, as I'm sure you'd imagine. Truth be told, I've never seen more than a handful of lifeforms before now." He sounded rather excited, giving Ryhane a smile. "Though, it's a bit noisy out here."
"Heh, you should see Stormwind, friend. Darnassus is pretty serene as far as noise goes." As she turned round the bend, off in the distance Ryhane spotted her old friend sitting on the ledge of a stone gazebo with her feet dipped in the water. "Mmm, there she is!" Ryhane piped up, quacking her pace.

Ryhane and the spirit chit-chatted as they closed in on the humming elf by the water, who seemed rather absorbed by her book. "Nyla, hey Nyla!" Ryhane shouted, making sure not to scare the poor thing. As she turned her head with a smile, Ryhane ran over to her friend, "Oh, it's good to see you!" She embraced her friend with a hug.
"I was wondering when you'd finally get out of your tower! You must be beyond busy in your studies!" She broke the hug with a smile, smoothing the creases on her dress, "What've you been up to?"
"It's a long story, but I've been out on adventures lately. Strange artifacts, Dire Maul, you know..." She trailed off, Nyla didn't look too convinced.
"You? Adventure? You never leave your tower!" She laughed. "Though you look thinner, so maaaybe it's true." She poked at her friends flat stomach, "Say, let's go catch up, my treat!"
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Spirit, meet Nyla!

choices: Before she finished, she used a duplication spell on the pastries that remained.
When she finished, the spirit multiplied her weight magically.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
They catch up over dinner, at a rather casual restaurant. Nothing too fancy, but still pretty good.
Ryhane ordered a large meal, her justification being that she went on a long journey, she hadn't really eaten in a good long while.
Nyla and Ryhane talked for a while, until the food arrived. Ryhane, after that, barely talked, and simply ate her meal.
Nyla felt a bit awkward, but paid no mind either way, and just ate her own food.

Ryhane and Nyla finished, and both parted ways.
Ryhane patted her now bloated belly, "Whoof! I ate like I hadn't eaten in a million years... Spirit, was that your doing?"
"Well, maybe it is, maybe it isn't." The spirit responded sarcastically.
"Well, if it is, quit it. I don't want to be a fat blob again..." Ryhane said.
"Or... do you?" The spirit mentioned slyly.
"No, I don't..." Ryhane stopped mid-sentence, and she stopped in place, "Wait... you know, maybe it wouldn't be so bad..."

Ryhane immediately ran to the nearest Bakery, and asked them to give her a dozen of everything. She was in control of her body, but the Spirit had altered her mind to want to be as fat as possible.
The Bakers, though questioning this odd request, got to work when Ryhane dumped a sack of gold from her pocket.
She took the multitudes of bags back to her tower, so she may eat in peace.

She began eating all the pastries, treats and food, her body growing fatter with each one she consumed.

You see, this spirit truly didn't want to see the mortal realm, in reality he'd seen it many a time, but his true intentions were to fatten up unsuspecting women into immobility by sending thoughts of gaining weight nonstop into their minds, using his magic to make the foods they ate more fattening, increase their weight at will, and as well, duplicate foods they were eating so that they could eat more using the Magic of the Void.
1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.title: Talking over dinner

choices: Finish up one last bag and go outside to look for something else to do
There must be something we can do here, I don't feel like going out

"Mmmph, this bakery has always been my favorite." Ryhane grumbled, crumbs falling from her mouth. "There spider cakes are to DIE for..." She still wasn't aware of the spirit's intentions, too caught up in her delicious baked goods. She rubbed off any stray crumbs from her now pot bellied middle, poking out from under her shirt. It was a start contrast, as much of the mages body stayed relatively thin. She sat cross legged on the ground, stuffing herself silly. "Spirit, do you taste this? *Urp*" Ryhane gestured, leaning back on her bed.
"Mmm? Oh, yes. Mortal sustenance is delicious." The spirit honestly couldn't care less how the food tasted, his motives were set on personally fattening Ryhane. While the mage wasn't look, the spirit multiplied the sweets in her final bag, intentionally clouding her realization of the fact. "I knew you were still hungry, Ryhane."
"Mmm, of course. I can get used to this, ya know?" She wolfed down another gnomish donut, her love handles widening just a touch. One hand absently played with her belly, rubbing around her belly button and pinching her new roll. "So, after we're done here wanna find something else to do? You've got lot's to experience, my friend!" Ryhane finished her dozen, grabbing yet another.

Food Conjuration

Ryhane giggled, and patted her now enlarged belly, "Hey, I got an idea. Why don't I show you a spell that can help with my hunger?"
The Spirit was questioning, but when Ryhane pointed over at the Spellbook she had found near the start of her adventure, the Spirit began flipping through the pages.

It eventually stopped on a particularly interesting one...

1141321121211131111121121121212112111122.content:
The book's pages flipped open as the spirit scanned over each spell and incantation. Many 'Hmms', 'Ooos', and 'Ahhhs' were heard as Ryhane emptied her final bag of sweets, until the spirit settled on one spell in particular. "Food conjuring? Interesting..." The book continued to stay open till a slight chuckling rose up from the spirit, "Yes, this'll do nicely." The spirit quickly skimmed the rest of the tome and slammed it shut. Ryhane was too occupied with her final bite too care what exactly he was saying, but it went along the lines of, 'So many delicious secrets... right under her... yadda yadda'. What was more important to her was a full stomach and pinching slightly doughier thighs.

"Mphh, so what'd you find?" Ryhane licked the tips of her fingers, lounging back in her bed.
"More than I'm sure you'd be able to understand. But either way, I've got options for you." His voice sounded rather confident, and a bit malevolent if she were to pay enough mind. "But before I spoil the secret... tell me your favorite food, Ryhane." The spirits voice sounded genuinely curious as to what she'd say, despite already reaping her mind for such things.
The slightly chubby elf brought a finger up to her chin as she thought, "Oh I know!" Her eyes shot wide open, "I could really go for some..."

choices: "...No. I want some more pie!"

The spirit begins conjuring, and summons 'accidentally' summons a few piles of the extremely delicious and extremely fattening pie.
Ryhane didn't care, however, and grabbed one of the pies and dug in, her belly growing once more.
The spirit watched in awe as the elf continued eating, he'd read that one bite should've filled her up instantly, but here she was, eating what seemed to be multiple bites, gaining weight in the process. Not that he was complaining.
Ryhane finished the first pie, and was still very hungry. She took another, and dug into it, her belly now twice the size of her previous weight and still growing.

Ryhane, after about an hour, managed to devour all the pies in the room, leaving her in a very obese state. "Oof... I can't believe I ate so much...!" Ryhane said, rubbing her now massive belly.

"Well..."
