"So... I have some questions..." Cat began.
115121212122121112211121112311111.title: Not so fast! Capture evaded

choices: Follow Sikana's PoV
Stick with Aemi for now
1151212121221211122111211123111111.content:
Aemi couldn't help but blush, trying her best to remain casual, she turns her head around, 'surveying the inn'. "Oh, that thing? It's nothing really, just someone I met, a coworker, yes." She was making up as she goes, Cat can tell.

"Riiight, and I'm the Empress of Silvermoon, you've gotta give a better answer than that. Trust me, I can see through you," He gestures with two fingers pointed at her, sipping on his wine (Drinking so early?) "And these elf eyes know you're lying. Give me the real story."

"Okay hero, you did save me..." Aemi goes into detail how she quit studies to run off and find 'great power ', meeting Mordecai, what she had to do, and why she betrayed him... "I just couldn't let the poor creature die, at least not in front of me. I froze the assassin and came here to lay low. You met the kidnapper last night." She made sure to keep out the bits about her real reasoning behind keeping Sikana around, he didn't need to know about that...

"So now you're here, laying in the same bed as an over-fed... thing and running from a powerful underground Forsaken syndicate. A big tale, I'll admit." Cat was polishing glasses for the patrons that'll inevitably be coming downstairs soon. "I'm inclined to believe you, but how could you leave ME to find ancient power by yourself? You pal, your best friend, Your SAVIOR? Pshhh" He waved his hand at Aemi in feigned hurt.

"Your ego really didn't need the boost." Aemi chimed in with a chuckle, she missed his company, truth be told. The two caught up on exciting months apart, casually chit-chatting... Sikana still casually munching.
1151212121221211122111211123111111.title: Why are you with... that?

choices: They reach Aemi's Dimension, but it's rather empty.
The portal messes up, and they end up somewhere else.
11512121212212111221112111231111112.content:
Aemi notices the time, and tells Cat that she really needs to get going.
"Wait! ...Can I go with you?" Cat requested, innocently.
Aemi sighed, "Listen, I've got a heavy load as it is, and the more I bring along, the more likely I'm going to get caught."
Cat then lowered his ears and head, showing some depression, "Oh. Alright... fine... I'll just go back to my boooring life... where nothing of interest happens... you know, maybe you'd need some companionship, maybe some help 'Feeding the Beast', heh." Cat said, trying to invoke pity out of Aemi.
Aemi has been pushed into taking Cat many places, and for once she was doing something without him... but she could use an extra hand helping with Sikana, this was true. And it wouldn't be too unrealistic for her to be outnumbered, and she didn't plan on training Sikana in the art of warfare. Aemi couldn't bear to get Sikana involved in this fight, so, her hands were tied.
"Alright, Cat, you can come..." Aemi gave in against her will.
Cat cheered, and leaped on the shoulders of Aemi playfully, "ONWARDS, AEMI!"
Aemi shook her head, while cracking a smile, and headed back to Sikana.

She returned to Sikana, who was already up, eating what was left from her midnight binge. "Mnnpph, what's going on? Who's that?" Sikana mumbled, gesturing towards the Elf on Aemi's back.
"This is... an old Friend, I call him Cat. Mainly because he's just as crazy as one." Aemi joked, "I'll explain on the way, right now I think it's high time we get to my Personal Dimension!"
Sikana and Cat both cheered, both of them prancing around cheerfully, Sikana's fat jiggling as she did.

After about 10 minutes of ripping through reality to open the portal, it was finally open, and Aemi encouraged them both to get in quickly before it closed off. They all leaped in, and they were off to their next destination...
11512121212212111221112111231111112.title: Stay with Aemi

choices: Little base set up, little bit of relaxation...?
Done to buissness, and no time to snack!
115121212122121112211121112311111121.content:
A portal opened in a desolate plane, a far cry from the gorgeous scenic view Mordecai's dimension had, but the novice managed what she could. It was peaceful at least, a nice quiet breeze, serene really. Till a screaming blood elf inn keeper emerges clutching Sikana's tail in fear. He's never been through a portal before, boring life. Aemi gave a flick to the tip of his ear, snapping him out of it. "So was that an elven schoolgirl scream, or was I just dreaming?"

"That was a uh... blood curdling... battle cry..." barely heard under Cat's mumbled breath. Standing straight and brushing himself off. "Yeah." Aemi couldn't help but laugh.

Sikana barely paid attention, taking a look at the realm. "Not as charming as the last, but it's safe."
Before leaving, the draenei's food stuffs were finally extinguished. Aemi's alterations on her were still present, and getting a bit out of hand. The clothes she left in here barely viable at all anymore. Her pants splitting across the sides, blue flab taking it's toll. Her tail and rump made short use of the back, underwear leaving little to the imagination. Oh and her shirt! It was an over glorified vest at this point, ripped up the middle, leaving a wide gut, two rolls, with a third coming soon.

"Oh shut it, you. There's not much I can do here currently, not without Mordecai's stuff. Hard to build a whole personal city with your hands tied behind your back."

"Ahem, isn't that why it's called magic? Ms. Oh so powerful?" Cat chimed in. "Besides, we don't need much right now." Making sure to look on the bright side, after a glare from Aemi.
115121212122121112211121112311111121.title: Aemi's Dimension

choices: Aemi explains her plan, and begins setting it in motion.
They decide to take a rest, it's been a very long day already.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211.content:
"Just for that, I'm putting you on Base Setup. I'm going to work on creating a small, interdimensional portal for us to traverse through with ease. Oh, and as for you, Sikana, don't worry. Here, have a pile of your favorite cookies." Aemi explained, using some of her Dimensional Powers to create an everlasting pile of fattening cookies for Sikana to munch on.
"Thanks, Aemi." Sikana responded, before digging into her meal.

Cat used his limited powers within the Dimensional Space to form a landscape not unlike Eversong Woods. Spiraling trees, sparkling green grass, as well as a few huts for them all to sleep in.
"Sorry I can't make a hut large enough for you, Sika. Besides, you're probably outgrow it, anyway." Cat joked.
Sikana laughed along with Cat, understanding. "Well, it's not like it'd do me much good, anyway." Sikana continued with Cat's statement.

Aemi returned, with good news. The Interdimensional Portal was up, and it would allow for, at most, 1 of them to go through every 10 minutes. Any more, and it would compromise the reality of Aemi's dimension, possibly causing it to collapse upon itself and be erased from time.
Sikana had gained quite a lot more weight, seeming to double in size since Aemi was gone. She ripped her old clothing, leaving her completely nude and obese. However, this seemed to not phase her, and she kept stuffing cookies in her mouth.
Aemi decided that the least she could do was give her some clothing, to cover up her indecency. She used some of the Dimensional Power to create Elastic Underwear, that would cover up her breasts and ripe buns.
"I apologize I can't give you anything more concealing, but it's the best I can do for the time being." Aemi told Sikana, "But don't worry, team. I have a plan, and if we pull it off, you, me and Cat will be able to stay here happily!" Aemi assured her team.

"Oh, I like the sound of this!" Cat enthusiastically stated.
"Mprphhrph! *Gulp* I mean, Yeah, let's do it!" Sikana said aloud, in between bites.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211.title: Setting up camp.

choices: Peek inside Sikana's thoughts
Shrug it off, maybe after their plans are finished?
11512121212212111221112111231111112112.content:
"It'll take me a little while to work out all the kinks, we can't have a single frayed end, or the whole thing will flop, but that needs to wait till tomorrow. Let's get a bit of rest first, all this conjuring and portal building has sapped Cat and I." As much as Aemi wants to get it over with, rest is important.

"Sounds like a plan, boss." Cat wasn't used to all this world-building stuff, but It's worse than 24 hour shift at his post in Silvermoon.

"Mhmmm, I agree!" Sikana shouted through a mouthful of cookies. She was certainly one to enjoy relaxation between important duties. It didn't take much to convince her to sit back and enjoy a snack. Give the greedy sweet stealer a lounge chair and a pile of food and she's set.

Cat retreated to his hut with yawn, sleep was good for him. And maybe a bottle of Eversong wine to keep him in a good mood.

Aemi was about the same, though her previous interest in plumping up Sikana was still her favorite relaxation. She sat beside the draenei, a smile cornering her face. Something about the strange girl appealed to her. She couldn't help but help Sikana, grabbing the tray of self replacing cookies. She popped them in her mouth which she happily accepted. Part of her wonders how she feels? Surely it must be heavenly... part of her wanted to scry into her thoughts, see it how Sikana does. Maybe she'd enjoy it?
11512121212212111221112111231111112112.title: Plans are for later

choices: Aemi wakes up, and begins prep on the plan.
Sikana and Aemi have a conversation in the dream.
115121212122121112211121112311111121122.content:
For a moment, a split-second, Aemi considered taking a look within Sikana's thoughts. However, a thought came to her head. She was tired, and even if she wanted, she couldn't afford to use precious energy to stalk one of her friends thoughts.
Aemi decided to simply cuddle up with Sikana, and rest in her large flab.

Aemi had a wonderful dream. She was in a large banquet hall, but only one other patron was here, Sikana. She was dressed in regal clothing, yet still the same size as she was in the awake world. Aemi was wearing much of the same, a very elegent dress, and they both had a seat.
The food was laid down on the table, and it was massive, and in large quantities. As Sikana stuffed the food into her mouth, Aemi helped by levitating some of the food with her magic.
They were both happy, enjoying each other's company. Sikana, growing fatter and hungrier, and Aemi, happy to provide her gluttonous goaty anything she desired.
115121212122121112211121112311111121122.title: Shrug it off.

choices: Check in on how the others are sleeping...
Wakey wakey
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
Aemi curled up further next to Sikana, who was as comfortable as an Eversong silk bed at this point. There was still plenty of time left for rest... Back in her dream she was sipping on a crisp glass of wine, while her companion was downing entire mugs of sweet mead. Aemi sat with her elbows propping her up on the table. The binging draenei never ceased to make her smile. As their dream-feast continues, she watched her smooth belly grow larger, resting on the table for support, it's overhang doing itself justice. It grew round and wide on top it, cute folds peaking out the sides of her out-grown clothes.

The dream seemed as vivid as the ones she implanted in Sikana from the beginning. Perhaps they were rubbing off on her, but Aemi enjoyed it. Sikana downs another mug of drink, coaxing her deep blue belly-button out for an appearance. "Sikana, you're so greedy! Didn't you say you were going to cut back after that chocolate cake?" Aemi teased, pinching a soft blue roll.

"Mrpmph mmm *gulp* I couldn't resist myself, after that cake. I forgot to complement the chefs who made it." Sikana gave what belly she could reach a shake, "Besides, I wouldn't have any of this, if I did. And I can thank you for it too." She gave the elf a genuine smile.

"Very true, my big blue glutton. And I wouldn't want you any other way. Though I must admit, I had no play in your indulgence prior to the first dream, that was all you. Greedy, greedy." The elf admitted, she was watching Sikana for a good time, watching from the corner of the inn as she over-indulged in culinary exploration. She even had a few different disguises. "Although, you CAN thank me for the cake, I conjured it to be extra delicious... and well fattening back in that inn... in fact I disguised myself as the waiter to push you to have dessert." Aemi poked a finger into the draenei's every expanding belly.

"Oh I knew there was something too good to be about that cake..." Sikana thought back, it was much too delicious, and she could practically feel her thighs widening as she ate it.... "But I'm happy it ended out as it did..."

The dream continued on for quite some time, the two talking and conversing over her gain...
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Vivid Dream

choices: She describes a strategic breaking and entering scenario.
She describes a more defensive-offensive plan.
She has a "Just follow my lead." Plan.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
As much as the two wish the dream could continue forever, they both were so rudely awoken by an impatient elf named Cat.
"Rise n Shine, Beauty and the Blob. I got something that might interest you." Cat told the two, in a very snarky attitude.
Aemi teleported to the middle of their base, still just waking up.
"Don't suppose you made any coffee, Hm?" Aemi questioned, somehow knowing the answer.
"Nope. But I did get this message from one of Mordekai's minions, take a look..."

A faded image of an undead appeared over a stained metal contraption, bearing the insignia of the Fleshbound Syndicate.
The image spoke, "You and your friends may be safe within your dimension, Aemillien. But soon, your power shall wane, and that's when we shall strike! This is your last chance, betrayer. Give us the Draenei, or face the full wrath of the syndicate. Time is ticking, Little one. Our master hungers."
The image then vanished, and was followed by some silence.
"So, any plans?" Cat asked, breaking the silence.

"Yes... And it's going to require 100% precision. One wrong step, and we'll be done for. Can I trust you to work with me, Cat?" Aemi questioned Cat.
Cat laughed, "Yeah, how hard could it be?"
Aemi ran up and grabbed Cat by the shoulders, "THIS IS SERIOUS! Everyone's ass is on the line, and you'd better do this right!"
"Alright, fine! What do we need to do?" Cat wondered.
Aemi began to explain...
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Rise n Shine!

choices: We cart in Sikana, fool them into thinking we surrendered
Illusions and disguises?
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"Firstly, Mordecai is right about one thing, I don't have enough energy to keep this dimension up forever. We're limited to a fairly short window. We need to take out the head of the snake, and soon. Our plan will involve breaking into their crime den unnoticed." Aemi stretched her arms and neck, "Which could be the riskiest part of the operation, truth be told."

"But what's our ultimate goal going to be in there?" Asked cat with a raised hand.

"We kill Mordecai and secure all the reagents I need for the portal. I don't see the syndicate staying in power if he's gone. They'll loot the place and split. Trust me." Aemi was at least sure that there wouldn't be issues after he's taken care of.

"Alright so how're we getting in?" Cat raised an eyebrow.

"Well..."
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Breaking and entering, step 1

choices: They bump into one of Mordecai's Assassin, who might see through them...
They find Mordecai's room with no trouble.
Check up on Sikana?
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"We'll disguise ourselves as new recruits, then try to get into Mordecai's main chamber. I'll cast an illusion spell on us, to make us look like Forsaken. Sikana, I'm going to need to keep you here. To disguise and allow your mobility, it'll take up a ton of my magic, and we need each and every bit we can spare. So, you're going to stay here." Aemi explained.
"Fine by me." Sikana agreed, biting into a large slice of cake.
Cat moans, "Ugh, fine. But we'd better get to the cool action stuff quick!"
Aemi smiles, "Don't worry. Killing Mordecai won't be easy, so we'll need to get him alone in the room."
Aemi and Cat shake hands, and both teleport away in a flash of brilliant light, allowing Sikana time alone to gorge herself even more.

Both Cat and Aemi were in their disguises, and went to the front gates. The guards bore heavy armor, bearing the insignia of the Syndicate. They looked down at the two Forsaken, one smiled and waved.
The female Forsaken elbowed the other, as if to tell him to cut it out, and she began to speak to the guard,
"Ahem, me and my associate here are the new Recruits, so, if you'd not mind letting us in..." But the Female was rudely cut off by the guard,
"Not so fast. To get in, you must answer three questions...
What are your names?"
"Oh! I'm um... Aeeerryn. Aryn Nightvenom. And my friend here is Cadwell Rotspine." 'Aryn' responded, trying to keep her cool.
The Guard, though slightly suspicious, accepted the answer, and moved to the second,
"Why did you join the Syndicate?"
"We joined because we were offered a 'Free Meal'." 'Aryn' responded quite fast.
'That one is super easy for me, Mordekai says it's a way to weed out the strong willed.' 'Aryn' whispered into 'Cadwell's' ear.

"Finally," The Guard began to conclude his test, "What is the average wingspan of an unladen swallow?"
Before either could answer, the second guard glared at the first one, and the first one just burst out laughing, "Oh, come on. You can't expect me NOT to have fun at this job. Get off your high horse, you know who we work for. Alright, you two can come in."

Cat chuckled as they both entered the mansion-like domain of the Syndicate's Headquarters. They could see many portraits depicting the leader, as well as a statue of him in a very threatening and domineering pose.
"Man, this guy has some ego, and that's coming from me!" 'Cadwell' joked with 'Aryn'.
"I know, but now's not the time for insulting him. Now, I think I remember where his room is, we just have to take a look around..." 'Aryn' told 'Cadwell', and they both headed off through one of the many corridors.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: The best plan is usually the simplest one.

choices: Caught red handed, just outside their goal!
Some old school trickery
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
The two undead 'recruits' walked down the main corridor, passing many busy forsaken. Luckily for them, otherwise they'd have been spotted without question. It wasn't easy adjusting their posture and walking style. It took a certainly style to pull it off, not one that an elegant blood elf could easily replicate. "Let's try and look for Mordecai's chambers, he's gotta be somewhere near the top..." Aemi lead them around the corner and into the main hall. It was bigger than she expected; domed ceilings and a massive balcony up above. There were signs of unfinished construction on the ground floor, clearly workers were reassigned to something else. The hustle and bustle of undead was pretty odd, for an underground syndicate.

Coming up the large dual sided stair-case, Aemi knew exactly where his room should be: Connected to that balcony. As they reached the final step, Cat brushed shoulders with an intimidating looking sort who seemed pissed. With a grunt he turned and watched the pair quicken pace. He could tell something was amiss...

"Ahah, this has to be the one..." Aemi went for the handle, just before a whistle turned them around.

And what business do you two have in there, I haven't seen either of you before?" The man asked with a raspy deep voice. The same 'gentleman' who bumped into cat...
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Hiding in plain sight

choices: "...we've come to fight you! One on one!"
"...Maybe we can strike a deal."
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
The Forsaken laughed, "Did you two honestly expect such weak illusions would be enough to infiltrate our main headquarters?"
He waved his hand over the two of them, and their illusions faded.
"Alright, you caught us. Now what? Are you going to kill us?" Aemi admitted, but the same raspy laughter from the Forsaked was heard in response.
"Kill you? Oh, but you've come so far, you must be DYING to see Mordecai. Come... I'll take you to him personally." He then grabbed both of them by the backs of their collars, and dragged them into Mordecai's room, the door slamming behind them.

"Oh, Master! I've found two people who you may have some interest in!" The Assassin calls out to Mordecai.
Mordecai appears from the shadows, dressed in a very unique suit, with elongated rims. "Well done, Andre. I'll see to it your reward is appropriate, when I am done dealing with these Traitorous Elves." Mordecai dismissed the Assassin, who bowed and vanished.

"Well, well well. If I knew you'd just waltz in here like lemmings if probably justve rigged the entrance. In fact, I either underestimated your cunning, or overestimated your intelligence." Mordecai taunted, grinning wildly.
"Mordecai..." Aemi began.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Caught!

choices: Mordecai's redeath
Aemi's bitter defeat
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"We've come to fight you! One on one!" Aemi yelled, an angry glare in her eyes. "It'll be a duel, you and I, to the death."

"Or re-death, in your case." Cat added, taking a few steps back in fear.

"Very well, little knife-ear, we'll do it your way. Let it be known that Mordecai never backs down from a duel." Spat the undead head honcho. "We'll have It here, and without holding back, no limits." His voice echoed in the stone room several times over. Mordecai opened his palms in wait for her accept.

"Very well." She bowed her head and readied her hands for a spell, glowing brightly.

"Begin!" He shouted, lobbing a pyroblast straight at the elf. Her defensive spell triggering a split second before impact, a frost bolt turning his spell into a wave of vapor. "A good defense young one, but how about this?" A torrent of arcane energy arcing out his fingertips...

The fight escalates over the course of half an hour, Aemi staying on the defensive as best she could, waiting for the perfect time to counter him...
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: A one on one match-up

choices: They return, and find out Sikana's gained tons more weight since they left.
See what happens when the Syndicate finds out the Leader is dead.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"Enough of this Tribble!" Mordecai begins to levitate high in the air, and begins a powerful spell, "This is your doom, Aemillien! Shame it had to end so terribly for you, we could've had everything together!"
Mordecai continued, still channeling dark energy into a powerful, as well as deadly, spell. "All you had to do was give her over to me, but no, you had to play hero and save that pathetic blob of alien flesh! You are a disgrace, you bloody, son of a mongrel!"
Mordecai continued taunting and casting, and Aemi was standing still, while Cat was freaking out.
"Aemi! Why aren't you worried? He's about to blast us to death with a giant shadowball!" He questions Aemi, who calmly replies,
"Don't worry. I have a plan."

Mordecai finally finished his speech, and began to hurl the Shadow Ball, when Aemi began to use the last of her dimensional powers to summon a portal that redirected the spell at Mordecai!
Mordecai could feel his soul being ripped asunder, his pained screeches of anguish only sometimes getting in a "Curse you... Aemillien..."
Cat cheered, "Woohoo! We did it!" And pranced around giddily.
Aemi noticed a staff, with a blue orb attached to the tip. "This must be what Mordecai used to have complete domination over his Dimension... C'mon, let's get back before his Gaurds find out. Won't be pretty." Aemi devised, and she opened a portal to her dimension, now with relative ease thanks to the Dimension Staff, and they both leap in before the portal shuts back up.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Mordecai's redeath

choices: Something wasn't right about Sikana... did something happen?
All is well, Aemi and Sikana talk about her victory over dinner
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
Cat and Aemi stepped through their expert level portal without any disorientation, this staff was great. "Did you see how he blasted himself with that spell?! His whole body practically disappeared!"
Cat cheered, holding up the victor's hand. "Slayer Aemi, the elf who toppled a syndicate!"

"Oh stop it you, I'm a bit more humble than that." Aemi rolled her eyes with a laugh, she even hardly believed it worked. "I'm just glad he kept this loot with him. I was worried we'd have to scavenge for it before the syndicate itself found it." She staff was resonating a deep blue glow, at home in the dimensions confines.

The celebration was interrupted by the sounds of loud munching and a sizeable belch. Sikana was busy while the pair of elves was away... "I'll leave that one to you, I'm going to get some much needed victory rest, after a much needed victory wine..." Cat walked to his tent with a grin, those two...

"I'll catch you in the morning, side-kick!" Aemi waved to him, jogging the opposite way in the direction of the munching.

Sikana was awake and well, helping herself to a 3 tiered extra cream cake. Aemi about fainted at the sight of her blue glutton. "You've gotten... huge!" She exclaimed, observing what's happened since their outing. Her magically imbued bra held a cavernous amount of cleavage, enough to fit a good dozen people inside. She was kept amazingly perky, each movement sending them shaking uncontrollably. Her legs swelled to massive proportions, thick flab making a comfortable seat on the ground, spreading her legs out quite far. Sikana's ass and tail were... to die for. Each cheek well over 6 feet wide each, looking soft enough to sink into. Her tail slinked around half her rear end, thick from tip to base, it connected to her bulging love handles quite well. On full display was Sikana's gorged belly, crowning over her thick thighs, it stuck out a good 17 feet, getting quite wide. Her navel large enough for Aemi to climb in, practically.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: A welcome homecoming

choices: Enter Sikana/Aemi's dream.
Later, when they all awaken...
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
Aemi set up a massive feast for Sikana, and a regular-sized meal for herself. While Sikana dug into her hugely-proportioned meal, Aemi talked about her victory over the Syndicate,
"Of course, there may be a few straddlers still seeking for us, but it'll take them years to find us. There may be only a limited number of Dimensions, but it's not as easy as picking a lock, or finding a key under a false rock." Aemi assured Sikana.
"As well, since the Syndicate is quickly falling apart, they'll be much easier to take on, since they're alone and have no backup."
Sikana got curious, swallowed her food and asked, "What if someone took over the Syndicate? You know, maybe he had a protege to take over if he ever died."
"Impossible. I was meant to be his Protege, and since he was spending so much time trying to kill me, he must've forgotten to replace me." Aemi laughed.
Sikana ate while Aemi continued talking about the Syndicate, and it was eventually halted by a loud snore from Sikana. Not a rude, bored snore, but one of sleepiness.
Aemi smiled, and cuddled up next to Sikana's large, puffy face.
"Good night, Sika. My big, fat Goat-ie."
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Victory Dinner

choices: Accept
Decline
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
With a yawn, Aemi woke, realizing quickly that she was laying atop Sikana's soft belly. Another night of intertwining dreams, she slept great. She found her new staff laying comfortably inside Sikana's deep belly roll. Cat was first to wake up, a message in hand, "Morning sleepy head, we've got some post." He unfurled a scroll of parchment, it looked pretty important and handed it to Aemi. "Sounds like an invitation for a 'thank you' dinner. Guess the Syndicate is happy you killed the blighter, they all hated the guy, or at least so this says. They didn't crumble like you said, instead their new leadership extends an invitation as a was of making amends for her predecessor's actions. They even gave us something to wear." Cat revealed two rather snazzy looking suits.

"Looks like you're right. And it certainly sounds... sincere." Aemi scratched her head in consideration, could they really be doing this? It's a bit quick, though he didn't seem like the best boss... "Alright, what do you think? Check it out quick and then bounce if anything seems off, or just decline. We're not really under obligation."

Cat gave a weak shrug, "I dunno, sounds odd..." he folded his arms over his chest, "But no matter what, I'm keeping this snazzy get-up."
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Later, when they all awaken...

choices: Their Waiter arrives, and already has their most favorite meals prepared.
Before the Waiter arrives, the new Leader pays them both a visit.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"This just seems a bit suspicious. Forsaken aren't the kinds of people to just forgive and forget, especially the Syndicate. What if it's a trap?" Aemi pondered.
Cat laughed, "C'mon, Aemi. You're overthinking it, it says right here that Mordecai was, 'Evil, Vindictive and Cruel', and they're happy! Plus, are you going to give up a free meal?" Cat attempted to convince Aemi.

"...Oh, alright. Sikana, I suppose you'll have to fend for yourself for tonight. I'll leave you with a large meal for you, don't worry." Aemi assured, as she put on her snazzy (Even if a bit revealing) dress.

They headed to the Syndicate's Main Gates, and were greeted with the same guard, who was surprisingly more glad to see them then before.
"Oh! Miss Aemillien and Sir Catsen! So glad you could make it, please come in. We have a BIG surprise waiting for you at the end, so we do hope you stay until the end." He replied, very cheery.
Aemi nodded, and followed the signs that read, "This way to the Dining Hall. Disregard any other doors."

When they reached the Dining Hall, they looked to see nothing but a single table, with two chairs, and a Forsaken in a tuxedo standing by the edge awaiting their arrival.
"Ah... Miss Aemillien. The grand slayer of Mordecai, our previous leader. Please, take your seat." The Forsaken insisted.
They both sat down on opposite ends, and the Forsaken told them their server will be out shortly.
"Well, so far they aren't killing us. But they're possibly just biding their time..." Aemi mentioned to Cat.
"Ah, don't worry so much. It's a dinner in our honor! And all we did was kill some already dead corpse, live in the moment, Aemi!" Cat reassured her. But Aemi still had her doubts that these Forsaken were changed.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Accept

choices: Aemi was right to suspect them
After dinner, the pair is invited to join the hostess on the balcony
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"Alright alright, you win. If anything happens, we're outta here, Cat." Aemi relaxed a bit, she chit-chatted with Cat, sipping on a glass of eversong wine set out for her (Which she made sure wasn't poisoned). Their privacy was interrupted to a loud creaking sound coming from the massive iron door to their right, a large commotion and music was heard from outside, a tall and rather pretty undead strode over to them, rather casually in a tailored suit, showing off her rather curvy figure, uncommon for the forsaken.

"Ahhh, my guests of honor! How're you enjoying yourselves!?" She gave them both a legitimate smile, she seemed in good spirits. "I'm glad you could make it out tonight, the main party is out in the main hall." She clasped her hands together in excitement.

"We've only just got here, your wine is a good vintage, I see." Aemi noted, holding up her empty glass. "I like what you've done with the place on such short notice." She wasn't kidding, it looked great.

"Oh, the pleasure is all mine, ma'am." Cat grabbed the boss' hand and gave her sizeable ring a smooch, someone was kissing up...

The three had some light-hearted conversation for a bit, Aemi found out her name was Larissa Blacksun, someone who rose to power pretty quickly among the ranks.

"Oh it looks like the party calls me back, do have fun!" She turns around and struts back to her festivities just as the food arrived...
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: New leadership

choices: After long negotiations, they come to an agreement.
After a rather short meeting, they agree on Peace, and nothing more.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"Mm, that was delicious!" Aemi confessed.
"Same, can't believe how great cooks Forsaken are!" Cat complimented.
Just then, the Waiter returned with a note, saying that it was from Master Blacksun.
It read,
Dearest Guests,
I wish for you to meet me atop the Balcony. I think we can both strike a sort of deal, and put our previous grudges behind us.

"Well, they haven't lied to us so far... let's not keep her waiting." Aemi states aloud, as her and Cat both head up to Larissa's Balcony.

"Hello, Aemi. Cat. I thought we could come to some sort of agreement, a terms of peace and possible alliance." Larissa explained.
"We'll need to hear your demands. As well, we'll expect you to hear ours." Aemi reminds Larissa.
"Of course, now lets get to business..."
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Personal Summons

choices: Aemi spmewhat got what she wanted, without much to gain or lose
Larrisa got what she wanted, a win win for both parties in the end
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content: Both parties had their own motives to consider during their negotiations. Aemi wanted peace, and perhaps anything that could give them better assurance to their own safety, and perhaps power. Larissa wanted them to work with the syndicate somehow or another, anything to get them to help share the load, she assured them it was a win-win, and the pair didn't have to do anything they didn't agree on. After it was all said and done...
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: A bargain is struck!

choices: Sikana has grown slightly.
Sikana has grown a lot!
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
They both agreed on a simple peace treaty. The syndicate would not go after them, so long as Aemi wouldn't attack the Syndicate They shook hands, and they all went downstairs to enjoy the festivities.

After the party was over, Aemi thanked Larissa for such a wonderful evening.
"My pleasure. And remember, if there's anything you need, the Syndicate will help you, no questions asked." Larissa winked.

"That went better than expected." Aemi said, cheerfully as she prepared the portal to her dimension.
"And you thought they were going to kill us, hah!" Cat joked. "Hope Blubber Girl didn't feel left out."
Aemi smirked, "Oh, don't worry. I'm certain she had plenty to do herself in our dimension."
"You mean 'Eat'?" Cat corrected.
Aemi nodded and rolled her eyes, finishing the portal home. "Let's just hope she didn't take up the entire dimension while we were gone."

When they return...
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Aemi spmewhat got what she wanted, without much...

choices: she was greeted to a fat and happy Sikana.
something was wrong with Sikana!
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
As Aemi and Cat walked through the threshold, there were greeted back into their cozy realm, with chirping crickets and a star lit sky. Cat stretched his arms up high, "So what's the plan now? We've dismantled an evil cult syndicate, proved we're total badasses, and have our very own realm?" The pair walked down the path to their camp slowly.

"Well, I haven't given it much thought, truth be told. I honestly didn't think we'd make it this far." Aemi shrugged, honestly she didn't know at this point. Perhaps invite more people to stay here? Build a safe haven for fellow mages? Who knows. Honestly, her mind was more focused on Sikana t the moment, how was she doing?

"Hmm, I suppose you're right on that front, I was almost afraid we were going to be eaten at some point. And even at the party, I felt queasy around the Forsaken." He scrunched his nose thinking back on it, it was the smell, the smell got to him.

"Believe me, that was one of the first things that came to my mind after betraying Mordecai..." As the two approached the campsite, the only sound beside the crickets was loud munching. "Sikana, we're baaaack!" Aemi greeted the out of sight draenei, picking up her pace a bit. As she rounded the corner...
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: A homecoming

choices: Sikana stopped midway through to talk with Aemi.
Cat talks with Aemi as Sikana eats.
Both elves watch in silence as Sikana eats her massive meal.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"Oh, glorious!" Sikana cheered, jiggling with happiness. "So I take it the party went well?"
"Yep, the Syndicate won't be bothering us anymore." Aemi replied. "And I think I know the best way to celebrate..."

While Aemi set up the celebration feast for Sikana, Cat got into a conversation with the obese Draenei.
"So, is this how you envision the rest of your life? Getting fatter and fatter, in this infinite space?" Cat wondered.
Sikana shrugged, "Well, forever is a long time. While I do enjoy constantly stuffing myself silly, it isn't something I wish to dedicate my life to."
Cat pokes Sikana's large, deep-blue belly. It alone was probably half the size of Stormwind, maybe even more! The belly held up two equally massive breasts, that manages to stay perky and round despite the amount of fat Sikana had gained. Her bubbly posterior had ballooned to two large, soft and puffy cheeks, that you hands could sink into like a gigantic marshmallow.
"Well, it certainly is a BIG thing on your to-do list." Cat joked.
"Oh, shut up!" Sikana responded playfully.

"Dinners ready!" Aemi announced, levitating dozens of plates of food towards Sikana. "Dig in, this food is t going to eat itself!"
Sikana obliged, and began eating all she could.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: she was greeted to a fat and happy Sikana.

choices: She settles the debate
She has a request of Aemi
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"Well, she looks busy now, so Aemi," Cat started, turning towards her, "Do you enjoy fattening her up? Is it a secret..."

"No." Aemi cut him off, a bit flustered, "Well yes, to a degree." Aemi didn't really want to admit that she wanted to fatten up the draenei on her own whim. "But it's not like I'm forcing her, she could easily ask to be shrunken down if she so chooses." Aemi sipped at her eversong wine, talking a bit too quickly and defensively. "Sikana chose this herself, I merely sped up the process... for research." She stated proudly.

"You don't fool me sister, nope." Cat smirked, "You like her don't you?" He leaned down on the table facing Aemi, "Someone really likes her, huh?" He stretched back, "Don't worry, I don't judge Aemi" She returned with a counter, saying it was purely for curiosity.

As they quarreled back and forth on the topic, Sikana had finished her feast and decided to interject...
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Chit-Chat

choices: Aemi evades the question, blushing and getting embarrassed.
Aemi, much like how she responded to Cat, denied the accusation.
Aemi took a deep breath, and finally came out with the truth.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
Aemi was saved from the topic when Sikana asked her for Seconds.
"Of course, Sikana." Aemi replied, carefully navigating her way off of Sikana's massive belly.

Cat smirked triumphantly. "Yeah, it's just dead obvious now."
Sikana looked at Cat with a confused look, "Hm? What do you mean?"
"Well, your feeder over there, Aemi? She's got a total crush on you." Cat rattles off.
Sikana laughs, "Cat, I know she likes me, but not in that way."
Cat raises an eyebrow, paired with a sideways smirk, as if to say without words, "You sure about that?"
"Yep, we're only friends... Right?" Sikana said, now not totally sure in her own words.

Aemi comes back over, levitating more plates of food to Sikana.
But before Sikana digs in, she had to ask, "Aemi... do you, 'Like' me?"
"Of course I do! Why would I be doing any of this if I didn't?" Aemi responded gleefully.
"No, I mean... Like-like me. I mean... REALLY like." Sikana tried to hammer in.
Aemi's gleefulness fell slightly as she responded, "Sikana, what are you talking about?"

"Aemi... Are you in love with me?"
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: She has a request of Aemi

choices: Sikana weighs in on how she feels about Aemi
Follow Aemi as she drowns her sorrow
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"Huh, what was that?" Aemi blushed deep red, she wasn't prepared for this, she was caught off guard. "I uh, well... I like you a lot and..." She conjured a cake in her hand and stuffed it in her mouth, "Well, would you look at that," She scratched the back of her head in embarrassment, "I guess it's time for bed! Sweet dreams everyone and all that, and good work, yeah." She spoke so quickly it was hardly intelligible. She casted a blink spell and disappeared from their vision, Cat looked in the direction of her tent, but only caught a glimpse of the tent flap falling down.

"Well... that was weird... but it only further proves my point, Aemi's smitten, you heart-throb you." He joked, that really didn't help her point. "Did you see the look on her face though? I think that's the first time I've seen her like that." He propped his head up and leaned to the side.

"Well... I had no idea, honestly. I just thought we were good friends, and the feeling was mutual. Never would I have guessed she was interested in me like that." Sikana looked down in thought at her sea of blue flab in contemplation.

"Look at this way butterface, she's been feeding you on purpose, HAND feeding you for some time. Even after we fixed the original problem. And I'm willing to bet that she was thinking about you making all these rash decisions." He narrowed his eyes a bit, "But what about you? What do you want?"

As this was all going on, Aemi was in her tent, laying on the bed with a conjured tub of goblin ice cream, "Ughh, what am I gonna do!" She scooped up a spoonful (She had a tendency to stress eat) "I mean... I have odd feelings that I can't explain, but what does that mean? I don't know anything about romance or any of that." She ate dropper her spoon at the bottom of the now empty tub.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Evasion

choices: Meanwhile, as Cat is trying to comfort Aemi...
Aemi and Cat return to Sikana.
Cat returns to Sikana with some bad news.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
Sikana has been weighed down by, not only her weight, but with the future. Now that Aemi's feelings were practically set in stone, Sikana had to make a tough decision herself.
"Say, Cat? I know I'm not feeling too good, but Aemi could probably use some comfort. Why don't you go talk with her?" Sikana asked. Sikana, truly, was only trying to get some time alone to think, but she didn't want to outright say it.
Cat nodded, understanding the gravity of the situation. While Cat loved drama, romance and other such things, but he knows when the situation is serious, and he needs to just get everyone recollected and on the same page.

"I can't just as well not return her love, but it just is too much... I mean, aside from her being of another gender, it's another faction! I mean, this alone is possibly enough for some form of consequence, but now she's in love with me? How am I going to sort this out..." Sikana wondered, wracking her thoughts and emotions, both conflicting in a neverending war.

After much thought, Sikana finally came to a conclusion, and due to her immense size, decided to simply wait for Cat and Aemi to return.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Sikana's thoughts

choices: You do love her, let's go tell her. You've got nothing to lose.
You need more time to figure it out, or at least hear it from Sikana
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
Cat cautiously opened the flap to Aemi's tent, knowing she can get rather... brash when she's not in a good mood. "Look, I know putting you on the spot was wrong and all... I'm very sorry." As he finished, Aemi was crying, facing the other side of the tent and heard munching on something. Cat tried not to startle her, he inched forward and slowly put his hand on her shoulder.

"Ohhh, *mmph* I didn't hear you" Aemi turned around with a spoon in her mouth and a half eaten tub of ice-cream (With the other one empty beside her). "W-What is it?" She tried her best to hide her binge, to no avail.

"I didn't mean to put you on the spot like that about your feelings..." Cat started, picking his words carefully. "I know stuff like that is sensitive, but you can talk to me about it if you'd like? Despite my normal ways, I'm not that bad a guy." He sat down on the bed beside her.

"Well... I just don't know where to start..." Aemi absently ate another spoonful of her treat as she started to vent about her feelings, "I do really like her, I have odd feelings when I'm around her, she makes me feel... off. But in a good way?" Aemi continued her rant of things she didn't understand, and Cat simply listened, saying simple, 'yeah, I know' and the like when he felt it was needed. It continues for a good while, but she seemed to be calming down.

"See, now it really does sound like...."
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Comfort from Cat

choices: "...I love you, too."
"...I'm going to need a few minutes..."
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"You should just go admit it to her. You've got nothing to lose!" Cat tries to convince to Aemi.
Aemi gets up, and throws down her ice cream, "You're right! I need to get to Sikana and share my true emotions with her!"
And so, Aemi and Cat headed down to confront Sikana. Aemi, who was having a nervous breakdown inside herself, put up a visage of complete control and seriousness.
Cat, on the other hand, had a sense of dread, as after this moment, everything would change.

They both teleported to Sikana's head, and Aemi spoke...
"Sikana, since I've met you, I've felt a great warmth in my body. One that I never felt before, and I now can no longer hold it in."
Sikana gave Aemi a look of confusion, as if she didn't know where this was leading, but in a way, she knew exactly what Aemi was going to say.
"Sikana.... I love you!" She blurts out.
After a long silence, Sikana responded...
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: You do love her, let's go tell her. You'...

choices: Some time with Sikana and Aemi
Fast forward a bit and see how the two are going
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
"I love you, too..." Sikana wasn't entirely sure of herself, but it felt like the right thing to say. All these odd things happening, and she DID like Aemi a lot. Sikana decided it was at least worth a try, if anything they'll stay good friends. Though she's still wondering if it's the right choice or not. Was Aemi that serious about it? It was all so confusing and hard to process.

Aemi's face lit with joy and she cradled the draenei's head in her arms happy to at least hear that Sikana, she wouldn't have known what to do after saying that and being shot down. "I'm so glad you feel the same, you have no idea how nervous I was, I even went to stress eating because of it." She giggled it off, trying her best to not make the situation awkward.

"Heh, well I'm glad you're happy to hear it." Sikana wasn't so sure... but she didn't want Aemi to leave her and Cat, that would be awful! Perhaps it'll be more genuine soon?
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: "...I love you, too."

choices: Aemi/Sikana has been feeling a bit strange as of late.
They both find happiness in each other (END)
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
Many weeks have passed since Aemi confessed her love towards Sikana, and since then their relationship has grown, as well as Sikana's appetite and belly.
She had grown to nearly large enough to fill the entirety of Stormwind, and have some fat seep out over the walls. Her two, massive blue breasts were soft enough they could act as Pillows for Giants. Her face was drowned in a sea of Chins and her two massive cheeks, but she was still able to breath and eat without much difficulty. As well, her massive behind was as plush and luscious as ever.

Cat decided he'd be better off leaving the two "Lovebirds" alone, and so it was only Sikana, Aemi, and their love.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: Weeks later

1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.content:
The two got together great after they admitted their love to one another, both becoming fully open about their 'interest' in Sikana's eating and gaining. Aemi was always at her side, feeding her great feasts and enjoying the show. With Mordecai's staff, she could infinitely expand the realm as she grew. If Sikana ever felt the need to walk around or start over on her great gain, all she needed to do was ask. Over the course of years, they've restarted her gain a few times, fattening without magic, and overall experimenting in ways to bloat the draenei.

Aemi became so adept, she wrote a few books of her own on the subject, in case anyone else wanted to try them out. (Though she did skew the words a bit to keep them from knowing exactly what they did, but that's their problem.) She was even invited to write a few chapters of Conjured Oddities: Culinary Edition and Book of Irregular Buffs for her mastery in an... odd magic. Life was certainly looking good for her.

Sikana was happier than can be, her love of food and fattening not faltering one bit. She cherished her time with Aemi, and the cross faction affair didn't effect either of them in the end. She grew to immense sizes, shrunk down and reached even bigger. All in all, she was the hungriest, fattest, and most well pampered lady in Azeroth, and there's no other way she'd have it!

Cat fared well for himself, not the best in magic, but his Inn became the hottest spot in Silvermoon, always full and lively. He had a good amount of gold to spend now, and even hire his own staff. His humor never faltered in his wealth either. Cat wasn't a stranger to Aemi and Sikana, visiting quite often to catch up.

The Syndicate cleaned it self up since Mordecai was killed. All the goons got great benefits and they didn't even do all that much wrong by anyone. Their leader was bringing them to a pretty good place, the Dark Lady herself recognizing what they were doing.

All in all, the story ended on a far better note than any of them expected, but the results were perfect for everyone involved.
1151212121221211122111211123111111211222.title: An end to a beginning

choices: Finish Plate One!
An obvious warlock of a woman comes to chat!
1151212122.content:
The draenei tried to keep a level head.. She had just plowed through every bit of easily accessible food in the pantry, there's no way she can eat too much more.. right? The chubby draenei grabbed a serving plate and strolled up and down each lane of freshly prepared goodies, getting quite the stare as her little extra pudge was sticking out like a sore thumb. She told herself inwardly, 'Nothing too heavy just yet.. start light, small..' Nodding to herself as she paced herself to the more modest options.

Luckily, the breakfast platters were still quite well stocked, the blue skinned woman leaning forward on her hooves to see each option, a subtle puff coming as she settled with stacking a few fluffy pancakes along the center mass of her plate, finding it'd be a crime not to at least get a waffle with them.. Grabbing a serving fork, Sikana skewered a few hefty links of breakfast sausage, the perfect bit of sear to them, she could hear the things crackling enticingly on the gnomish hot-plate. Following down the line, she set up a good helping of toasted Dwarvish rye toast and Night Elven tarts, lightly sugared with plums, pears, and lemon zest.

Happy with her plate, the draenei affirmed herself with a nod, bringing the piled high plate to her table before politely settling in with a napkin tucked into her collar and a look of almost.. poshness on her face, quite happy with herself for being so well controlled.. despite eating anything and everything without prejudice not too long ago..
1151212122.title: A Primer.. Of Sorts

choices: "Eat all or most of the food in this Buffet, and the Skull will be yours."
"I'll call upon you when you are needed, but for now, the Skull is yours."
11512121222.content:
Sikana patted her engorged belly after a meal well devoured, unbuttoning one of the buttons keeping a tight grip on her chest, allowing her to flow more freely. She smiled, content with herself.
That was when she noticed a robed and hooded figure appear in front of Sikana, who seemed as interested in her appetite as she was.
"Oh, hello!" Sikana greets the stranger, "How can I help you?"
The hooded figure nodded, "I couldn't help but notice your large... Appetite. Was that meal you had truly filling for a Draenei of your size?" The hooded figure asked.
"Oh, yes, I do believe so. But I could still go for some dessert." Sikana responded, not taking much offense to being called fat.
The figure nodded once more, "Well, if you're interested, I've actually been working on a small project that helps people like you fulfill their wildest dreams and fantasies."
Sikana was taken aback, but was intrigued, "My wildest fantasies...? How?" Sikana wondered.
"Simple." The Warlock takes out a small Skull with horns jutting out just above the eyes, "This is a Dreadlord Skull. But within it lies the Soul of a Demon."
"A demon?" Sikana gasped, no longer so sure about this idea, "B-b-but those are forbidden!"
"Just hear me out. I make sure that all of these Demon souls are nothing more than Imps. I just use the Dreadlord skull because it looks cooler. Anyway, if you rub the head of the Skull, an Imp will appear and grant you whatever wish you desire." The Hooded Figure explained.
"So, I'd be making a deal with a Demon?" Sikana asked.
"Not entirely. The only catch is that you can only ask Three. No matter how large or how small the request, and once the Spirit has granted those three wishes... Well, don't worry too much about that. It's just an Imp, what harm could one small, weak imp cause?" The Hooded figure cackled, "Even the simplest of simpletons could defeat one."

Sikana laughed alongside the Figure, her belly jiggling as she did, She got a hold of herself, and continued talking, "Alright, this sounds fine to me. How much are you charging?"
"Not much. I may be a Warlock, but I'm not gonna just throw these out for 1,000 gold or something. A simple task is all I ask of you to complete..."
"And what might that be?" Sikana asked.
The Hooded figure laughed...
11512121222.title: The Warlock Equivalent to a Genie in a Lamp.

choices: "Perfect! Allow me to help with the plates.."
"I'll be back momentarily.."
115121212221.content:
As the figure continued laughing well after Sikana had stopped her little chuckle, she eventually wiped at her unseen eyes under the hood."Ahhhh, right then.. All that's needed is a bit of.. a bet.." Rubbing her gloved palms together as she did so, still eyeing her bloated stomach. Keeping quiet a bit too long as she did so.
"And ehmm.. what is this bet?" Sikana lead on, slightly uncomfortable with her strange behavior.
"Oh yes.. the conditions for such a thing.." Clearing her throat for a moment before continuing, "Well, you'll have to eat every bit of this buffet's food. All of it, or close to it.. I'll be the one to judge that enough is enough." An awkward little giggle rolling out as she continued to rub her palms. "The skull will be yours if you can earn it.."

Blinking a few times, the draenei thought it over, "Erhmm.. it's a strange request, I must admit, especailly from a stranger." Her eyes narrowing on the hooded figure, "But the skull seems quite interesting to at least try for.." Slowly tilting her head from side to side as she thought on it. "Why would you want me to do this?" Sikana continued to eye the warlock with suspicion.
"Well.. I'd just like to see is all." Another nervous, and rather awkward giggle peaking out from under the hood, "No real harm in that, right?" Puffing a little as she spoke.
"I suppose not.." The blue skinned woman gave a low sigh before holding out a hand, "It's a deal then. I'll eat as much as I can." Giving the skull a once over before turning back to the hood.

With that answer, the warlock threw her head back with another practiced cackle..
115121212221.title: An.. Odd Request

choices: "...That was only an Appetizer!"
"...Alright, you've really earned it."
"...Are you sure you don't have room for dessert?"
1151212122212.content:
The Warlock lifted herself from the table, and told Sikana to wait while she took care of a few things. Sikana nodded, and prepared herself for the challenge the Stranger gave her. She rubbed her taut belly in hopes of calming her overstuffed gut, and tried to imagine that she didn't just eat all the food in her kitchen just an hour or two ago, on top of the meal she just had.
Sikana noticed that people were clearing out of the buffet, most likely the Stranger's doing. Maybe she paid off the owner to look the other way while they conducted the bet, or perhaps some form of Mind Control. Sikana would never truly know for sure, but all she could hope is that whatever it was, it wasn't illegal.

As the place cleared out, the Cashier left their station to go and flip the Open sign to "Closed", and locked the door.
The Warlock whisked herself back into her spot, placing herself down on the opposite side of Sikana and smiled, "There. Now there's no one here to ruin our little bet. I've also asked the Kitchen Staff to refill the entire buffet, so it won't be too easy for you."
Sikana nodded, and gulped nervously.
"Oh, you aren't scared, are you?" The Stranger patronized, "I know it looks intimidating, but I believe you'll be able to do it."
Sikana nodded, and when the Kitchen Staff fully stocked the rest of the buffet, the Warlock stood up once more to get food for Sikana, telling her, once again, to wait right there while she got the food for her.

Sikana patted her legs with her hands in anticipation, not wanting to watch the Stranger pile up plate after plate of all the food in the restaurant. It would only make her more anxious and scared, which would not help her in the task. She began to wonder if all of this was even worth the struggle, it was a Demon after all. It might come with some crazy catch that the Stranger refuses to dish out.
Sikana struggled over this for a while, but before she could come to a conclusion, the Stranger returned to place various dishes out, piled with a variety of foods from all the tables. She even had some cups of Water and Milk, to help with eating and to ensure she doesn't choke on the food.
"Dig in!" The Warlock smiled, and sat on the opposite end of the Table, but was unviewable from Sikana's side.
Sikana took a deep breath, and started working on eating. She was eating like she'd never eaten before, grabbing handfuls of mashed potatoes, steaks, even salads, and shoving them into her maw. Her clothing became even more tight as her belly began to fill up with food, she barely even had time to taste the deliciousness of just one type before another handful of food got shoved in. The sounds of linen ripping and buttons popping. all of it was worth it, however, and she was determined to get that Skull.
She stopped midway through to take a large gulp from multiple cups of milk, it was a pleasant break in between the stuffing.
"Please, do not overwork yourself," Stated the Warlock, who was now visible from after Sikana was finished with half her meal, "If you are unable to continue, just tell me. I don't want anyone getting hurt." She followed that up with a wink, which made Sikana a bit worried, but she didn't bother with it and continued eating.

She ate for what felt like an hour, stuffing the last bit of food into her mouth, panting wildly. Her belly was distended beyond belief, rubbing up against the table, her belly complaining that she was in no more mood to eat anything else, not even the smallest pea.
The Warlock clapped, "Good job, I'm amazed at your skill."
"Huff... Am I... Pant... Done? Can I have the skull?" Sikana asked.
"Well..." The Warlock began...
1151212122212.title: "I'll be back momentarily.."

choices: "Allow me to help you finish.."
"Come now.. can't give up when you're almost done!"
11512121222123.content:
The warlock snickered rather loudly as she sat cross-legged on the other side of the table, "I'm not sure if you noted the lack of dessert." Beaming a wide smile. "And I did say clean out the entire buffet.."
Gulping, Sikana rubbed at her cartoonishly bloated stomach, quelling a little burp as she shook her head, "Mrmm.. I dunno if I can do that.." Her eyes heavy, body working her into a partial food coma just sitting there. Her stomach ached and cried out, telling her as best it could that she'd had enough food for the day.. maybe week, but the glutton slowly nodded, "I've gone this far.." Shaking her head before nodding, "Fine, bring out.. dessert.." Panting through her words as she tried to sit up in her seat, having quite the sloshing and gurgle fit in her stomach.

"Ohh, you won't regret it, the skull is certainly worth it.. I assure you." Rubbing her palms once more, she motioned for the draenei to stay seated as she stood and hurried over to the buffet line that she intentionally didn't touch for Sikana's meal. Piling up plates with various decadent and delicious desserts; settling on grabbing the entire tub of gnomish icecream, a stacked human fudge cake, several pies from all around Azeroth, Dwarvish donuts, elven spider cakes.. all of it and more.
All the while, Sikana was left cradling the massive thing as it's overstuffed apex (or apexis, am I right?) curve having ripped the front of her pants clean open, and her shirt wedging under her breast. Giving a low grown, she couldn't even watch the woman pile it the plates high.

After all the preparations were set in stone, the warlock almost skipped back to the table, all giddy with anticipation. "Are you ready for the last course, dear Draenei?" Coaxing her on as she slid the various plates in her direction, an overwhelming sweetness filling the air, almost intoxicating.
forcing herself back up, Sikana gave a low grumble, nodding her head as she slowly pulled a plate of cheesecake closer.. "I hold no promises.." Grabbing a slice of the stuff and topping it with a scoop of icecream before cramming it down her maw, starting to work her pace back into that blurred speed; to out-eat her brain before it forces her to stop.
Each plate started to blur together, every dessert topped with icecream to help it down and chip away at the tub of the stuff. Pressing two donuts in at a time, cramming entire slices of pie at a time, stuffing in spider cakes.. it was hardly recognizable at this point as Sikana devoured everything in sight, her pace starting to slow down again mid dessert. Groaning, she laid back for a breath, panting like mad with a burp following. Before her laid the fudge cake and the half melted bottom of the tub of icecream.

the warlock watched on with bated breath..
11512121222123.title: Best For Last!

choices: Sikana wanted to try out the Skull immediately.
Sikana was too exhausted from all that stuffing, and had to rest first.
115121212221231.content:
The Warlock giggled at Sikana's obvious struggle to finish the meal, she had pity on the poor soul so she used some of her magic to help levitate the food towards her mouth.
Sikana sighed, and opened up her mouth to continue eating willingly. She was eating at a much slower pace than before due to the levitation, but she still ate it nonetheless.
With only a little bit of help from The Warlock, Sikana was able to finish up all the food in the buffet. She belched loudly, which transitioned into a loud groan.
"Ouch... I'm in so much pain... But I did it!" Sikana announced with what little energy she had left.
The Stranger clapped, and headed over to help rub Sikana's belly, "You sure did, and as promised, here is your just reward."
The Skull was placed on top of Sikana's distended gut, and after a playful slap of Sikana's belly as congratulations, the Warlock walked out of the buffet.
"Er... Miss?" A Dwarf tapped Sikana on the shoulder, getting her attention.
"Oh, yes? What is it?" Sikana asked.
"Are ye done?" The Dwarf asked a bit impatiently.
"Oh, yeah, I am. I just need a few minutes..."
"Of course, lass."

After a good couple minutes of Sikana resting off her meal, she lifted herself and her gut from the booth and grabbed the skull, holding it by the eyesockets. She waddled outside, and made a beeline back to her house to try out her new toy.
She wondered of all the possibilities she could wish for with this Skull, assuming it worked the way she expected it to.
Sikana wasn't even bothered by the people staring at her engorged belly, she was too enthralled by the power of the Dreadlord Skull. She was wondering what kind of powers would be in store for such a powerful artifact...

When she got home...
115121212221231.title: "Allow me to help you finish.."

choices: Make the first wish!
Save it and prod the imp for information
1151212122212311.content:
Laying out on her bed in her ill-fitting shirt and busted pants, the Draenei tossed the skull from one hand to the other, contemplating what to do. On one hand.. she was feeling rather overstuffed at the current, and on the other.. she couldn't sleep with this much excitement boiling up inside her. She earned it after all, and she wanted to try out her prize.
Giddy, Sikana sat up in bed, some of the swelling going down some as she let it lay in her lap. "Alright.. let's see what you can do.." The draenei's eyes lit up wide as she started to rub at the top of the skull, careful not to stab herself on the pointed horns. Rubbing harder, she waited for.. something to happen. Holding the skull up with a look of disappointment on her face, "Oh come now.." Rivingit once last attempt as she rubbed with her palm all along the skull till a subtle glow grew in the otherwise empty eye sockets.

"Huh, who's this?" A frail little voice rang out with scartchy undertones, "You have something to say you over-inflated beach-ball?" It's rather obvious it belonged to an imp, and a sassy one as was usual.
"Ehm.. I was under the impression you grant wishes?" Sikana questioned trying to even look for the littel creature wherever he was.
"Well.. you were right. Three wishes is what you get, take your time, I'm only bound for a millennium to that skull." Puffing a sarcastic sigh as he looked at her from the side of the bed.

Taking a moment, Sikana wanted to think about this.. "Erhmm.. well.. let's see what you can do!"
1151212122212311.title: Giving it a Whirl..

choices: Sikana was actually hungry, and wanted to see if what the Imp said was true.
SIkana had to show off this Skull, so she went off to find one of her friends.
11512121222123111.content:
"For my first wish... Hm..." Sikana thought it over, not wanting to waste her first wish on something small. It would have to be a significant change, and she thought she had the perfect one.
"Alright, Imp. How about you help me with my horrible stomach ache?" Sikana asked.
"Lady, have you EVER made wishes before? I can't grant you the wish unless it's preceded with "I wish for..."." The Imp responded snarkily.
"I wish I could get rid of your attitude." Sikana retorted.
"Yeah, that ain't happenin' anytime soon." The Imp laughed, "Just ask for your REAL wish, water balloon." The Imp stated impatiently.
"Fine. I wish the food in my belly would digest already." Sikana wished.
"Alright, let me do my stuff and we'll get started..."

The Skull floated out of Sikana's Grasp and channeled a beam of purple energy into Sikana's chest. Her belly began deflating into a pile of mushy fat, spreading out into the other parts of her body. It kind of tickled Sikana, and she giggled a bit as she poked her belly, now very flabby and squishy.
"Heh, I like this. This feels good." Sikana stated.
"Well, good for you. I made it so that all food, from now on, will instantly digest so you won't have any more feeding cramps in your belly." The Imp explained.
"I guess that's a good thing, but how would I know when I've had enough?" Sikana asked.
"Your own poor judgement, you Space Cow. Now leave me alone for a while, You woke me up from the middle of an important nap." The Imp demanded.
Sikana groaned, this Imp was actually pretty annoying. She nods, and the Skull falls down lifelessly from it's levitating state.
11512121222123111.title: Digestion made easy.

choices: Just deal with the partial nudity for now..
Try and find -something- to wear
115121212221231112.content: Clutching her newfound girth, the draenei felt as though she grew quite a bit.. the entirety of her bloated stomach moving all over her frame, rather interested with the creamy blue fat. From chubby to rather fat, Sikana wasn't exactly alarmed, enjoying the added mass. "This is fantastic!" She called, sitting up as her now food cleared stomach allowed for such a thing. Clutching the skull, she stared at it and tossed it around before standing to her feet.. hooves. "I must show Xunaah! She'd love this thing!" Peering around.. it was obvious nothing she owned was going to fit however.. and this torn shirt that barely kept her decent wasn't going to do at all. Tapping along her chin, she thought for a moment..
115121212221231112.title: Check This Out!

choices: "...We need to study this, we can't waste this opportunity on selfish wishes!"
"...Let me try it out, I wanna wish for something!"
"...You need to get rid of this thing. It sounds dangerous."
1151212122212311122.content:
Sikana knew that this wouldn't do for a social environment, so she went to her closet to search for at least something decent to wear, even if it just barely fit her.
She lucked out, finding an old Hallow's End costume that might work. It was meant to be a crude Vanessa VanCleef costume, fit with Mask and all. She put on the tunic and shorts that matched the set, not bothering with the mask, shoulderpads or even the boots. It did wore much better than her old clothes, and the shorts, while ripping at the seams, were doing their best to hold together, and looked like they would last so long as she didn't put on any more weight.
Sikana looked in the mirror to see how she looked, and saw her fat belly still poked out from the bottom of the tunic, and her cleavage was very visible, but it would have to do until she got bigger clothes.
Sikana grabbed the Skull, placed it inside her satchel, swung the satchel across her chubby shoulder and rushed out to find Xunaah, her gelatinous body jiggling the whole time.

"A demon?! Oh, gosh, you're not pulling my tail, are you?" Xunaah asked, a bit shocked from hearing the story Sikana just told. The two were in a hidden alleyway so as to not draw any attention.
"No lies here, Xunaah. I am in possession of a Wish-granting Imp inside a Nathrezim Skull!" Sikana restated for emphasis, pulling out the Skull from her Satchel. It radiated with Demonic Energy, illuminating the dark alleyway.
"Sikana..."
1151212122212311122.title: Try and find -something- to wear

choices: First wish!
... Second wish?
11512121222123111222.content:
"Sikana.. why haven't you told me you found something so.." Xunaah start, with Sikana interupting her.
"I know I know.. it's demonic in nature, but trust me, it's harmless!" Her voice rather pleading with the girl.
Furrowing her brow, she started again, "I was gonna say.."
"No no.. you don't need to say it; it's dangerous and not worth even humoring." Getting into a bit of a pout, Sikana rubbed up her neck, almost embarrassed with herself.
"Sikana, please. I was just gonna ask why you didn't let me know sooner!" A wide smile appearing on the thin draenei's face, "I'd do just the same in your hooves!" Patting the draenei's stomach, which she was still rather confused about. "And how did you get all this extra- oh forget it.. let me try the thing!" Trying to grab the skull from Sikana's possession all the while. "I have just the idea!"

Trying her best to dodge the assailing friend, Sikana pulled the satchel away rather quickly, "What do you say then?"
Grumbling with a roll of the eyes, Xunaah held out her palm, "Please may I see the skull? Thank you."
Doing as she promised, Sikana gave her the skull..
11512121222123111222.title: My turn!

choices: "To be stinking rich!"
"To be the best chef in the world!"
Some other wish.
115121212221231112221.content:
The Imp awoke from it's slumber once more, "Oh, hey, looks like you worked off all that weigh- Oh. No, you're just someone different. Guess it was just a nice thought." The Imp stated, "Alright, you get three wishes. What's your first?"
"Woah, alright, three wishes, huh? Just for me?" Xunaah stated.
"Yeah, Numbskull, can't you hear? Ears not big enough for your head?" The Imp patronized.
"He's awfully rude, but... Well, what can you expect?" Sikana explained, "Just make him grant a wish quick, he might not be so patient with you."
"Okay, okay... My first wish is..." Xunaah started...
115121212221231112221.title: First wish!

choices: A trip to the store for a grocery run?
Grab some cash for dining out!
11512122.content:
Such an experience! Sikana felt amazing, despite the events that transpired the night prior. The dreams she had! An unexpected treat, and a new experience she was dying to try again! Maybe this planet wasn't so bad, especially if she could enjoy the simple pleasure of eating delicious food without fear of consequence. She had to have more, experience more! The simple idea that there were hundreds-no thousands of foods she hadn't even tried yet excited the draenei beyond compare. If it was even half as delightful as her dream, fel, as good as it was last night, she'd already be full of bliss.

Downstairs the giddy draenei went, clad only in her underwear that did little to hide her chubby form. "This is going to be great!" She barely held in her excitement as she opened the larder doors for something to have... And was created with nothing, "Ahh, I forgot to go shopping again..." Sik grumbled to herself, spirits dropping to an all time low since waking. It was always such an afterthought for her, since she was used to such slim pickings on her home world, buying food to eat was quite foreign. Another reason she attributed to the lack of food was the fact that she was quite picky of the new cuisine... Until recently of course. Despite what the case was, Sikana was faced with a predicament. "What to do, what to doooo..."
11512122.title: A Chance To Binge

choices: An intrigued stranger strikes up a conversation with Sikana.
Sikana's meal arrives, after a few minutes of waiting.
115121222.content:
Sikana was hungry now, and didn't have the patience to head down to the market and determine how much she was going to eat then, and what she'd save for later. She also didn't trust herself not to just devour everything in sight, she felt so hungry.

Sikana put on a Navy Blue Half-shirt, that showed off her rotund belly, and long black pants. She styled her hair in a way that made her seem at least halfway presentable, took her gold, and was off to see what city had to offer.
She made her first stop at a Breakfast and Lunch Restaurant, she found herself a seat at one of the booths and a waiter came up to her posthaste.
The waiter was a Female Gnome, with short, frazzled hair. She had obviously been working for quite a while before Sikana entered.
"Hi, welcome to Spritzgear Eatery, how may I take your order?" She asked in a cheerful tone, not what one would expect from someone who looked so deprived of a rest.
"Yes, I'll have a large pile of Alterac Waffles, with a side of Boar Sausages." Sikana asked.
"The large pile is recommended for families of 4, ma'am. Are you sure you-"
Sikana cut the gnome off, "Yes, I'm sure. Just prepare them for me."
The Waitress nodded, not wanting to aggravate Sikana, "Of course, Ma'am. I'll have your meal up in a few minutes."

As Sikana waited, she played with her exposed belly. It was so large and plump, it made Sikana giggle with each vibration.
115121222.title: Grab some cash for dining out!

choices: Try to politely dismiss the 'guest', I'm here for food!
Listen to Mel's offer
1151212221.content:
From the bar, a hooded figure watched a certain... engorged draenei order and wait for her meal. A rather rare subject, definitely not run of the mill as far as people go these days. Her round pot of a belly, chunky thighs, well fed chest; it all looked like quite the oddity, and it's no wonder it struck a certain onlooker's eye. Picking up on the slightly agitated tone Sikana was dishing out, the onlooker cracked a smile, "Eager as they come." Once the waiter was out of the way, they made their move. Standing up from a metal stool, the figure held a tightly wrapped cloak; revealing the seemingly female form below. They shared the height of your average human, with fiery red hair peaking out just behind the hood's mask of dark. This draenei was worth checking out at the very least, like she observed; an oddity in the common world.

With no regard to manners, the stranger pulled a seat just opposite of Sikana, slinging her elbows up on top the gnomish table with a slight bang, "Well, who're you then? If you don't mind my asking." The observer quirked her masked face to the side in legitimate wonder, her straightforwardness already making itself known, "You can call me Mel, it's what my friends call me." The confusion on Sikana's face was already present before this so called 'Mel' even sat down, her eyes narrowing at the newcomer.
The draenei took a moment to process her visitor's notion, her odd behavior already peaking her curiosity, "Mmm... You can call me Sik... since you're clearly already on friendly terms with me." Sikana cautiously added, giving each syllable a weary drag. "I'm afraid I just ordered my food, if you were looking to share a meal..." She started, giving a returned tilt of the head.
"Oh no no!" Mel interjected, waving her hand back and forth in a dismissing manner, "Not hungry. More interested in you!" The girl gave the quick addition to her already hasty manner of speech, "But if you must know, I'm a researcher!" Mel announced, with a raised finger.
Sikana scoffed, "I really didn't ask-" Her voice cut off by the continued speech of the other girl.
"And I'm looking for someone to help me out, interested?" Mel leaned in closer, a faint wink and smile shining through the mask of darkness over her face.
1151212221.title: An Intervention
