choices: Sikana is met with the bill.
Sikana's belly hungers for more.
11512122211.content:
"I'm sorry, but I'm not looking to get involved in any sort of crazy experiments at the moment." Sikana declined politely.
"Oh, I understand fully. But if you ever change your mind, just look for me here." Mel slid over a piece of paper with an address written on it, and nothing else except for "Mel" written above the address.
Mel then left the table, heading back to where she was sitting early. Sikana got strange vibes from Mel, but she dismissed it as just another crazy cultist or something.

Sikana finally got her meal, and saw the waffles were piled high, almost up to the top of her head when sitting down. She drooled over it as the Waiter poured Syrup over the top, watching it drip off the towering pile of Waffles.
She dug right in, caring not for public decency. She was starving, and she was certain this amount of food would satiate her.
Her belly grows larger, her rear begins to strain on her pants, and she just can't get enough of these delicious waffles.

She finished up her meal, and pats her engorged belly, loving the feeling of an enlarged body figure.
"Woah... can't believe I ate that entire pile..." Sikana smiled, shaking her belly filled with Waffles and Sausage.
11512122211.title: Here for the Food

choices: Dine and Dash
Try and work out a deal with someone?
115121222111.content:
Sikana looked down and admired her handiwork with a smug grin, "Lookin good Sikana, lookin good." She toasted her meal with a large mug of milk, and an equally tall glass of juice, washing down her obscenely large meal with the cold beverages. "Ahh, a complete meal." She smacked her lips together and gave her gut a firm pat. Her belly was nice and round, sated with her enormous meal, one who's portion she'd likely be eating more often now... Sikana took a moment to find her balance and stood up, careful not to bang into the table with either her plumped up tail or wobbling belly.

But before Sik could leave, she realized there was a bill to pay... Sitting back down with a wince, she waited for the polite server girl to return, impatiently swishing her tail back and forth. And before she knew it, the 'energetic little one' returned with a bill in hand, "My my! You finished it, huh? Gotta say I'm surprised." She giggled, "But I do hope you can afford to pay for that family of 6 you fed!" Her giggle morphed into full on hysterics, her laughs resounding off the gnomish metal walls. Sikana simply narrowed her eyes and grumbled, turning away from the mocking gnome.

"Just give me the damned thing." She took the bill from the waitress' hand and scrolled her eyes down to the total as she walked off. "Fifty?!" She pulled out her purse and counted all the gold she had... down to 20. All the food she'd been buying was really adding up, and if she didn't do anything about it, she'd be outta luck... can't pay this now! Sikana's mind raced for a solution.
115121222111.title: Dine and... Waddle?

choices: A few hours pass, and Sikana was finished with her taste testing.
Mel keeps making Sik eat more and more, making Sik keep gaining weight.
1151212221112.content:
"Bit low on cash, huh?" A familiar voice sparked up from behind Sikana.
"Who said that?" Sik wondered, looking around her. Her gaze finally took her to behind her seat, where on the booth opposite to her was the hooded figure.
"I could spot you 30 gold, if you'd just take part in a few small tasks." Mel said in a sly tone.
Sik didn't want to get involved in any strange experiments or situations, not until she became accustomed to the Azerothian Lifestyle, and also keep her good looking figure.
"...What tasks?" Sik asked the figure, sounding genuinely intrigued.
"Oh, nothing 'Big', heh. I'm just opening up a small bakery, in Old Town. I need someone to come over and Taste Test some of my delicious goods." Mel explained, "It'll only be for just today, but if you like it enough, you could become a permanent employee."
Sik pondered her situation, but it didn't seem like she had much of a choice. It was either accept the stranger's offer, or be kicked out of this restaurant permanently, so Sik accepted the Figure's offer.
"Glad we could do business." Mel smiled under her hood, and dropped 30 gold pieces into Sikana's hand as she walked out the door.

Sikana found Mel's Bakery, it was amazing she did, though. It had a similar structure as every other house in Stormwind does, the only thing that was different was the sign outside that read "Mel's Bakery". It didn't have that fancy a name, but then again, wasn't that fancy a place. Sik entered, and saw a Human Female wearing an apron that showed off her cleavage running the stand.
"Hello, welcome to Mel's Bakery, how may I-" Mel began to greet, until she realized who she was talking to, "Oh, hello Sik. Glad you didn't just walk off on me."
"I'm a Draenei of my word, now can we get started?" Sikana asked.
Mel chuckled a bit, "Right down to business with you, huh? Alright, follow me."

Sik was lead to the back of the Kitchen, where she was placed in a bright, colorless room with a single light illuminating a rectangle jutting out of the ground.
"I've hired engineers to create this feeding chamber. I will periodically lower food onto the table, and you must eat as much as you like. If you eat a lot, you like the food. If you don't eat a lot, you don't like it. Pretty simple, right?" Mel explained to Sik.
"Alright... how long will this take?" Sikana asked.
"Depends on how fast you eat." Mel jested, and left Sik alone in the room.

The first thing that lowered into the room was a pile of Chocolate Cupcakes. This was no problem for Sikana, and she began eating them right away.
They were very good, it came as such a surprise to Sikana that she began eating them as rapidly as the Waffles from earlier.
Mel recorder her data on a piece of paper, enjoying what she saw.
Sikana didn't realize, but there was an enchantment on the food she was eating. Well, two actually. One made her have lower standards for food, making her think anything edible was as delicious as chocolate cake, and another that made her metabolism lower, so she gained weight more quickly. This was all part of Mel's plan.

Sikana finished the cupcakes, and licked her fingers, "Ah, how delicious. Was that it?"
"Of course not. We have a few more to go." Mel called over the speakphone, and dropped a large chocolate cake.
Sikana licked her lips, and began eating that cake once more.
1151212221112.title: Return of Mel

choices: Huh? That's all?
I'll keep it in mind.
11512122211121.content:
Mel's cake was delicious, there's no denying that. Sikana greedily ate all that came in front of her. The quality was impeccable, partly due to the initial love put into it, and partially due to the experimental drug she'd been unknowingly fed. Mel watched from behind a hidden window, those gnomes really outdid themselves! And a sweet deal too, the treats she prepared got pre-loaded and lowered on command, giving Mel a superb chance to watch her handiwork in action. She leaned over the feeding console to get the closest possible view, her grin growing wider and chuckling like a madwoman. Once the cake was gone, Sikana gave a burp, "Mm, got anything else lined up?" She actually enjoyed the 'job' as it were, good food and good pay!

Mel awkwardly straightened herself up, picking up the mic, "Uhmm, let's see..." She looked threw the list on her clipboard. The food ranged from your average sweets to the far more exotic. To blatantly unsweetened carbs that looked like cookies. Sikana would eat anything at this point, and all the drugs she specially packed in the cupcake and chocolate cake was enough to make anything mouth watering. "Got some... eclairs! Fresh out the oven!" She cheered, selecting the sugary treat on the console's menu and hitting 'send'. Down came a tray of pretty looking eclairs, practically oozing cream. "Pretty proud of these, tell me how they are! Or show me, that works too." She giggled over the mic before shutting it off, returning to her viewing position.

Sikana devoured everything and anything Mel sent her way. It took a good two hours for the 'baker' to empty her stock, feeding every last scrap to the fat draenei. "That's all I've got, my friend! You've cleaned me out. But I must admit, it's very clear that you've loved everything I sent your way." Her voice grew as cheery as it was fast paced. Sik's belly was positively round, stretched full with all variety of sweets. Mel didn't dare send something less tasty... at least not yet. "Your debt is paid and your free to go as you please! But remember, come back any time!" She switched a lever on the far side, the table razing back up, and the chair forcing Sikana to her feet... err, hooves.
11512122211121.title: Consider Your Debt Paid!

choices: Sikana has a strange dream.
Sikana wakes up the next morning... and somethings a bit off.
115121222111211.content:
"That's it?" Sikana asked.
"Yep! You can go now." Mel repeated.
Sikana was so wrapped up in eating, she had no realized how much she truly did. But she was still hungry, how was that possible?
She left out the front door, shaking her now massive belly. "I can't believe how much I ate..." She sighed, her belly now overstuffed beyond reason.

"Maybe I should go back there... I loved the food there, and I could use the extra cash." Sikana pondered.
"But... I'll get so fat..." Sik counters herself, grasping into her large belly.
She was conflicted. She loved the food, but she ate so much there, she'd gain so much weight...
...But was being fat all that big a deal?
She wasn't having any trouble moving around, or getting places. The stares haven't bothered her much, mostly. She enjoyed the free attention.
Sikana wondered what she should do, until she came to the conclusion that she'd return tomorrow, and see if she still liked doing it.

But for now, she wanted to do something other than eat. She wanted to experience Stormwind, while digesting her large meal.
She made her first stop at the Cathedral Square, where she struck up a conversation with a Priest. It was mostly about the Light, and what it was, and how they used it to heal and protect others. She even learned the difference between Paladins and Priests, and how their holy strikes damage others, and how Priest holy strikes heal others.
It was really eye opening for Sik.

But, eventually, the day had to come to an end. Sik headed back to her room at the Inn, and noticed her belly was fully digested. She shook it, causing it to jiggle. Her belly was nearly twice the size it was when she woke up in the morning, and she considered that a good thing.

She slipped into her Underwear, which were straining against her weight, and laid herself to sleep.
115121222111211.title: Still hungry

choices: Explore with a morning walk
Pull out Mel's card again...
1151212221112112.content:
Sikana woke up slowly. She had a comfortable night to a day of... activities. Her rest was great, she was perfectly awake and invigorated, but despite all that, she didn't feel like everything was... right. She couldn't put her finger on it. She inspected her body, nothing new... nothing quite different in any way. She just felt... weird? With a slight delay, she went to her dresser for some clothes, best get ready for the day, even if she wasn't quite sure what it was she was doing. She slipped into a tight fitting 'crop top' that only concealed her impressive bust, leaving her bare blue gut on display for all to see. "Feels great..." she murmured, rummaging through her bottoms drawer for something decent to wear. A pair of leather chaps that were seemingly perfect for her, despite no recognition of buying them. With a shrug, she pulled them on, their substance enhancing her curvaceous figure.

There was something off... Sikana would never know, but someone was in her room the last few hours. That feeling of strangeness was that of an intruder snooping around. The perfectly fitted pants were a prime example, planted by the mysterious invader. Eventually Sikana would notice more things showing up without any explanation, but that was for a later time. For now, Sikana had to figure out what was she was gonna do today. She slipped on her most comfortable shoes and stood up to make her final choice.
1151212221112112.title: Not quite right...

choices: Sikana finishes her meal, and orders seconds.
Sikana is interrupted by someone.
11512122211121122.content:
Sik looked back at Mel's card from her old pant's pocket, and realized there was new writing on it. No doubt from the mysterious stalker.
'Now that you've have a delicious first taste, why let this opportunity go to waste?'
The strange rhyme was fun, but she was a bit startled. Was this writing on the back of here before? She let this slide, thinking it was just something she missed from earlier. Strange coincidence she managed to see it now, though.

She headed out the door, mindlessly wandering outside to see where she would be led to.
The first place she ended up was at the same Restaurant she was at yesterday, it was as if some force brought her back here. But, since she had no money, she couldn't as well pay for the meal.
"Oh, hello!" The energetic Gnome from yesterday greeted Sikana from outside the restaurant, "A friend of yours came over earlier, and she said that all your meals here are on the house from now on."
Sikana was surprised, "R-really? Well, if that's the case, let's see how much I can eat!"

Sikana was certain this was the work of Mel, but she loved this place to bits. To now be able to eat what she wanted here for free? This was a dream come true.
Sikana ordered double of what she got yesterday, and the Gnome smiled and got right on her order.
"I wonder why Mel is going through all this trouble to make me happy... it's as if she wants me to fatten up." Sikana pondered, but then she shrugged, what's a few extra pounds gonna do, anyway?

Sikana got her meal, and the Gnome smiled and flew off to another table.
This time, Sikana got two plates of towering Waffles instead of one, and there were Chocolate Chips inside, too! This was too good to resist, and she began eating the two piles at the same time, her belly growing once again.
11512122211121122.title: Pull out Mel's card again...

choices: The new stranger has a similar proposition, threatening to cut off Sik's freebie
The stranger just wants to chat, do some fact finding on the glutten
115121222111211222.content:
Sikana was once again the sore thumb in the restaurant, just as before. She really didn't mind though, her clothes were fit for just that purpose, she was grabbing eyes left and right. Her top and pants were perfect, and since that dream she FELT perfect. She couldn't help but admire her physique as she waited, she felt like a goddess, just as she was. And the meal she ordered was one fit for a goddess too. She pinched and prodded at her soft tummy, giving a playful giggle.

At the bar... once again... a hooded figure sat in watching. This one a bit more curvaceous and tall than Sik's last visit. She watched Sikana very similarly to how Mel did, dressed in similar clothes. The figure returned to their drink, waiting instead for Sikana to at least be occupied with her meal. Whoever it was, it had to be connected...

Whoever set up the deal with the gnomes must have gotten extra because they came out double time, taking 4 gnomes to bring out all the food and deliver to her table. The draenei looked on with wide eyes; an impressive serving, even for her. As soon as she was free of their presence, Sikana dug straight in with no abandon, with more furiousity than ever before. The drugs Mel gave her certainly didn't wear off... driving Sikana into an all out feeding frenzy. The generous portions started their disappearing act. Her belly already growing rounder and tighter by the minute...

The figure stood from her stool, the target well engrossed with her meal and prime for approach. As she stood, her height rivaled that of Sik, and her legs bent in a very similar fashion, a little white tail coming out the back of her tight armor. Her walk was for more elegant than that of the stuttering Mel, and lead to more of a saunter. She took a seat right next to Sikana and introduced herself, "My name's Nalaa, and I know you as Sikana." She bluntly stated to the feasting draenei beside her. The stranger's eyes shown bright through her hood, as every draenei's did. "You can tahnk me for the free meals today... and for the foreseeable future."
115121222111211222.title: Again? Really?

choices: Yes
No
1151212221112112221.content:
The Stranger sat down on the chair opposite to Sikana, "You know, this can be normal for you. These free meals, you obviously love them to bits."
"Oh, really?" Sikana looked up at Nalaa brightly, but then gained a suspicious look, "...What's the catch?"
"Nothing much... all I need from you is to come help with Taste Testing at Mel's place... permanently." Nalaa spoke, the last word picked up a bit more emphasis in her voice.
"P-Permanently?" Sikana's eyes grew wide, "I don't know... I eat way more than I should there..."
"Is that not what you do here?" Nalaa gestured toward the empty plates on the table.
Sikana was stumped, "...I suppose I do, well, I guess I could try it out for a few more days."
"Hm, I knew you'd see it my way." Nalaa said, similarly to how Mel stated it yesterday, as she sauntered out the door.

Sikana headed back to Mel's Bakery, having some trouble fitting her stuffed belly through the door.
Mel wasn't there, but there was a sign that read, "On break. Will be back at: 5:30."
It was 5:00 when Sikana came, so she would have to wait.
Sikana decided to take a look behind the counter, and saw a bunch of the regular stuff you'd see behind a counter, bills, paper, display objects, but one thing certainly caught Sikana's eye. It was a leather tome, with the words "Journal Entries" written on the front. Dare she read?
Sikana decides one small peek wouldn't hurt, so she turns to the first page...

Day 1:
Hah! My own Bakery! I knew this day would come, and I'm going to make people happy with my delicious baked goods. I can't believe how cheap I got this lot! Must be because Old Town is right by the SI:7 "Hideout"... seriously, do they know that Hideouts are supposed to be Hidden? Sheesh... anyway, I'm certain everyone's going to have a blast here!

Day 2:
No customers yet, but I'm sure people will come by soon!... I hope...

Sikana skips ahead

Day 6:
Why isn't anyone coming? I advertise everywhere I can, I stand outside and wait for customers, but... No, no, I'm sure they'll come soon. Probably having trouble finding the place is all. Maybe I should start handing out my address to people...


Sikana begins to feel sad for Mel, maybe this is why she's been feeding her so much. Because she wants justification that her food is good.
Does Sikana read on?
1151212221112112221.title: Not so free as she thought.

choices: Continue the test record to find out what happened to the Alchemist
Follow Sikana as she checks out Mel's bakery
11512122211121122212.content:
As Sikana read on, her heart felt for poor Mel. She's this awkward little sweetheart, "D'aww... she's so cute!" She couldn't help but ration Mel's behavior, the first few entries were just so sad... She almost felt bad for opening it up. Sikana put the journal back where she found it, innocently smiling at the thought of such a cute person. Whatever Mel was doing, she was sure it was only for the best. If she were to flip a few more pages however...

Day 9:
The feeding chamber is finally ready. those damned gnomes got it down quick, and I honestly can't complain. Managed to lure one of the installers in before they left, got a good test out of it. She tried to refuse at first, but I managed to ensare her with my magnificent charm *Wink*. The little one tried my food and loved the first few batches, but got too stuffed to continue. Had to let her go, sadly. I need something to keep em comin back...

Day 13:
I hired some draenei alchemist to help me out with that formula I thought up. She seemd to enjoy the idea, too. I didn't tell her what it was for, but I knew she suspected something (Those space goats really are pesky?) but I can't let her catch on... what if she tells someone? Ugh, this is making me queezy... I think I'm due for another test. **And by that I mean on the alchemist. Just for clarification.

Day 17:
Final stalk-I mean tracked down that alchemist. Turns out she was at home the whole time, the tricky wench. But anyway, I staked out her porch and waited for hunger to inevitably settle in, when she had to leave her dwellings in search of sustenance. So here's what I did, it's pretty genious so follow long; I stuffed a doughtnut in her mouth and knocked her out with that blackjack I built yesterday. Testing starts tomorrow! Bright and early.

Day 18:
Primed and ready to go for stage two of the operation. That slithery draenei is strapped to the chair with those new cuffs I installed (did it myself, yep.) and there's no way for her to escape! My secret is safely hidden here. Got MOUNTAINS of food ready for her last night, and put all sorts of her formula in it. She's in for a treat... (And not just my baked treats; the figure of speech kinda treat.)
11512122211121122212.title: No

choices: Continue with what happened to the Alchemist Draenei.
Mel enters the Bakery, calling out to Sik, as if she knew she was there.
115121222111211222122.content:
Sikana continues to search through Mel's Bakery, the door to the Feeding Chamber was locked, so she was limited to what was in the room.
It was a fairly small area, a quick touch of the food behind the display cases would prove to show they weren't real, just rubber molds. It was a tad confusing, but Sikana had a feeling Mel had a good reason. She'd have to ask about it later.
It hadn't taken Sikana long to realize the area Mel chose wasn't kept in that great condition. It was mostly wooden, and seemed really... makeshift. It was amazing how Mel could afford to allow a single Draenei free meals at a restaurant, yet can't afford a good looking bakery. Heck, the room she was fed in looked better than this.
She took a look inside the Kitchen, and noticed most of the equipment in there was old, as well. Seemed like it hadn't been used a day in it's life.
"How can a Bakery have fake food, and not have use for even an oven for this long?" Sikana thought aloud. This was getting weird, she hoped that, when Mel returned, she'd have a reasonable explanation for most of these questionable things she was spotting.

But then, she found something very interesting.
"A potion...?" Sikana wondered, and she read the label: "HUNGER ENHANCEMENT"
This was some damning evidence that something was not right at this Bakery, if it even was one at all. Sikana became very worried, had Mel been playing her for a fool this whole time? Did Mel use this on her? These questions were becoming more and more erratic in this young, obese Draenei's head.
But one question that was on her mind, that seemed the most troublesome... What is going on in Mel's head?
115121222111211222122.title: Follow Sikana as she checks out Mel's bakery

choices: Keep on reading, uncovering all the juicy details
That's enough, I really didn't need to know
1151212221112112221221.content:
The best way to figure out what Mel was thinking had to be in her journal. Those seemingly 'cute and innocent' pleas for customers were hiding an obvious dark side. Behind the awkward girl mask had to lie someone far more devious... right? "Maybe she just has... personal projects?" She shook her head, there's not exactly an easy way to rationale these sort of findings. One thing was certain, she had the means to build a feeding chamber and produce these academical additives. Racing back up to the front of the 'store' or whatever it really was, Sikana slipped the leatherbound book back out and flipped open to the pages she skipped, tracing her fingers under each line, quickly getting the story behind Mel's hidden alter-ego... at least she hoped it was.

Reading up to the section about the gnome worker was enough to make Sikana's spine shiver, but upon reading the bit about an alchemical project was enough to make her heart race. She quickened the pace, eager to hear what happened to the poor alchemist...

Day 19:
Didn't get any sleep last night. Waaaay too much excitement! That draenei really proved her skills in that formula! It worked like a charm; after four helpings of doughnuts jam packed with the stuff, her stomach was growling 24/7, begging for more! Guess it really enhances the flavor too, because I hardly had to sweeten them. Once I fed her that cake... it was on! I put the highest dosage in that baby and let me tell you... ohhh that metabolism was non-existent! Anything that went in after she was finished slowly grew on her frame right in front of my eyes! Poof, she was getting fatter! Those are some good results! More to come tomorrow!

Day 20:
Barely got a nap; had to bake some more stuff. She outpaced me, no matter how subpar the food was, she'd eat ANYTHING I lower in there. No use having her restrained now either, I don't think food ever lost space in her mind. Maybe I shouldn't put so much in like that... No matter, the oaf wrote it down before her unfortunate 'disappearance', as it was written in the papers anyway. It's easy enough to replicate. Wish I could compliment her on it, but well, she's too preoccupied to take note. More tomorrow, hopefully a littttle break of action for some sleep?

Day 21:
Did some digging on the lass. Looks like she's got quite the pretty penny stashed in her house. Alchemy is booming these days; I wonder who farms for her? But anyway, the good news is that I can run my shop for a good few years now, plus supply all the food and hunger supplements I need. Speaking of which; the next time I bring a test subject, I need to make sure and limit the dosage. It's no fun if food's the only thing on their mind... though it makes for quite the spectacle. (Oh that belly of hers...)

Day 22:
I can't keep up with all this cooking, buying, crafting, etc. This alchemist is getting to be really high maintenance, and I don't know how much longer I can keep this up. Gotta find a 'permanent solution' for her before I'm dry. Drugs are great miss, but you failed to warn me of the side effects. *Sigh* This is why you ended up like this.

Day 24:
Sorry journal, I had to skip a day on account of the search to rid myself of the test subject. I'd have liked to been friends with her, but she knew too much, and the dosage was really getting to her. For security reasons however, I can't disclose what happened to the fatty; no way I can get someone reading my journal and learning this secret, nope!

Day 27:
Found a new potential subject... one I won't mess up on. She was eating at the local tavern last night and peaked my interest. You'll like this one, journal; a real looker she is. Ate like she hasn't seen food in years! Followed her to her bed after she waddled to her room. She didn't notice me, but I DID get to inject that mood altering stuff in her; help her enjoy the big things in life; like big plates and dinners and such. Hopefully something comes of it!
1151212221112112221221.title: The Missing Alchemist

choices: Sikana starts the "Taste Testing", ask questions later.
Sikana decides to ask a few more questions before starting.
11512122211121122212212.content:
The rest of the pages were blank, obviously that's where the entries ended. Sikana was afraid, very afraid. What happened to the Alchemist? Would a similar fate befall Sik when Mel was through with her?
She couldn't as well ask Mel these questions, she didn't want to admit she was going through her private stuff. But this all seemed so strange to her.

That's when a bell chimed, the Front Door had opened. Mel was probably back.
"Hello? Anybody here?" Mel called out, noticing some things were out of place.
"Um, yeah, hi. I'm back here, just taking a look around." Sikana responded.
"Alright, I just had to run to the Market and get some things. We can get started in a moment!" Mel explained, as Sikana heard her putting away some things.
Mel looked under her desk, and noticed that her journal was gone. She entered the Kitchen, and looked at Sik, "Have you seen my Records Book?" Mel asked, giving the journal a fake name.
"Oh, uhm, no. Sorry." Sik said, hiding the book hastily behind her flabby back.
"Ah, well. I'll search for it later." Mel smiled, and guided Sikana to the back.
"Say, Mel?" Sikana asked.
"Yes?"
"Why does everything here seem so... old?"
"Well, you know I have to get things for a bargain. This is decent on my salary." Mel explained.
Sikana felt a bit more at ease, at least that explanation made sense. She didn't want to ask any more questions as of now, or else Mel might get suspicious.

A similar situation was placed before Sikana, another pile of Cupcakes stood before her on a Rectangular Table in a pure white room.
"Alright, Sikana, we may begin when you're ready." Mel stated.
Sikana wondered if this was the right decision. If she should go through with it now, or try to buy more time. It was inevitable she'd end up eating all of this, but she wanted to know more...
11512122211121122212212.title: That's enough, I really didn't need to ...

choices: Mel plays off answering more, edging Sylvia to just do it
Mel humors Sik, answering all her questions, absorbing the praise
115121222111211222122122.content:
Sikana eyed the food, and despite how mouthwatering it looked and smelled, she turned her head away. The draenei was still extremely curious as to Mel's explanations. There were still questions to ask, the trouble comes in asking them right. Sik didn't want her host to know she was snooping around, after all. Just thinking back on what the alchemist's sentence was. She probably wasn't even that inclusive, and look how she ended up...

The fat draenei stretched her arms, "So how'd you build this fancy chamber? Looks like it has enough tech to drop an engineer's jaw." She tried to throw in some compliments, maybe that'd make her less suspicious?
Mel tuned I over the intercom, "Ohhh, you know..." She tried her best to sound mock humble, "I do tinkering in my spare time. When I'm not baking, I'm building!" She stopped to fidget with her machine, "Goes to show just how much this place is a work of love, right? Put my heart and soul in it, I did!" Mel's fast pace speech started to waver, "Oh okay... I had the gnomes help me out. The local tinker's guild came by to guide me through a lot of the processes, but it turned out pretty, didn't it?"

Sikana nodded in 'admiration', "That it did! I'm impressed you could make all this, I feel so pampered!" She chuckled, her mind wondering to the though of an alchemist being in the very room not too long ago... "Say, your recipes! How do you make all your chocolate taste so good? You'll have to teach me how!" If anything, Sikana was just buying herself some time, despite the hauntingly good smell on the table.
115121222111211222122122.title: Just For Clarification...

choices: Sikana went asking around Stormwind, but was unable to find help.
Sikana was stopped by a familiar face in the middle of her quest.
1151212221112112221221221.content:
"I'd love to tell you, but that's a family secret. I will give you a hint though, it does have a "Secret Ingredient" that isn't found in any other foods I've, nor possibly you've, ever seen in our lives." Mel explained, "Now, enough chitter-chatter. Let's get down to the stuffi- I mean, Testing."
Sikana, while she still had questions, realized the communications device had shut off, and asking anything more would be a waste of time. Besides, she'd probably be able to ask as many questions as she wanted afterwards.
Sikana took one bite into the Cupcake, and she went back into a similar craze for food as she was last time, forgetting about what happened to the Alchemist, about her worries and Mel, and just started eating all she could.
"Works every time." Mel smiled, leaning back in her chair, "For a minute, I thought we'd have a problem."

The process from the other day continued, cakes were devoured, Eclairs were splattered everywhere messily, and cookies were chomped and chewed quickly. Sikana grew fatter with each bite, her belly expanding at a rate that pleased Mel.
"It always just takes a little push in the right direction." Mel laughed, sipping a glass of milk as she watched Sikana eat and grow.

What is wrong with me? Sikana thought, as she shoved more food into her mouth, I shouldn't be doing this, but... my mind says keep going. This must be the work of Mel... but how can I stop it?
Sikana couldn't think right now, so she had to wait until she was done eating.

When she finally did, she fell on her plush rump, and rubbed her engorged belly. She felt so full, and Mel only congratulated on her second day on the Job. Sikana then heard footsteps leaving the room, and entering the room she was currently in. Mel aided Sikana in getting up, and as she was about to ask another question, Mel quickly swifted her out the door.
But luckily, Sikana kept a hold of Mel's journal. She'd probably be able to find someone who knew this woman, or even the Draenei who came to help her.
1151212221112112221221221.title: Just get to it, already.

choices: Her friend Alyssa, a night elf local she met when she first arrived
Her sister, whoa been working for the local guard. She has connections!
11512122211121122212212212.content:
Now, Sikana wasn't exactly the best person for searching. She wasn't a local; I fact she only recently got here. She got lost just going to the store, let alone search for some hidden leads that were hard to find for someone who's lived here for decades! Her odds weren't looking great. And as she aimlessly wondered the streets of Stormwind, it became more and more apparent.

Now, say she does track down the mystery lady from earlier. Here comes a fat draenei who looks nothing like anyone else on the street. People who weren't well muscled in these turbulent times seemingly didn't exist. If they didn't want to be found by Sikana, they'd see her first and bolt. How could she chase someone on the run? It didn't add up.

The draenei was at her wits end, all the facts of the matter were baring down on her the more streets ahe turned. "Guh, this is hopeless..." Sik moped, hanging her head low. She took a moment to rest, a seat on a stone bench outside the Dwarven District. She looked up at the sky, leaning back against the wall, "I dont know what to do." She admitted. Little did she know, help was just around the corner... And quite literally going to bump into her...
11512122211121122212212212.title: Hey! I know you!

choices: Mel (Or one of her "Friends")
Zeyana.
115121222111211222122122122.content:
"When I get to Stormwind, I'm not going to be the same lazy, chubby Draenei I was back on Draenor. I'm gonna be someone!" A mocking voice came from behind her back.
Sikana was a bit shocked, not expecting anyone to be nearby, and then gained a face of annoyance when she realized who she was talking to...
"Sigh, hi, Zeyana..." Sikana greeted in a mopey way.
"Aw, cheer up, Sikky." Zeyana took a seat next to her now obese sister, "At least you find doing nothing but eat and sleep fun. All I do all day is just walk around telling idiots where to go..."

Zeyana was a more dark-skinned Draenei than Sikana, her face was covered by the Helmet she had to wear for duty, but underneath was a smooth face, with long tentacles, and wild, pointed hair.
"So, that whole diet didn't work out after all, huh?" Zeyana laughed, poking her sister's belly.
"Not entirely... I got roped into being a Taste Tester, but I have a feeling the Chef is trying to fatten me up, in a Bad way." Sikana explained.
"Well... shouldn't this be a dream come true?" Zeyana asked, confused.
Sikana shoved her face into her palm, and handed over the Journal she had.
Zeyana read the entire thing, and when she finished, she was surprised.
"By the Naaru... you were right to inform me about this, Sikky. Can you show me where she lives?" Zeyana asked.
"No! I can't take you there, she'll know it was me, and she might..." Sikana trailed off.
"Do what?"
"...N-nothing, I know she works at the Bakery in Old Town. Go there, and you'll probably find her."
"Thank you, I'll bring over a few of the guards to this Mel's place and we'll make sure everything's fine." Zeyana patted Sikana on the back, "Don't worry, after this is all over, I'll help you get back on track with your diet."
Sikana hugged her sister, "Oh, thank you, Zey! I knew that you'd help me out."

Sikana, for the rest of the day, was in a pretty good mood. While she didn't want to lose her belly entirely, she felt that the overeating had to stop. This was just too much at once, and she worried about Immobility, as well as what Mel had in store.
That night, while Sikana was getting ready for bed, she heard a knock on her door.

It was...
115121222111211222122122122.title: Condescending Sister

choices: She found something before she left...
Came straight back to see Sikana
1151212221112112221221221222.content:
Sikana hurried to open the door, eager to see who it was. Hopefully it was Zeyana, coming to tell her the good news; Mel was finally locked up and given due punishment! She smiled in anticipation, practically skipping to the door. "One moment!" She called, unlocking the several new bolts she applied to her door (She got a bit paranoid when she moved into such a big city) and swung open the door.
The sight she was greeted with was not expecting. Before her was her sister, the part she did manage to guess, but the whole bit about capturing Mel didn't seem to pan out... Zeyana wasn't looking like her normally fit self... She looked far softer, chubby even. An obvious pot belly was poking through the gaps in her armor, and her breastplate looked like it was about to burst off. She held her helmet under her arm and looked rather pissed. "C-Come in, sis." She gestured to her couch and opening the door wide. Zeyana obliging with a huff.

"I suppose I owe you an explanation." She huffed, sitting down on the couch in more of a crash. "And even if I don't, this is what happened, and if you laugh?" She looked her sister dead in the eyes, "I'll destroy you." She leaned back and gave a large, angry sigh. "To start with, all the guards were out on a bust in Old Town. Big stuff. I cold skip out, said I had a personal call to investigate. They let do it and all that, but id be going alone. Stupid me though, and I underestimated what I'd find." With another sigh, Zeyana lifted her feet up on Sik's table, her sister taking a seat across.
"So, when I get their l, I'm face to face with a 'Out on errands, be back soon' sign. And naturally I thought it the perfect opportunity to check things out, snoop around and all that..." She rubbed her temples in irritation, "I see what I assumed to be that chamber she described in her journal. Now... I know it sounds stupid... But the smell was unbearable in there... But in a good way. On the table was a moooound of cakes, never seen so much sugar in my life!" Her voice begun trailing off, "Something compelled me to take a little bite, see what all the fuss was about. And before I knew it I was shocking it all down until the plates were cleaned. And by that, I mean I licked em clean." Zeyana looked ashamed, trying to avert her sisters gaze. "Maybe it was a security measure... Or something..." She slumped back in her chair.
1151212221112112221221221222.title: Not As Easy as it sounds...

choices: Zeyana is waiting by the Gates, as the note said.
Sikana was tricked by Mel, it's an ambush!
11512122211121122212212212221.content:
"Before I left, however, I did bring back a little something..." Zeyana then reached into her satchel, and took out a potion vial labeled "HUNGER ENHANCEMENT", the same one Sikana saw when she was poking around.
"What will we do with that?" Sikana asked.
"It might be a stretch, but I recognized the label on the Vial. She was very popular on Draenor, Mel must've gotten a hold of her while she was in town. But with this, we can find out where she lived. If she ran a business, no doubt this marking should be on her building." Zeyana explained.
"Ah, so it's an adventure!... Oh, but it's a bit late for that, don't you think? Let's start up fresh tomorrow, huh?" Sikana asked.
Zeyana nodded, "Of course. I just wanted to make sure you were up-to-date with current information. Anyways, I'll see you tomorrow!"

Sikana waved goodbye to Zeya, as she got ready for bed. But something that was unknown to the two Draenei, is that Mel had once again stalked Sikana home, and knew all about their little plan. However, Mel had a few tricks up her sleeve. She swore to herself that, this time, when Sikana entered her Bakery, she'd never leave.

Sikana woke up the next morning feeling the same as she did yesterday. Feeling as if something were off, but this time it was a bit more apparent. There was a note left for her on her bedside, it read:

"Dear Sikana,
I came by earlier, but you were asleep, so I decided not to wake you. When you wake up, meet me by the Gates of Stormwind. I'll be waiting for you there, don't take too long now!

~ Zeyana"


It felt like weird writing for her sister, but she believed it and started getting ready. She got out of bed, only to notice her belly was much larger. The digestion made it fat, and jiggly. It was now a bigger burden than before, but Sikana was determined not to miss out on this.
Zeyana wasn't a very patient Draenei, and it'd be even less likely for her to wait up for a Very Obese Draenei.

Sikana put on a large T-Shirt that covered up only half of her enormous belly, and shorts that unintentionally showed off more of her buns than she'd like.
She was then out the door, her fat jiggling with each step of the way.

When Sikana reaches the gates...
11512122211121122212212212221.title: Small piece of evidence

choices: The trap is sprung!
Sikana
115121222111211222122122122212.content:
The way towards the gates was about as annoying as it normally was, though with her newfound weight, it was an even bigger burden. Sikana found herself shoulder to shoulder with many of the street's pedestrians. The sidewalks were rather cramped as is, but with an extra 'oomph' added to her figure, Sikana was having to force herself into pretty much anyone within 3 feet of her. Gnomes didn't see it coming as her doughy belly bumped straight into the backs of their heads, humans treated to a faceful of cleavage, or a bit of a sink into Sik's love handles. As she walked, countless people brushed past her or outright crashed into her, but it couldn't be helped...

Stormwind was a busy place full of impatient denizens, but Sikana managed to get through it in one piece. As she got through the gates, she pulled off to the side, off the road bustling with mounts of all varieties, carts, and wagons. "Why do you even ride your Gryphon on the ground?" She fussed, seeing a bunch of half bit adventurers riding their flying mounts on the ground despite their obvious wings... she turned and left, cursing under her breath and giving her hair a flip, moving off to the clearing just off the road that the note had drawn on the back.

The sound of traffic was still present, but not a soul was within sight, the treeline blocking out any prying eyes... perfect for Mel, who laid in wait just over a small hill.
115121222111211222122122122212.title: Sikana was tricked by Mel, it's an ambush!

choices: See what Mel has in store for Sikana
See what surprise is waiting for Zeyana.
1151212221112112221221221222121.content:
Just then, while Sikana was waiting like a sitting duck, she was ambushed by two hooded figures. A bag was shoved over her head, and she was tied up with rope. A LOT of rope, since Sikana was a rather large Draenei.
"Hey, what's going on? Let me out!" Sikana yelled as she tried to resist the ambushers.
Mel laughed, and gave Sikana a swift whack across the head with a club to knock her out.

The two hooded figures and Mel then rushed away with Sikana, leaving the scene without a trace.

When Sikana woke back up, she was in a not-so-familiar place. It looked like a dark, empty cellar. Cobwebs everywhere, not very clean.
"Ngh... Zeya?" Sikana asked, as she regained consciousness. But all she was greeted with was a smiling face of Mel, who she now could see was standing in front of many hooded figures.
"I suppose you'll be wanting an explanation... well, it's a long story." Mel stated coyly, "But I won't get into it now. Let's just say that I didn't open up this bakery to make a profit off of delicious treats. Well, it was at first, but after a while I had to make a few, let's say, adjustments?"
"Mel... why are you so interested in making me fat?" Sikana asked, even though she knew the answer wouldn't be pretty.
"Why? Well, let's just say after I, heh, had my fun with that Draenei Alchemist, I grew a lust for it. I loved feeding people into helpless piles of fat. What I do is fatten people up to impossible weights with the Potions and Machines my colleagues have given me, and then I capture their soul to work for me, and the process repeats." Mel states, gesturing to all the hooded figures.
"So all of these hooded things are...?"
"Souls. The Souls of those I've fattened up, and robbed of their lives." Mel finished Sikana's thought.
"What do you do with the bodies?" Sikana asked.
"Well, they're kept alive in a state of constant hunger. Magic is certainly helpful to create a constant stream of food, I occasionally revisit them to play with their heaping piles of fat. It's like a giant mountain of gelatin, it's so fun!"
Sikana felt very dirty after hearing that, and didn't want that to be what remains of her on this planet.
"Zeyana will come and save me, I just know it!" Sikana stated.
"Oh, that's very unlikely. At this point she's probably halfway to that old Alchemist's place, and we have a little surprise for her there, as well." Mel laughed.
1151212221112112221221221222121.title: The trap is sprung!

choices: Go in through the greenhouse
Go in through the front door
11512122211121122212212212221212.content:
Zeyana was more than a little bummed when her sister didn't show up to go over to the alchemist's house. Considering that it was her who drug both of them into this... Strange and fattening case. Though with or without her laze of a sister, the draenei had to get there and find out what happened. With a huff, the draenei hopped on her guardsman's steed, adjusting the plates and mail of her armor so that they didn't pinch her newly acquired pudge. "Hiyah!" She shouted, snapping the reigns and kicking her hooves back. The mount galloped full speed down a cobblestone path, her location marked on her map...

It took nearly an hour, but Zeyana managed to make it near her pinpoint. All the while she was wondering what Sikana could possibly be doing to warrant her not showing up... Maybe she was captured, kidnapped, attacked? She threw around the idea back and forth, but the house she was looking for was right in front of her, forcing her to focus on the mission at hand. Appeared to be a semi-large farmhouse design. A large botanical greenhouse attacked on the side. The brush and overgrown crawling plants were already claiming the domain. A door looked like it was forced open in the front, and based on the plants creeping in; its been a while. Whoever broke in sure didn't mind waking the alchemist at an unreasonable time... Or breaking and entering. The draenei hopped off her mount, tying it to a hitching post out front.
11512122211121122212212212221212.title: See what surprise is waiting for Zeyana.

choices: Up the Spiral Staircase
Through the door.
Investigating the main entrance room.
115121222111211222122122122212121.content:
Zeyana tried the front door, but it was bolted shut with wooden planks. No matter how hard she tried, she just couldn't remove the planks of wood.
"Come on, Zeya! You've fought worse foes than this, don't let these planks of wood get in your way!" Zeyana roared, but it was no use. She'd have to find another way in.
Knowing this Alchemist on Draenor, she always kept her Greenhouse door unlocked. Zeya would have to hope and pray the same principal applied on Azeroth.
Thankfully, it did, and she was able to enter Greenhouse. It was actually quite larger than the Greenhouse she had on Draenor, with all sorts of different plants she'd never seen before. Strangely enough, though, it seemed like that the Greenhouse had been kept in good condition despite nobody living here for several weeks.

Zeyana continued to walk through the Greenhouse, searching for a door somewhere. As she did, she noticed the labels of different plants on Azeroth that the Alchemist had collected over the few weeks she was able to collect, she had plants such as Khadgar's Whisker, Peacebloom, Goldclover, and many others.
But something strange was happening, the vines around the Greenhouse began shifting around. They began to take a strange form, that of a humanoid figure.
Zeyana was enthralled by the strange plants, and was curious as to what was going on.
That's when the figure began to speak. It's eyes glowed a deep evergreen, and spoke...

"Draaeeenneeeii..." It spoke, in a hushed tone.
"Um... hi?" Zeyana responded, feeling weird at the situation.
"Wwwhhhaaatt aarreee yoouu dooing heeerreee...?" The Plant questioned.
"I'm looking for any signs of an Alchemist who lived here, do you know her?" Zeyana asked.
"Ssshhheee iiisss nnooottt heeerrree... Aannnyymmooorree..." The Plant answered, creepily.
"Um... do you know what happened to her?" Zeyana asked, now a bit more worried.
"Lllleeaavvee... thhisss... pllaacceee..." The Plant told her.
"Not until I see what's inside!" Zeyana stated.
"Ttthheeennn tthhhiisss pplaaaccee... shall beeee... yooouurr toooomb..." The Plant roared, and sent vines grasping at Zeyana's limbs.
Zeyana evaded the Vines, and used her sword to cut apart the vines.
"Yooouu cannot escaaaaapppeee!" The Plant threatened, and began shooting balls of liquid poison at Zeyana, which she deflected with her shield.
She charged at the living plant, ripping it to pieces. The last thing the plant did, was sputter out, "Yooouuu... shhhaaalll... jjjooiiinn... heerrr... sssssoooooonnn..."
"What the hell was that about?" Zeyana wondered.
She thought no more of it when she found the door allowing her access inside the house, so she could investigate further.

What Zeyana didn't see though, was an Arcane Eye viewing her actions within the Greenhouse. It was Mel's, and the living vines was one of her traps.
Mel wasn't scared, though. She expected Zeyan to get through the first trap, she had many more planned for her along the way. After all, this tower was large! She had plenty of opportunities.

Zeyana entered the Tower, and saw the entrance. Vines that were holding the door shut were now lying dead on the floor, withered.
"At least I can get out now, but that'll have to wait. I have to search the rest of this house..." Zeyana stated, and looked around. In front of here were two possible directions, up a spiral staircase that lead to various rooms on the way, or directly in front of her was a doorway that lead to different rooms.

Zeyana decided she'd start...
115121222111211222122122122212121.title: Go in through the greenhouse

choices: Kitchen
Trophy Room
1151212221112112221221221222121212.content:
The guardswoman tapped her hoof against the stone floor, "Now... I could go up and check if there's any clues..." She folded her arms under her chest in an attempt to figure this out with minimal loss of limb, "But, if what I need is right in front of me... I'd have wasted all sorts of time AND have to hike down those damned things..." She shuddered at the thought, seeing the winding staircase reach up into the darkness it went so high. The Door in front of her seemed viable enough, and didn't look like it was going to blow up at a moment's notice, "Alright, I take a quick check through here, see what I can find and book it back!" She decided, inspecting the room she was standing in. The connecting hallway was lit with the warm glow of a torch, potted flowers and vines lining the walls, "Makes sense for an alchemist... I suppose." Zeyana shrugged, turning around some, a wall of scuffed up frames, pictures of a dark skinned draenei posing in front of various landmarks (at least the ones she could recognize from her time on Azeroth) and plants with a smile on her face. The sight of the missing alchemist made the guardswoman frown a bit, seeing such a cheerful person just up and disappear.

Finding this room was as safe as she'd get, Zeyana noted to return here after each round of exploration. "Alright... here goes nothing!" The draenei gathered herself in a defensive stance, readying her shield for whatever could be on the other side. With a gulp she reached her arm over and pulled down on the handle, the click sounding fairly normal, slowly pushing the door open with a cliche creak, "Damn..." She muttered under her breath, seeing a torch light up... well whatever it was she was looking at, the vague shapes of the room not amounting to much at first glance. Putting one hoof forward... still clear... Zeyana gave a sigh of relief, pulling her shield down some and stepping into the room, just as the whistling of darts came shooting out of the darkness, "WHOA!" The expertly trained woman pulled her shield right back up to feel hard tinks and thuds crash and bounce off her steel. A full volley heading her way, a bead of sweat dripping down her forehead as the stream slowed down, a stray dart shooting straight at her leg!

Zeyana gave a loud gasp, looking down in horror in what might be here last moments on this earth- but quickly breathed easy, the dart sticking straight out of her plate leg guards. "Whew... thank the Naaru that didn't hit," She cooed, the whisking of arrows and darts coming to an abrupt halt. Zeyana pulled the dart out of her legplate with a loud huff, the thing a good 3 inches long and sharpened to an outrageously fine point, "The vines were at least semi-interesting!" She panted, still recovering from the near heart attack rush.

With all imediate threats dealt with, Zeyana got a better look of the room now that she was actually inside it, "Wow, this is quite the lavish..."
1151212221112112221221221222121212.title: And Behind Door Number 1...

choices: A Cake
Big Elekk Steak
11512122211121122212212212221212121.content:
"Kitchen..." Zeyana stated, looking around the magnificent-looking kitchen. Despite there being barely any light sources, the appliances within the Kitchen were radiating a silvery glow. It was quite beautiful.
She had to search around for any clues, and be careful in case any more traps could be sprung. It was honestly a surprise for Zeyana that this Alchemist would keep her house so protected, a Vine Guardian, a Dart Trap? None of this seemed right for such a cheery, bright individual. It's as if someone didn't want her in here, to find anything.
She searched through the cupboards, and only found baking supplies, normal for a kitchen. She searched in the oven, and even the Refrigeration device, but there wasn't anything out of the ordinary. Except for the Fridge, which had nothing inside and wasn't working properly.

Zeyana was just about to call this place a bust, when Mel placed her next trap. The Oven began heating itself up, and the scent of a delicious aroma began filling the air.
"Hm... odd, I don't recall seeing anything in the Oven. Wait, why is it turning on anyway?" Zeyana wondered, heading over to the Oven. She opened the hatch, and saw a perfectly cooked Turkey. It seemed like it was coaxing her to eat it.
Zeyana glowered, "If you think I'm going to fall for your tricks, you crazy... House! I'm not." Zeyana yelled into the empty house. She left the Turkey sitting there, as she walked off to the door.
But the door locked behind her.
Zeyana tried to burst open the door, but it was a fruitless task. She was certain the door was open earlier, but somehow it managed to close and lock itself.

"Oh, come on..." Zeyana groaned, "This house is going to be the death of me!"
Just then, the house began to shake momentarily, which triggered her to yell, "I DIDN'T MEAN THAT LITERALLY!"
Zeyana looked behind her, and some smoke faded on a counter. A note appeared from the smoke, and it read...

"A Magic Oven is the key.
Accept it's offerings and you will be free."


"So, if I eat all of the Oven's food I'll be free...?" Zeyana asked herself, and looked over at the oven, "I guess I don't have a choice, really... Besides, I didn't have time to eat before I left today."
Zeyana went over and took the Turkey out of the Oven, looking at it's perfectly cooked meat. It looked great, so she had no real reason to deny free food. But she couldn't let this house overtake her.
She ripped off a leg, and took a bite. She chewed, swallowed, and let out a satisfying "Mmmm... That's good!"
She began eating it more swiftly, actually thinking the Turkey to be delicious. When she finished, she patted her stomach, leaving nothing but the bones.
Zeyana let out a belch, and asked, "Alright, Oven. Is that all? Can I have the key now?"
Of course, it wouldn't be THAT easy. The Oven let out a puff of black smoke, and revealed a....
11512122211121122212212212221212121.title: Kitchen

choices: A Stocked Desert Tray!
A key!
115121222111211222122122122212121212.content:
The oven coughed up it's plume of black smoke, being sucked into the vent above it, "Oven, you better not have some sort of beastie in there or soemthing, because I haven't known you long enough to trust you..." The draenei narrowed her eyes, slowly inching back up to the thing, holding up her shield juuuust in case. Her keen eyes watched carefully as her hand slowly reached out... curling her fingers around the handle-and throwing down the hot door and ducking her head below the edge of her shield, half expecting some sort of food monster to come out and suck her in the oven. But luckily it was just the hearty scent of a perfectly grilled meat, the draenei peeking over the curve of the steel to inspect the contents.

Inside was exactly what the smell promised; a succulent, tender, mouthwatering Elekk steak... glistening like a beautiful untouched gem, meat perfectly cooked to Zeyana's exact specifications. As though it could read her mind... But before the guards-woman could question the strange contraption, she put aside her sword and shield, slipped on the oven mitts, and grabbed that masterpiece out the oven. The scent alone was calling to the draenei, "By the Naaru... if that isn't the absolute... -perfect- cut of elekk.." Her mouth watered just looking at it, forgetting her stomach was still visibly full from that whole turkey. The steak even had a knife and fork stuck in it, as if it just invited Zeyana to eat it...

And that she did. The draenei digging in like a ravenous beast, cutting off massive swathes of the monster steak, easily weighing a good 7 pounds, "Mmmmpphh; oven, you sure do know how to... grill a steak?" She thought for a second; "Why would an oven be able to grill such a damned good bit of meat?" But the thoughts were fruitless, resulting in a quick shrug to resume her feasting. "But don't think we're on good terms, you key holding..." Zeyana grumbled through her steak, nearly finishing the whole thing already, her stomach packing past it's normal full limits, looking almost humorously round on her figure.

And before she knew it, Zeyana had conquered the oven's second champion, dropping the fork and knife on the plate it came on, tossing it on top the one the turkey came on. The draenei licked her fingers clean of all that juicy goodness, patting her stomach, *Urp* "Well fought steak, but I win this round." She returned her gaze to the oven, "Have you another challenge, or are you just gonna sit there like a hunk of junk?" Pointing accusingly, and as though in response, another cough of black smoke poofed out the cracks of the oven door... Inside, Zeyana found-
115121222111211222122122122212121212.title: Draenei Vs. Steak

choices: Keep the tight-fitting armor on, better safe than sorry.
Remove the armor, the armor won't be much use now anyway.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121.content:
There appeared to be a tray of delectable desserts. A pie, a big Sundae with tons of toppings and flavors, a Triple Layered Cake, decorated as such to celebrate a momentous occasion with many different toppings on it as well, and surrounding the feast was a circle of cookies.
"I suppose I'm gonna have to eat all of this..." Zeyana groaned once more, "I don't know how much more of this I can take... but I need to do this to escape!"
She starts off with eating the cookies, her stomach began to ache, but she had to push through.
But when she finished the third cookie, she couldn't eat any more, her stomach was way too full.
"Owwiee... My stomach hurts so bad, I can't keep eating like this!" Zeyana spoke in a pained voice. But then she remembered, she had a vial of a strange potion with "HUNGER ENHANCEMENT" on the label.
She checked, and there was a small amount left in it. She could use it, assuming it worked, to just get through this last challenge. If there was more, she'd have to resort to more shoving.

She downed the vial, hoping it wouldn't kill her. The minute she swallowed it, it made her feel like she hadn't eaten a thing for hours. She looked at the now delicious pile of sweets with a gluttonous grin, and began to devour it all as fast she could.
Her stomach no longer felt stretched, but instead more doughy. The fat began digesting into her weight, and she began just gaining weight as quickly as she was eating.

She finished her delicious dessert, and fell down onto her now fat rump. It was now she broke out of her glutton trance and realized what'd happened, she had gotten fat!
"How did this happen?" Zeyana asked, not realizing she had just eaten 3 full meals in a row.
But how it digested so fast, must have been the Potion she drank.
"Just that little bit made me eat this much, and become this obese blue blob?" Zeyana asked, shaking her jiggly belly, "No wonder Sikana's been putting on so much weight, Mel must be force-feeding this stuff to her in her food."

Zeyana got back up, and realized how tight her armor was on her. Her fat was poking through, making her a very easy target. She did have some clothing underneath, but even the slightest bit of protection could be the difference between life and death in a strange Tower like this.
She decides...
1151212221112112221221221222121212121.title: A Stocked Desert Tray!

choices: Ascend The Stairs
Inspect The Entrance
11512122211121122212212212221212121211.content:
Zeyana gave a deep frown, "Just that little bit of potion... you've gotta be kidding..." The draenei pinched at an inch of fat squishing out between her plates of armor, "This has got to be some sort of joke." She pinched harder, hoping it was some sort of hallucination, but a sharp pain reassured her it was very much real draenei flab. With a slight grimaced on her face, Zeyana planted her hands on them doughy hips, "Mmph, well I won't let a few extra pounds slow down this Stormwind Guardswoman; nope!" She nodded her head resolutely with a huff. Despite how tight it was, those darts were reason enough to keep the plates on, because who knows; those could've easily been packed with enough poison to make her shrivel up like a husk! "I shiver at the thought!"

Zeyana gaze her doughy belly another squeeze before returning her attention to the task for hand; pudge can wait! And with another final huff, the draenei walked over to the oven, banging her fist over the oven, "Alrighty, gimmie my key!" She fumed, banging her plated fist loudly. And as if the contraption was submitting, another sickly black cloud of smoke erupted inside, the heated draenei pulling the door straight down and reaching inside, pulling out whatever was inside.

Zeyana found herself holding a brass key with a note wrapped around the shaft, slipping it off she wasn't feeling the least bit amused

Your fill you have eaten, the key is yours, but will you find what you're looking for?


The draenei read the note slowly several times over, narrowing her eyes over the last bit, "Okay oven, what's your deal?" She kicked her chubby hoof against the grill in anger "Ugh, I don't have the time to deal with you..." She stormed off, curves shaking through the gaps in her plate armor. The kitchen was only accesable through the door she came in, furthering her frustration, "I didn't find a -thing- AND I porked up." The draenei whined stomping back to square one.
11512122211121122212212212221212121211.title: Don't Forget Protection

choices: Cast an Arcane Image of the Alchemist to take the Cookbook from Zeyana.
Recharge the Vine Guardian with Arcane Energy, making Zeyana fight it again.
115121222111211222122122122212121212111.content:
The entrance was barren of anything of interest, just a circular rug in the middle, with the entrance to the right of her and the bottom of the Spiral Stairs to the left of her.
Zeyana decided the best thing to do would be to start ascending the stairs, despite the darkness startling her a bit. There had to be something this house was trying to keep her from finding, and Zeyana would find it.
She began climbing the stairs, each step causing the wooden planks to creak. She wasn't sure whether this was due to her weight, or the age of the stairs, but she could feel the steps under heavy pressure. It made her worry they could give way at any minute, and the longer she walked, the more dangerous the fall got.
It seemed like the Tower steps went on forever, maybe it was like Karazhan Tower, where it was bigger on the inside. Either way, she had been walking for nearly thirty minutes with no sigh of a door or a floor.

But finally, after what felt like an eternity, she found a stone platform that lead to an entrance to a different room. She wiped her brow, thanking the Naaru that she didn't need to keep walking up these stairs.
There was no door, it was just a stone doorway, with two styled pillars on either side. On the top was a label of what room she would be entering, and it read, "Potions and Elixirs".
"Well, this should be an interesting room." Zeyana said to herself, and entered the door.

Within the room, there was exactly what she expected; Rows upon rows of Potions, each of them labeled and, which many were similar color, each had a different shade of that color. No two potions were exactly the same, some had green with purple swirls, and some had strange particles within them.
Zeyana rattled off a few names as she passed by them, "Elixir of Dragon's Breath, Potion of Water Breathing, Potion of Masterful Intellect... This Alchemist really had a lot to pick from."
Zeyana reached the end of the lines of Potions and Elixirs, and finally reached the end. There seemed to be a gap in between two potions, and realized that's where the Hunger Enhancement Potion was meant to go. What was strange, is that there seemed to be a button on the spot the potion would be.
"Hm..." Zeyana thought, and took out the empty Potion Vial. She placed the potion on the button, but nothing happened.
Zeyana felt that was a bit unfulfilling, she thought it would've done SOMEthing. She looked at the back and saw a plaque, another riddle:

Once all the Vials are filled to the top,
Then the stairs ending will soon show up.


"I don't think Top and Up rhyme..." Zeyana mentioned, noticing the strange form of riddle.
She didn't think much of it, because it did tell her what she needed to do. She had to refill the Hunger Enhancement potion, and she didn't think it'd be as easy as filling it up with water. It probably meant the actual potion it stated.
So she removed the vial and took it with her downstairs, which actually took only a few seconds. She must've truly been going up an endless staircase, and this was the only way to rectify it.
She went back into the Greenhouse, in search of a cookbook of potions and elixirs to learn how to make this potion.

She trudged through the dead vines, once a beautiful vine Guardian, now nothing more than a heaping pile of grass. She kind of felt bad, it just wanted to protect the Greenhouse from intruders. Zeyana promised herself she'd make up for it once this was all over.
Zeyana kept looking around, and soon she found it. The Alchemist's Cookbook. She flipped through the pages, and landed on a page that seemed to be the Alchemist's handwriting, must've been her own unique recipe.

Mel, looking through the Arcane Eye, noticed that Zeyana had found the Cookbook, this is what she wanted.
Mel decided to lay another trap for Zeyana, in an attempt to get the Cookbook and collect the Hunger Enhancement recipe she so desires...
115121222111211222122122122212121212111.title: Ascend The Stairs

choices: "I Suuubmiiiit!"
"Ovvveer Myyy Shriiivvveellleeed Huuusk!"
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
Mel sat behind the foci for her arcane eye, rubbing her scheming hands together, "Ohhh, what shall I do with you?!" Her manic laugh echoing off the stone walls, the crazed woman hunched over the only light in the room, "Should I shut the greenhouse doors and poison you?" Mel shook her head, "No no, that's not fun. Hmmm..." She tapped her fingertips together, hoping an idea would come, "OHhhh! Oh oh!" The human gasped, "I know! I'll pump that little weed full of arcane go-go juice and take that draenei captive! Or just leave her... details details!" Mel readied her spells, looking through the arcane eye in order to direct the energy. The valves for watering the plants slowly opened up, a light sprinkle of water pouring through the shower-heads...

Zeyana felt a sudden spray of water from above, tossing her shield above her as quick as her body would allow, "Back beast! I'll tell you what's what!" With a shout she waited for a returned roar, blood curdling scream, disgusting gurgle; anything really. But none were to be had, leaving the bloated draenei to lowering her shield and watching the 'automated' showerheads water all the plants, luckly the book was covered under a cover tarp, the table staying perfectly dry. Zeyana walked back over to the book, scanning over what she needed. "Ahhh, so a bit of this..." She scanned around the place, hoping she could recognize what each plant looked like. "You!" She called, reaching over to snip a few leaves of kingsfoil, "Some of yoooouuu..." The draenei turned around, plucking a stem of Fireweed, bundling it with the other herb. "A few sanguine hibiscus and..." The guardswoman kept up with her scanning and plucking, trying to gather up all the herbs she needed, which was honestly quite a lot. "Suppose if you need something that makes you... need a lot of something, you need a lot of something to go in...?" Zeyana shook her head, leaving the thoughts of an alchemist to an alchemist.

All the while, Zeyana was oblivious to the pile of vines she chopped up earlier, their shriveled husks blossoming back to life. Mel had poured arcane energy straight into the empty dead vines before starting the watering process, giving the blossoming creature a far more empowered structure. The vines gathered to form it's humanoid shape once more, though looking more like a chubby female than anything else, the freshly watered plants giving it an added boost to size, "Oohhhhhh drrraaaeeeeneeeeiiii...." The voice spoke, coming off stronger than before.
Zeyana turned her head around fast enough to almost snap her own neck, "What did you just say, you..." She gulped, seeing the vines back to full strength, the entire side of the greenhouse engulfed in flowering vines.
"I tooooldd yooou you woould finnnd nnnoottthhing..." The creature gave a deep laugh, lashings of vines balling up.
"Y-You shut your trap, you overgrown weed!" Zeyana dropped her herbs, pulling her sword and shield out, ready for the attack.
"Yooouuuuu willll beeee miiinnneee!" The vines hissed, a rope of them lashing out to strike at Zeyana's primed shield, a large thunk of steel n heavy bark.
"Not in your dreams!... You don't even dream!" The draenei shouted, an undercut slash coming from under her shield, lopping the head of the vine off and stomping forward at full force, her added bulk making for a lot more draenei to charge, sending her jiggly bits bouncing all over, not to slow the rage filled warrior though. "RAAAaahHHh!" She shouted, swinging her blade every which way, some connecting, others slashing at the air, it made no difference for her.

The vine creature was actually caught off guard, finding itself pulling back to escape the draenei's 'weedwacker stance', balling up vines to protect herself, trying to send a rogue vine to creep around the advancing warrior.
"I'll show you, you... you over-glorified defense system!" Zeyana was nearing the chubby plant itself, "Submit now or face my fuurrrry!" She shouted, practically frothing at the mouth, her blade inches away from the Vine's 'neck'. Because despite the creature's willingness to attack her, she didn't want to cut the thing down without a second... third chance. "Help me make this potion, and we can go our separate, not dying ways!" She shouted as her final offering.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: I Live, I Die, I Live Again

choices: ...Decided to play along, and gave Mel a fake recipe.
...Didn't want to play by this Elf's rules, and fought her way out.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
"IIII Willl nnooott.... fffaaaill... Massstteeerrrr!!" The Vine roared, and used a vine to trip up Zeyana, causing her to fall on her back. The vines twisted around Zeyana's limbs, and acted as makeshift bonds to keep the Draenei tethered to the ground.
"Ngh... Must... Escape..." Zeyana struggled, wriggling around on the tight constricting vines.
"Will.... Nooottt... Essscaaappee..." The vine guardian spoke, in the same, snake-like tone.
Just then, the face began to twist and form into a hole, and an Arcane Eye flew in to be perfectly slotted in.
"What the... huh? Was that thing watching me this whole time?" Zeyana wondered, as the the face of the Vine Guardian began to project an image of... an Elf!

"Hello, Zeya!" The elf said cheerily.
"Mel!" Zeyana growled, "Are you behind all this?"
"Well, not the Vine Guardian. I merely brought it back to life after you killed it." Mel explained, "I wish I was this good!"
"What do you want, you fat-loving monster?" Zeyana demanded from Mel.
"Isn't it obvious, I'm here for the potion. Now, tell me the recipe for the Potion and I'll let you go. Otherwise, well... I guess I'll just let Ms. Vine here finish her job." Mel demanded.
"I won't! You'll just use it to fatten up my Sikana, and other unwilling races!" Zeyana roared.
"Yeah, that's kinda what I do. But it's not my actions that matter now, it's yours. Now either give me the recipe or face the consequences!" Mel demanded.

Zeyana...
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: Live and Die for the Master

choices: Mel goes off to brew up her potion...
Mel suspects foul play
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
Zeyana struggled and grunted through the choking vines, the added tightness of the armor already wasn't helping much either. "Mmphh, you think that'll stop a proud guard of... Stormwind?" She coughed, dropping her sword and shield on the ground, wriggling around like an overfed worm. She gave a huff, seeing the futility in her actions, "Alright, maybe that will stop me." She winced, gasping for air."

Mel saw the draenei give in and laughed, "Well that wasn't so hard! Now tell me, what is it? I have my note-pad ready right here." She egged on, looking impatient through the projection.
"Alright.. mpph.. first you stop vines from killing your recipe book..." She grunted, her face turning purple.
"Oh right." Mel snapped her fingers, the vines easing up, but keeping a tight grip none the less.

Zeyana quickly paced her breathing and sighed, "Whew, step number one is complete." She breathed easy, the return of oxygen getting the draenei's mind going again. She couldn't quite give Mel the real potion, but she didn't want to die either. The best option she could come up with was handing Mel a bunch of bogus information, recalling random bits of information from each recipe she canned over. And with that, the scheming draenei smiled, "Alrighty, got your pen handy?" Her voice rather chipper, considering.
"I do I do, get on with it, goat!" The impatient Mel prodded with a tap of the foot.
"Alright so what you do is..." [insert random alchemical processes for a good half hour] "Annnd that's it!"
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: Potion Recipe? Sure Thing...

choices: A note appeared on the door, from seemingly nowhere.
Mel sent an Arcane Defender to steal the Potion from her.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
Mel went off to brew the potion, she didn't know much about Alchemy, so it wasn't hard for Zeyana to give her a false recipe. As Mel went off, Zeyana found this would a perfect chance to escape.
With Mel distracted, the grip of the Vines weren't as strong. So Zeyana slowly removed the Vines, and tied them up together so it would be more difficult for the Vine Guardian to catch her.

Zeyana, despite now packing on a few more pounds, still tried her best at stealthily moving from the opposite end of the Greenhouse to the door.
Mel sounded like she was almost complete with the Potion, so Zeyana had to hurry. On her way, she picked a few of the herbs necessary for the actual recipe. She picked each one up with silence and finesse so as to not attract the Vine Guardian.
She reached the final Herb, that was only a few steps away from the exit, when she heard the sound of a faint explosion.

"AAAUGH!" Mel screeched, the sound of fire in the background, "You blue little... HEY! Where'd you go?"
Zeyana laughed as she ripped off the last herb from the pot, "Over here, Poison Oak!" Zeyana taunted.
"Why you little..." Mel growled, as she tried to control the Vine Guardian to move, but it was tied up to the nearby pole. It was immobile!
"Sorry, but I think you're gonna STICK around for a bit longer!" Zeyana quipped, and rushed out the door.
"You won't get away with this, you Goat Demon!" Mel roared, as the Arcane Eye removed itself from the vines and chased after Zeyana.
The Vine Guardian regains it's consciousness, looks around, and sees no other intruders. It submerges itself back into the wildlife, with all threats being seemingly neutralized.

Zeyana made her way into the Kitchen, locking the door behind her. She heard a satisfying THUD of a glass eye ramming itself into the door.
"No! My eye!" Mel screamed, before the eye fell onto the ground, shattered. It seemed that chasing after Zeyana at full speed wasn't such a good idea after all.

Zeyana was back in the Kitchen, but this time it would help her rather than annoy her. Give and Receive.
She began cooking up the potion on a heater, in a large iron cauldron. She followed the ingredients precisely, watching the potion change color ever so slightly, enjoying the variety and excitement.
"Maybe I should become and Alchemist," Zeyana joked with herself.

Finally, the Potion was ready. Zeyana took the Vial, filled it up, and was about to leave the room, when suddenly...
