1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: Mel goes off to brew up her potion...

choices: Course 2 Is Served
[System Malfunction]
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
A note appeared on the door... Zeyana read aloud, "A Magic Oven is the key. Accept it's offerings and you will be free." Her head dropped down, a groan escaping her lips, "Ohhhh come ON!" She shouted, crumbling up the note and throwing it aside, "I don't have time for this crap..." Zeyana mumbled under her breath, fumbling for her key from before. "Hmm.. where'd I put that.." She searched her satchel and belt pouches, scraping at the bottom of every one; no key to be had, "I know it was here somewhere..." The draenei patted down every inch of her clothes and armor, even checking down her cleavage for any sight of the key. "You've got to be kidding..." Her heart sank, she must have dropped the key back in the greenhouse when that beast pulled her down! Zeyana snarled, pulling out her sword, "No more games, house!" She roared, striking at the door- but instead of splinters she was greeted with a magical barrier, deflecting her blow, sending her sword flying out her hands and planting straight in a wooden beam. "House... you're starting to get on my nerves..."

As Zeyana fruitlessly charged into the door over and over with her shoulder, the oven started up it's magic once more. The draenei fell right back into the same trap she fell for the first time, seemingly resting like a bad record player. With a loud weaze, the oven popped out another belch of black smoke, signaling the first trial was to begin. "Zeyana, why did you ever get in this mess?" She shook her head, looking up at the ceiling, the smell of freshly cooked meat taunting her nostrils. "Mreaah, fine! I'll play your stupid game for now, you hunk of junk." The blue skinned woman tossed a pan in frustration, kicking her hoof into the wood floors.

To the oven the pudgy draenei went, as though it were the walk of shame, pulling down the oven door and taking the 5 pound roast out the oven, "First course is served, right?" She bemused, taking her time to sadly cut the meat. though as she took her first bite, the taste was enough to crack a smile on her lips, nod her head up and down a lil and say, "Mmm..." And before long, the draenei was tearing through every last ounce...


A satisfied belch echoed through the Kitchen, Zayena wiping her mouth clean on a nearby napkin. Her stomach lightly distended from the meal. Apparently the hunger potion from before had the adverse effect of permantly stretching her stomach's capacity. "Okay oven, just get it over with and send me your next round of torture!" Zeyana taunted, tapping her hoof impatiently.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: Look Familiar?

choices: Spat out another key, allowing Zeyana to exit.
Acted out similarly to the last course, and produced an equally massive 3rd meal
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
Something wasn't right, however. The Oven began to spew out Black Smoke, but nothing was appearing. It seemed like the machine was going through a ton of stress, trying to push out what it needed to.
"What's going on...?" Zeyana wondered, moving over the the Oven to see what the problem was.
She couldn't see through the choking smoke, so she had to stand back and wait for it to be done with... whatever it was trying to do. It seemed like it was clogged or something...
But then, something began to form through the smoke. It didn't look like a steak, though, as she expected it to be... it looked like something else.
"What on Azeroth is that?" Zeyana wondered, watching as the smoke cleared.
From the Oven, a large hunk of meat was squishing its way out. It looked much more massive than anything Zeyana had seen before, and it was forcing itself through this small Oven.
More of the large steak became visible as she watched the Oven shove it out with all of it's might, and when the entire thing came through, it was nearly twice the size of her standing up!
"You want me to eat THIS?" Zeyana asked, "That's insanity!"
Zeyana took out the Hunger Enhancement Potion, "Unless I..."

"No! This potion has caused me nothing but problems, I can't drink it again! Even if, I'd need to down this whole thing if I wanted to get through this goliath of a steak." Zeyana argued.
Zeyana looked around, hoping she might find an alternate escape route. Another door, a window... But her luck was naught.
"But it doesn't seem like there's any other option..." Zeyana stated dismally.
Since she had no choice, she popped the top off the potion, and downed the entire thing. It reacted poorly in her stomach, causing it to jiggle ceaselessly. She grew hungry, and a ravenous look grew in her eyes.
"Must... Eat..." She slobbered over the giant steak, and then dove in like a hungry dog. She ripped it apart, taking apart large pieces with just her teeth and hands.
Her armor began tightening to the point of pain, and popped off of her naturally, leaving her in her leather clothing beneath. She didn't let this deter her, she wasn't even halfway through the whole steak yet!
It was a juicy, tender steak that didn't require much work to eat through. It was made deliciously perfect, and Zeyana loved its flavor. Thus she ate even more.
Her body, just like before, expanded with fat quickly. The sheer size of the steak would cause anyone to put on a significant amount of weight, but paired with the Hunger Enhancement potion, you've got a recipe for large pounds.

Zeyana finally finished the massive steak after a good hour of eating, and like before, she fell down on her butt, resting against the wall next to the Oven.
She looked down, and was dismayed to see her new, massive body. She was large enough to probably rival Sikana's new girth.
"Please say that was it... I can't handle any more, this is already going to take so long to work off..." Zeyana pleaded.

But the Machine sputtered and coughed, and...
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: [System Malfunction]

choices: Back up the stairs...
Look for another door on the ground floor...
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
To Zayena's personal surprise, the wide open oven spat a key out at her, popping straight into her hands, "How nice of you... you make me eat an entire elekk then give me a key..." She clutched the key, this one was a different color than the one before. But either way, the draenei took her situation for granted. It coulda been much worse, after all. Though the next problem came with the issue of size. Her leather gear was practically painted on, stretching thin to cover her chest and legs, doughy belly having grown the msot and popped off the piece originally covering it. With a grunt, the guardswoman, clutched at the side of the oven, using it to help her stand.

"Wheew, I knew I shouldn't have poked fun at my sister..." Zeyana planted her hands on the meaty hips she now sported, "Karma always..." Turning around to inspect her rear, the draenei wasn't exactly sporting the same tone and slimness she once was, two large doughy cheeks packed tight into her leather leggings, "Comes back to bite you in the ass..." With a frown, Zeyana kicked aside her armored plates, all she was left with now was her shoulderplates, gloves and shin guards, and even then they were on there last straps. "Okay Zeyana, keep your head on straight, it's just a few extra pounds." With a deep breath for composure, she refocused on leaving this accursed kitchen for good. "Alright oven, good riddance!" Zeyana hissed, kicking the side of the thing with a chubby leg. The thing grumbled for a moment before coughing out more smoke-dozens of keys shooting out the front at the draenei in response, "Ooo, ouch! Damn, alright alright, sorry!" She groaned, walking away from the thing before it took her ankles off.

Zayena took a moment to pick up her shield off the ground, her belly doubling over in two distinct rolls as she did, "Can't forget this... or this..." The draenei walked over to the sword skewered pole, pulling back on the hilt till it wedged free, "Ooof..." She clutched the sword in her hand, noting her chubby digit's new grip. And with that, Zayene made her way back to the door, unlocking it with a satisfied "Aaaah" And stepping into the wide open hall, careful not to step over the pile of glass that the arcane eye once animated.

Now, Zayena was still as clueless as when she started. The most she knew, was that Mel knew she was here, and didn't want her seeing whatever was here.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: Finally...

choices: No places to hide! She'd have to do whatever she needs to do in here quick.
A perfect hiding spot! She hid there until the Eye would give up searching.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
Having refilled the Potion, she decided it best she find out what's at the top of the tower. It must be very important, maybe it was this Alchemist's study room!
She waddled up the stairs, the steps creaks became even more dangerously loud due to her new obese body. She had to perservere, as she made her way up the stairs as quickly as she could.
But as she was heading up the stairs, the Arcane Eye from downstairs was beginning to reform. The pieces rattled, and slowly began to inch closer to each other, until they were full once again.
"Oh, once I find that accursed Draenei, I'm gonna give it to her!" Mel roared. She directed the eye to go to the foyer, and fly up the stairs. The most logical place where this Draenei would go.

Zeyana finally reached the Potion and Elixir storage area, and shoved her way through the door. It was small, so it she almost got stuck. But, she managed to get past, and took a moment to catch her breath.
"Whoof... This weight... Is really... Weighing me down..." Zeyana stated ironically.
But there was no time, she heard the sounds of Mel's angry threats, "You fat, blue-hooved pest! I'll find you, you can't hide forever!"
Zeyana needed to hide, but with her weight, she would be difficult to hide, and this time there wasn't a door to slam. She couldn't fight back in this obese state, she had to hide from this Arcane Eye.

She looked around the Storage Area, and found...
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: Back up the stairs...

choices: Test the potion button again!
Take a closer look at the potions, maybe something can help?
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
Zeyana scanned around the room, her eyes darting every which way for -something, anything- that would hide her bulk. She heaved her weight around as best she could, working up a good huf and puff, "Shelves... shelves..." She brushed her fingers against each row of potions, the room surprisingly long. "That eye can't -huff- lift anything.." Zeyana moved through her thought process to eliminate any options, "So anything with a lid... a drape..." So far nada, the boxes she did see were only small crates at best, likely only able to hold a gnome; even that idea stretching the bounds of actuality.

"Mmph, come on come on!" Zeyana raced, her plump tail waggling back and forth behind her, nearly smashing over glass vials and potions. "A cabinet, a trunk... -hurff- anything!" She mumbled under her breath, hearing the fumed taunts call out just an earshot away from the entrance to the room.
"RRaaagh! I'll make you fatter than your bovine of a sister!" Mel called through the arcane eye, "Make you regret the day you learned to walk on two feet... hooves... whatever!" The 'baker' yelled furiously, the magic device buzzing through the air.

The draenei didn't have much time, and if she didn't find something soon, that eye would certainly do... whatever exactly it intended on doing. Zeyana lumbered down the room even quicker, her steps rattling the alchemical vessels clink together subtly. That's when she spotted it! A large pile of packing blankets, laid out on the floor in the corner, looking dusty enough to have not been touched in a good half decade, but it was Zeyana's only option! She made a b-line for the southwest corner of the room, quickly picking up as many as she could and moving them aside, trying to make enough room for her to sit down.

The eye buzzed past the frame of the storage room, only to quickly turn around after realizing it hit it's destination. "Alright porky, where're you now?" Mel hissed, the eye slowly entering the room and scanning the adjacent walls of potions.
Luckily the eye didn't quite excel at hearing, as Zeyana frantically tore the last blanket away and slid down on ground, panting heavily and tossing the dusty blankets right on top of herself, and if she was lucky, her bulk would easily pass as a pile of scarcely used storage precautions. The draenei settled in and hushed herself as best she could, trying to keep deathly still, despite the massive pressure.

Mel's arcane construct slowly rounded every tall stacked shelf of potions, because despite only being broken an hour ago, she had no idea Zeyana packed on so much weight, figuring the girl was chubby at best and could still hide in far more space conscious areas. "Hmmm, are you in here love?" Mel groaned, quickening her eyes pace through the maze of small boxes and glistening potions... checking behind every nook and cranny in search of the draenei who fooled her.

Zeyana just tried her best not to sneeze or breath too hard, as even the slightest movement at the wrong time would surely result in an angry orb of magic prowess. She stayed still, unmoving and silent, despite not hearing or seeing anything for a good long while.

After a good time waiting... and then some... Zeyana was certain the eye had moved somewhere else in search of her. And just as she was about to sneeze and pull off every blanket, she heard Mel's voice ring out, "Baaaah, she's not in here?!" A loud buzzing flying right past her and off in the direction she came in, a sigh of relief pushing past Zeyana's lips.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: Tactical Espionage Action

choices: The Alchemist.
Someone she'd never seen before.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
She decided, with the potion vial filled up, she'd try the button once more.
She lifted herself from the piles of dusty rags, brushing off any debris that fell onto her. She sneezed, the dust tickling her nose.
She took the potion from her bag, and found the empty pedestal where the Hunger Enhancement Potion was to go.
"Well, this better do the trick. Otherwise, this whole tower was a waste of time." Zeyana told herself, as she placed the potion onto the button. The potions all lit up the room in a glorious purple hue. It seemed as if their energy was pointed towards the Engraved Message.
"What's going on?" Zeyana wondered.

But as quickly as she asked, she had her answer. The wall began to spit in two, slowly forming a doorway into a long, dark corridor with a single Torch near the entrance.
"Well that's not ominous." Zeyana said sarcastically. She headed over and grabbed the Torch, this doorway seemed to be much larger than the Storage Room's door, as if it was meant for someone of Zeyana's size. That said, it was much easier for her to make her way through this corridor.

The sounds of her hoofsteps echoed through the long and empty hallway, there didn't seemed to be any visible end to this, but there had to be something.
She kept walking, hoping at some point she'd reach and exit. The corridor was old, moss-filled, and dusty, as if it hadn't been used for many years. But Zeyana hadn't even been on Azeroth for more than a month, this had to have been made by a previous owner.
But that said, what was at the end of this? It seemed strange, and somewhat scared her. Nevertheless, she kept on walking. She didn't want to come back to Stormwind empty-handed after the things she's seen and done.

She kept on waddling down, her weight beginning to be more and more of a burden on her. She tried fanning herself, but she was so tired and sweaty from all the movement.
"You've had years of training on Draenor... Don't let a little weight pull you down..." Zeyana forced herself to keep moving. But she knew that this weight wasn't very 'Little'. She was a whale, an overweight whale. Even the Whales would call her a Whale as an insult.
Zeyana felt discouraged, but still pressed on. Maybe she could find a Weight Loss potion on her way out.

After continuing down the corridor for what felt like hours, she finally found something different. It was a bright light, much more bright than anything she'd ever seen in her life.
She shielded her eyes, but kept walking forward, staggering her way closer and closer....
Her eyes soon became adjusted, and found she was inside a glowing, sparkly room. It reminded her of the Exodar, with many different gems and crystals jutting out of random places, the Draenei architecture. It seemed odd why this Alchemist would keep herself so separated from her heritage.
In the middle of this room was a giant, blue obelisk. Something that Zeyana has never seen in her life, it had many strange markings on it. Zeyana studied them, but had little time to, for she heard the sound of a portal opening.

In case it was danger, Zeyana hid behind the Obelisk, and waited to see what appeared from the Portal. The figure of a humanoid appeared as a silhouette, and was moving closer. Closer and closer, until it was revealed to be...
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: Test the potion button again!

choices: "Allow me to explain..."
"Showing might be easier..."
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
Zeyana squinted, eyeing up the massive cathedral like room; how did it even fit inside the house? Perhaps it was otherworldly magic that made it possible, as the house wasn't all that massive from the outside, and she certainly wasn't going underground... Any way about it, the room looked like it was in pristine condition, and given her people's background, especially on Azeroth, that was a rarity. The hum of the otherworldly draenic technology that Zeyana hadn't seen in who knows how long. It all felt rather homey for the warrior. Her eyes eventually adjusted to the bright light though, her eyes clearing up and growing wide-eyed. So much to look at! The obelisk was at the top of her list however, as even though her people used crystals to power their technology, it didn't look to be of that origin. The hefty draenei looked it up and down as the silhouette appeared, slowly walking towards her. It was definitely female, that much was certain... draenei features...

"Well, I wasn't quite expecting any guests..." The voice eased, a smooth, but heavily accented draenei spoke, "You must've found the way through the traps... falling prey to a few of them as well..." She trailed, clearly looking Zeyana up and down. She still couldn't quite make out all her features though... dark skin... curled horns... short hair... it was all starting to remind her of those photos outside the greenhouse of who she assumed was the home-owner.
"You're the alchemist, I presume?" Zeyana questioned, crossing her arms under her thick bust and squishing her tummy some, "Interesting mix of traps, I'll admit. Patting her stomach for emphasis, "Though the kitchen seemed to be the only problem I ran into with that damned oven." The host's features starting to come into full few, her figure as svelte as they appeared in the pictures, soft facial features, softly glowing silver eyes. "All the riddles meant to keep someone out, huh? I think after all that trouble I'm at least deserving of some sort of explanation." Zeyana reasoned, keeping her eyes on the draenei in case she tried anything.

"Heh, did you enjoy the oven enough for seconds?" She asked with a light tone.
Zeyana huffed, slightly offended, "I'll have you know a murderous psycho was in hot pursuit and your scrap heap of an appliance decided bust on me, alchemist." The blue skinned girl grimaced.
The alchemist shook her head with a smile, "I'm Mehlaa, by the way. No need to use such stiff terms with me." She dismissed with a wave of her hand, "But you should be quite safe here, I assure you." The woman gave a warm smile to give show of her welcoming tone. "But back to your previous inquiry, because after all, you -do- deserve a bit of light on the situation..."
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: Home Owner's Appearance

choices: Agrees, it's a Sacrifice she's willing to make.
Disagrees, she's determined to find another way.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
"It's quite a long story, it'd probably be easier to show rather than tell." Mehlaa stated, directing Zeyana's attention to the Obelisk. It began to open up a small arcane portal, that showed visions of the past, "It all started back when I first began work on my Alchemy Tower in Elwynn..."

The Portal showed Mehlaa using Arcane Elemental's to assist in creating the tower, making the process move by much quicker.
"Keep up the work, Minions! Be sure to follow the blueprint design!" Mehlaa called up to them. She was busy writing down in her Herbalist Journal about the plants she saw around the area.
"Hey, there." Mehlaa heard a voice say behind her, startling her slightly.
She turned to see it was a Night Elf, "Oh, hello. Can I help you?"
"I heard you were a pretty powerful Alchemist." The Elf stated.
"Well, I don't know about powerful, but... Yes, I am an Alchemist." Mehlaa responded humbly.
"Regardless, I'm interested in a special kind of Potion. It's one that might help out at my shop." The Elf explained.
"I'm sorry, if you could come back later, I'm certain I'll be able to help you. Right now I'm pretty busy building my Tower." Mehlaa stated as one of her Arcane Elemental's floated by, rolling it's eyes, "What work...?" The Elemental grumbled angrily.
"Hey, you keep quiet and keep working, Slave." Mehlaa glared at the Elemental, which quickly got back to work.
The Elf giggled slightly, "Heh, well. When you do get the chance, you can come stop by my Bakery in Old Town in Stormwind."
"Of course, what's your name?" Mehlaa asked, but as soon as she did, the Elf was gone. The only thing she had left was a card she left behind, which had the label, "Mel's Bakery".

"The next day," Mehlaa explained, shifting the time portal forward many hours, "I decided I'd find that Elf's bakery. It couldn't be too bad."
The portal showed Mehlaa entering the Bakery door, and the Elf was waiting by the Counter.
"Ah, you finally decided to show up." Mel greeted a bit passive-aggressively.
"Yes, and can we please go by what you want quick? I open up shop in a few hours." Mehlaa responded.
"Of course, this'll only take a second..." Mel stated, and she quickly got out a dusty piece of paper from beneath the counter.
Mehlaa looked at the paper, and it showed what looked like her own personal recipe.
"This is a Hunger Enhancement potion, it's meant to increase the imbuer's stomach capacity and make them very hungry." Mel explained.
"Mel... That is your name, yes?" Mehlaa asked.
"Yeah, what is it?" Mel responded.
"You're obviously no Alchemist, because this Recipe won't make anything but a disgusting beverage." Mehlaa explained truthfully, "But I must say, a Hunger Enhancement potion? That might actually be useful... What do you plan on using it for?"
"Oh, nothing, nothing... This is really just something I was working on. Do you think you could... work on it for me?" Mel asked.
"Well, I could always use new recipes for my collection... Sure, why not? I'll work on it, and come back to you when I've made more progress." Mehlaa agreed.
"Thanks a lot!" Mel exclaimed, "Ooooh, you're the best!"
Mehlaa smiled and nodded, and headed back to her home.

"I did work on that potion," Mehlaa stated, "But I had no idea what her true intentions were. When I completed the Potion, she forced me to be the first Test Subject. I ate so much, I just couldn't stop eating. The potion I made was too powerful, I had a feeling when I made it, it would only be used for bad, and yet... Curse my pride, I had to see if I could do it."
The portal showed Mehlaa stuffing herself full of food, she was way more massive than either Sikana or Zeyana combined.
"So... How'd you escape?" Zeyana asked.
"I didn't. This is just a Mirror Image I cast, I told Mel, that monster, that I'd go grab the Recipe for her, but instead I created this labyrinth within my own home. I intended Mel to go through this trap house, to teach her a lesson, but... I guess you beat her to the punch." Mehlaa explained, "In fact, this is also a trap. I just have to give the word, and the Obelisk will exchange the weight from me to you."
"Well.. please don't do that." Zeyana asked.
"Actually, I think it's our only option now." Mehlaa said.
"WHAT?" Zeyana roared, "No, absolutely not! I don't want to become an obese blob!"
"Look, it won't be permanent! There's someone else in here with me, If you can distract here with the Arcane Eye she summoned here with your immobile flab, we can jump her!" Mehlaa explained. Zeyana had a feeling she was referring to Sikana.
"But... What if something goes wrong?" Zeyana asked.
"Nothing will. I just need you to trust me. Let me transfer the fat of us to you, and when this is all over I'll work on a Weight Loss potion for you." Mehlaa stated.

After much consideration, Zeyana...
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: "Showing might be easier..."

choices: The transfer goes fully as planned
Not... quite what was planned
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
Zeyana muddled through both options... surely their HAD to be another way... but if that monster had Sikana? "Ughh, you don't make the choice easy, Mehlaa..." The blue skinned draenei shook her head, "Part of me wants to find another way, but that sounds a bit stubborn and selfish, right?" She gave a deep groan, "And if I hadn't bullrushed through her, Mel would've come up here and all woulda been done perfectly..." Zeyana shook her head with a low expression, "I suppose for doing all that, I need to take one for the team here." She slowly nodded, looking back up at the mirror image, "But I gotta say, you had me fooled with this mirror." She smiled weakly, knowing now that her only option was to take what the alchemist had to offer, "I'll do it... but only on the condition you can promise me you'll fix this!" She waved her finger resolutely.

The alchemist gave a friendly nod, "Worry not, it's something entirely doable my friend. And you're a Stormwind Guard, no?" She asked, pointing at the ill-fitting shoulder and wrist guards. "You'll be doing good for the people of Stormwind." The dark skinned dranei eased, "As there's the possibility she has even more people under her thumb!"
"You make a good point, Mehlaa. I'd shake your hand, if you weren't a trick of the eyes." Zeyana's doubts were finally dispelled, she'd do what no one else could!... and grow impossibly fat! "And one last thing! My sister is likely the one with you, if anything goes sour, at least make sure she makes it alright." The draenei gave a final set of nods, "Do your thing, Mehlaa!" Zeyana struck a heroic pose, looking up at the ceiling in wait for... the weight.

Mehlaa's mirror image walked to some sort of arcane power console, fiddling with it's knobs and switches, the mirror image tapping away at instruments the guards-woman couldn't see. The portal showing Mehlaa's true form still wide open, giving Zeyana a perfect view of the show about to go down, "Now, do be ready for... quite the jolt..." The alchemist mentioned before typing in the final sequence, a countdown tone slowly ringing out.
Zeyana gulped, "For my sister... and the good of the people..." She winced for a moment, giving a hard gulp as the final 5 digits came ticking down, peaking her eye open to watch the portal, as an instrument from the ceiling folded down, a funnel on the end of it.
"The funnel is just a way to focus all the energy, don't be alarmed and let it do it's thing, Zeyana..." The dark skinned woman warned, her image starting to fade, "Good luck, and watch the portal!" She called, her voice slowly fading away.

The thing in front of her hummed up, glowing pink and purple, fixing just inches from her face. Zeyana did her best to watch on the portal, instead of the arcane thing in front of her. Regardless, the end started to hum to life, the final number sounding off... and with a mechanical buzz, a line of pink light shined right at Zeyana, spreading a hot warmth right over her; still striking that heroic pose as a boost to confidence. The heat spread over every inch of her body, a light layer of sweat on her already porked up frame. The warmth reached it's height, before a new buzz came out, a new line of purple energy spreading over Zeyana, the effects starting to make themselves known almost instantly.

The blue skinned woman felt a growing sensation, but kept her eyes glued on the portal, seeing Mehlaa's frame slowly but surely start to melt away...
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: This Weight is Mine Alone to Bear...

choices: Mehlaa searched the many doors, and eventually found Sikana.
Mehlaa heard the sounds of Footsteps, and had to hide somewhere.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
"It's working! Oh, my, I was afraid for a minute. I never got a chance to test this old thing!" Mehlaa stated, watching her body melt off the weight.
Zeyana was growing larger, her weight increasing every second. She didn't enjoy it, but she'd have to face this to save everyone, "How much longer...?" Zeyana asked, sitting on her now immense rump.
"I'm still pretty large, and we still need to account for the other Draenei in here..." Mehlaa explained.
"You mean Sikana?" Zeyana asked.
"Wait, you know her?" Mehlaa asked.
"Yes... She's my sister. She got caught up in this nonsense to begin with, and it doesn't make it any better that she had a Eating Problem." Zeyana explained, but then laughed, "This might at least keep her from eating so much... Hopefully."
"I'm so sorry, Zeyana. Once I reach my thin self, I'll search for your friend, and then you'll have to be the siphon for her weight as well." Mehlaa stated.
"I understand. I just hope I don't outgrow this place, it'd be social suicide for me to be seen in public like... this!" Zeyana pouted, slapping her now massive fat-filled belly. Zeyana was now easily twice the size she was earlier, and wasn't even halfway done with the transfer.
"Don't worry, Zeyana. I know it seems bleak, but I'll get us through this without any unwanted pounds." Mehlaa stated.

After a while, Zeyana was a quarter the size of the room she was in, but wasn't overflowing or breaking anything. Her belly was very squishy, and could fit an entire Ettin, if it were sitting down. Her butt, each cheek was the size of Mehlaa. But the good news is that Mehlaa returned to her normal weight.
"Ah, thank you very much, Zeyana!" Mehlaa's projection bowed.
"Yeah, whatever... Just find Sikana and then stop Mel!" Zeyana yelled down, her head on top of a mountain of fat.
Mehlaa nodded, and the image began to fade.
"Don't worry about the Eye, Zeyana!" Mehlaa stated, "She'll never find this place, trust me!"
Zeyana nodded, as Mehlaa's Image faded entirely, leaving Zeyana alone.

Mehlaa woke up from her slumber, back against a cold, iron wall.
"Good job, Arcane Me!" Mehlaa smiled, picking herself up. Thankfully, the chains were meant to fit her fat body, and slipped right off her. But now it was time to search for Sikana's chamber, it couldn't be too hard. Mel couldn't have that many races locked up, right?
She pulled out her hairpin, and used it to unlock the door. She went through, and saw she was only one of many races Mel had locked up!
"How could she do this...?" Mehlaa wondered, looking at the rows and rows of similar looking doors, only labeled by different races and gender.
But when she looked inside some of them, she saw that they were empty. Obviously, Mel was planning on taking this operation farther. She saw that her Cell was unique, as it was labeled "FIRST SUBJECT".
"The first, and the last, Mel..." Mehlaa stated dramatically.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: The transfer goes fully as planned

choices: Mehlaa starts the transfer
Mehlaa's interrupted!
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
Mehlaa glanced at each label, not even looking inside any of the doors, as she didn't want to see what had befallen anyone, if they were even in there. She promised Zeyana to find her sister! She wasn't one to give up on at least that, so she ran straight for the door labeled, "Female Draenei..." Mehlaa read aloud, sliding back the peephole slide to look in. She wasn't exactly sure what she'd find, but the room was certainly dark and vast, lavish draenic carpets and decorations. "Mel themed the rooms...?" Mehlaa felt a shiver down her spine upon realization that it was likely the same story for all the other rooms, save hers. She couldn't see the entire interior of the room, but couldn't see Sikana either, forcing her to have to go inside. The alchemist pulled the deadbolts back and unhinged the chain locks, "She really doesn't want her coming out of this one..." She grumbled, fiddling with all the restraints; the more she looked at Sikana's room and precautions, it became obvious that Mel had been upgrading the newer cells while they were still thin enough to possibly escape, while Mehlaa was already too fat to even move in her previous living situation.

After a good few minutes undoing all the locks, the draenei could finally open the door, pulling back with all her strength on the heavy iron door. "Grraahhh..." She grunted, finally able to wedge it open far enough to slip past. The mage was feeling her mana start to slowly flow back, snapping her fingers to conjure up a flame bright enough to at least light the vicinity, giving her a more clear look at the room itself. It appeared to be a stone, prison-like room, just decorated with tacky draenic furniture and rugs. Any real draenei could tell it was just cliche. From the back of the room however, Mehlaa heard a faint munching, "Sikana, is that you? I'm here to bust us outta here!" The alchemist hissed, "Your sister is helping us!" She called, walking down a while longer till she found the source...

Sikana was in fact in the cell, though looking quite tubby. Sitting on a mount of draenic silk pillows, large tray of sweets stacked up high beside her, the draenei eating away as though she didn't have a choice, "Sikana, it is you, right? Your sister didn't exactly give me the perfect description..." The mumbled, looking up and down the draenei's form with wide eyes. She wasn't as fat as Mehlaa was, but if she could guess, the girl wasn't looking like she was going to start a sprint any time soon...
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: Prison Break

choices: Follow Mehlaa's plot to stop Mel.
Stick with Zeyana keeping Sikana stuffed with food so she wouldn't talk.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
She reopened the link between her and Zeyana, and saw that Zeyana had fallen asleep.
"Hey, wake up!" Mehlaa roared, trying to keep her up.
"zzz.. Huh, what? Oh, about time you came here! How's my sis doing?" Zeyana asked.
"Pretty good, she's not even half as large as I was, so it won't be too bad for you." Mehlaa explained.
"Well, get it over with. I want to be thin again!" Zeyana demanded.
Mehlaa nodded, and began the transfer once more...

Zeyana felt a small growth as the transfer commenced, but she barely added any weight to her already massive figure. But, internally, it would still be a ton to work off.
"Alright, we're done! Let's go find Mel and stop her!" Mehlaa announced.
"But... I must eat... More..." Sikana said, in a trancelike state.
"What? Oh no... Mel must have her under some kind of Mind Control!" Mehlaa stated, "She can't think about anything other than eating!"
"Eat... Eat..." Sikana repeated, she began eating the food again, causing her body to once again bloat up in weight. Mel must have a new way of fattening up subjects, and is no longer in need of her potion.
"Alright, I guess I'm going at this alone. Mel may be a monster, but she's not fighter. If I get my chance, I might be able to jump and attack her." Mehlaa explained.
"But what about Sikana?" Zeyana asked, "If she's under her control, she might blab about you escaping!"
"That's where you come in, Zeyana. I need you to distract anyone who comes in here from Sikana, and make sure Sikana keeps on stuffing her mouth. Understood?" Mehlaa asked.
"So you want me to ENCOURAGE her to eat more?? How, even?" Zeyana asked.
"It's our only option. I'll keep the link between here and my tower open, and you just need to act as a voice in her head pushing her to eat even more to keep her mouth shut. Don't worry, I won't be gone for more than an hour. She probably won't gain that much while I'm off." Mehlaa stated.
"Alright... just be careful!" Zeyana said, and was responded by Mehlaa's wink and smile.
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.title: Mehlaa starts the transfer

choices: Return to Mehlaa as she searches for Mel
Keep with Zeyana as she attempts to keep her sister from talking
1151212221112112221221221222121212121112.content:
Zeyana gulped, watching her sister be enthralled by whatever it was Mel did to her, "Just take that monster down, yeah? I don't want to have gained all this, made my sister grow, AND leave Mel around to do this to more people..." The guards-woman sighed, watching Mehlaa run back the way she came and close the door behind her. Whatever her plan was, it had better work... Because the feeling of the added weight was already starting to bear on her, and if it wasn't gone relatively soon, she wasn't going to be happy. However, her attention was brought back to her sister, Sikana. She was still thin (thinner than she'd ever been, truth be told), but Zeyana wasn't sure what exactly Mel did to her. She looked a bit absent, as though she wasn't really there, hypnotized, mind-controlled, whatever it was, it wasn't good.

Sikana munched on a massive slice of cake, shaking her head slowly, "Must... tell... Mellll..." She groaned, whatever had tricked her was compelling the draenei to report the intruder.
"No no, Sik. You need to stay!" Zeyana quickly spat, trying to ease her sister into sitting back down, "Just take a seat and relax, okay?" She tried to keep her voice low and easy, but it was a bit hard seeing her sister in such a condition.
Sikana didn't really slow down however, "Mrpph... intruders!" She groaned, her eyes glazing over.
Zeyana's mind bounced all over, how could she keep her in one place? "If you leave, you won't have anymore food to eat!" She called, watching her sister stop to think about it for a moment, swallowing what was left of the massive slice of cake.
"Food?" She questioned with a tilt of the head, "I can't eat if I go out there..." She reasoned, slowly returning back to the pile of pillows, ploping back down on her backside and grabbing another slice.
"Good!" Zeyana reassured, "How is it, hmm? It looks pretty tasty!" The draenei tried to sound as calm as possible. Plus, if she were being honest, that cake did look pretty damned good. "Chocolate, yeah?" Zeyana licked her lips, looking up and down the cake through the portal.

"Mmmm... It's good." Sikana manged, scarfing down a few big bites, one hand reaching down to massage her rounding middle, "Chocolate with strawberry *urp* filling..." Sikana stifled a belch, taking no tiem to return to her treat.
Zeyana bit her cheek, "Good! Just keep on eating in then, yeah?" She had to do her best to encourage Sikana to eat, by the looks of it, she'd get up and run if her mind ever snapped out of a full food focused mentality. 12521.content:
Tava Smallhoof was something of a midget in terms of tauren size. Okay, maybe it wasn't that bad, she wasn't three feet tall or anything, but everyone had to admit that compared to a typical female cowgirl she was on the tiny side.

Despite constant attempts at binge eating and twenty different kinds of diets, Tava still remained thin as a stick. She didn't even have much in the way of breasts, let alone hips or thighs. To top it all off, she stood a good foot or so shorter than most of the ladies of Thunderbluff, making it hard to pick her out in a crowd. No one really made fun of her for her appearance, after all any tauren was considered a gift from the Earthmother, but she still couldn't help but feel neglected somewhat.

While at her age most tauren girls looked into getting married and bearing a calf or two for the tribe, Tava spent most of her time focused on her calling as a shaman. No young bull would be interested in a malnourished girl like her, the promise of an heir would be too slim as Tava's body certainly wasn't built for bearing children. So there she was, stuck as a novice shaman studying in the Spirit Rise in hopes that one day she might become skilled enough to go adventuring.

"Hey Smalls!"

Tava grunted, opening her eyes from her attempts at meditation. "Hello Sarga..."

Sarga, who was standing in front of her, grinned like a maniac. Tava held back a glare but stared at the brown cowgirl with a look of envy. If there ever was a polar opposite to Tava, it would most certainly be Sarga. She stood slightly taller than most of the other girls, and was big and busty to boot. More than once she found herself on the other end of a proposal from a hopeful bull, all of which had been turned down so far. For some stupid reason, Sarga decided to also focus on her path as a shaman, much to Tava's annoyance.

"What'cha doing?" Sarga asked, with a bubbly tone that was absolutely sickening to hear.

"Mediating...Or trying too anyway."

"Oh? Can I join you then?"

She always tried to do this to Tava. She always tried to get chummy around her, but Tava wanted nothing to do with her. "No, I think I'm done for today. I'm going home."

"Then let me walk with you!"

"I'll be stopping to a do a few chores though..."

"I'll do them with you then!"

"Just...Just no, okay? I need to be alone."

Tava stomped off in a hurry before Sarga could give another dimwitted reply. These attempts at being friends, coupled with that revoltingly sweet bubbly attitude, annoyed Tava to no end. Why couldn't she just leave her alone? Why was she even trying to be friends with someone like Tava? And most importantly, why was Tava so jealous of her?

As she walked along the outer rim of Thunderbluff, the sun setting in the distance over the orange Barrens, Tava pondered and pondered why Sarga bugged her so much.

"It's not like she isn't friendly to me...But why doesn't she just leave me alone? Why do I hate her so much?"

Walking past a small puddle from recent rain fall, Tava paused and took a deep long look in the reflection. A scrawny and sad looking black furred tauren looked back at her. Tava tried to envision the reflection with a few more added pounds, particularly in the chest and legs.

"I hate being so tiny...I wish...I wish I was as big as Sarga. No, bigger. That way maybe she'd just leave me alone..."

Tava kicked a few rocks at the puddle before moving on back to her home. She had another long day of training again tomorrow with her and Sarga's master, she'd need her rest if she was going to put up with Sarga all day.

But in the distance, hovering near the horizon but just in hearing range, was a wisp of cloud of an unusual blue color. It slowly followed Tava's shadow, almost like it was watching her. A voice that boomed like thunder spoke softly enough that no one would hear it.

"A possible beneficiary, envious too. How quaint. Just the shaman I've sought, perhaps I shall pay her a visit in the eve..."

The next day Tava woke up...
